Job Description:
Booking.com
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.
In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.
Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.
We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
We are IT Services
Do you want to own IT Services that have a positive impact on the entire workforce? Working with some of the latest technologies and global deployment challenges? Well, we are looking for a talented IT Support Technician to join our IT Services department in Amsterdam.
In IT Services, we design, build and maintain all the corporate technology our Booking.com workforce needs day-to-day, so they can in-turn deliver great products to our customers.
This includes, for instance; SaaS applications, Identity, SSO, collaboration tools, productivity suites, communication platforms, endpoints, laptops, VDI solutions, video conferencing, voice infrastructure, Wi-Fi connectivity, VPN, ITSM and a plethora of other bespoke developed applications.
Booking’s IT Services organization is seeking a sharp, talented and energetic IT Support Team Lead to assist and enable our workforce, including providing excellent user support, analyzing and addressing IT related problems and looking for solutions to automate or improve our processes.
  Junior Endpoints Engineer
The Booking employee base is diverse and globally dispersed, therefore we rely on different technologies in order to achieve our goals. In order to provide our colleagues with the best in class, secure and compliant working capabilities, we need to make sure all corporate endpoint devices are properly managed.
The Junior Endpoints Engineer helps to maintain and administer the systems that manage our global fleet, containing thousands of user endpoints. 
Working as part of the Endpoints team, this role is responsible for helping to deliver a compliant and frictionless experience to our colleagues devices, following the processes and guidance provided by senior team members and industry standards.
B.responsible
Delivers a capable level of problem solving and troubleshooting for devices and management systems, flagging any opportunities for improvements.
Adheres to Technology processes, best practises, change management and incident handling. Keeping any related documentation updated and accurate.
Assists in maintaining the systems that manage end user devices such as laptops, corporate mobile phones, corporate tablets, etc. Aims to improve system reliability, scalability and reduce the need for human intervention.
Acts as an intermediary between IT Support and Endpoints team to resolve escalations and empower IT Support where possible.
Uses a variety of dashboards and alerts to actively monitor the endpoint environment, quickly picking up, resolving and escalating any anomalies found.
Ensures endpoints inventory data is accurate and up-to-date, all devices are traceable, correct device ownership information exists and inventory state changes are captured according to the predefined endpoints lifecycle.
Understands that different personas exist within the organisation in order to achieve a frictionless user experience.
Communicates effectively within the endpoint team and can bring ideas to team discussions. 
Keeps up to date with Endpoint technologies and is ambitious to learn and absorb knowledge, including building relationships with IT Services and wider teams.
Participates in on-call rotation and out of hours maintenance where required.
  B.skilled
Confident in supporting desktop hardware and peripherals across a variety of devices.
Strong knowledge and working experience of configuration, support and failure analysis of Windows and Apple operating systems.
Good understanding of a Windows domain, DNS, DHCP, Active Directory and Microsoft OfficeUnderstanding of enterprise endpoint management software.
Understanding of infrastructure-related technologies like hardware, virtualization, networking.
Entry level scripting E.G. PowerShell, AppleScript, Bash, Perl, Python.
Understanding of deployments across hundreds of user endpoints.
Experience with package management solutions.
Understanding of Asset Management and Inventory tooling to accurately track the current endpoint real estate.
Nice to have experience of MDM management and solutions.
Mac:
Understanding for maintaining JAMF or similar enterprise Mac fleet management solutions.
Experience administering MacOS in an enterprise environment.
Capable troubleshooting MacOS, resolving incidents and clearly documenting resolutions.
Windows:
Understanding of VDI solutions E.G. Azure Windows Virtual Desktop, AWS Workspaces.
Experience working with ConfigMgr (SCCM) and desktop deployments in an enterprise environment.
Experience with cloud services, specifically EMS and Microsoft's Intune.
Experience rolling out and managing systems at scale.
Experience with Windows administration in an enterprise environment E.G. AD, DHCP, DNS, SQL Server.
Linux - Bonus:
Experience managing end user Linux devices for an enterprise.
Ability to maintain company supported Linux distributions.
Experience on CentOS/Ubuntu distributions.
B.offered
Living and working in a Booking Office
Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture
Opportunity to utilise technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working for Booking.com
Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
We’re looking for a UX Copywriter to join our writing team in Marketing, supporting our Business Travel department. We’re a close-knit writing community made up of around 15 writers (both Creative Copywriters and UX Writers) who collaborate across products and integrated marketing campaigns. Our goal is to deliver a seamless digital experience for our customers through one voice that builds trust and engagement with our brand and enhances the platform experience for all of our users. 
UX Copywriters in Marketing are embedded in product teams and work alongside designers, developers, researchers, and product managers. This position offers the successful candidate the autonomy to create, test and scale. As the UX Copywriter for Business Travel you’ll be our writing team’s go-to B2B expert. You’ll conceptualise and write compelling copy for B2B communications designed to inform, engage and inspire different audiences with a focus on our US Business Customers.  
Your skills range from short-form copy and persuasion to SEO and marketing communications.  You’ll write copy for chatbots, product features, or online and offline B2B marketing campaigns. 
You’ll test your own hypotheses, examine detailed metrics, and use data to decide your next steps. Almost everything you write will be translated into 44 different languages and dialects, so you’ll also be a key point of contact for a large team of language specialists.
  B.Responsibilities 
Perform competitor keyword analyses in order to understand demand and write content to meet customer needs
Send copy to Language Specialists with sufficient context (conceptual and visual) for translating your ideas to a local audience
Collaborate with other copywriters to ensure copy is consistent across all channels
Create copy-driven experiments to support product goals and your own copy strategy
Use qualitative data, quantitative data and key metrics to measure the impact of your copy and transform those insights into new iterations
B.Skilled
As a candidate for UX Copywriter in Business Travel, you possess a broad range of abilities:
You are experienced in B2B communications. 
You have a native level fluency in English
You have a portfolio that can demonstrate both your creative writing skills and your knowledge of UX 
You are a passionate advocate for the user, dedicated to the craft of writing and creating elegant user experiences
You are comfortable with each part of the writing process – from brainstorming and researching to shipping products and iterating
You write copy that is intuitive, future proof and scalable
You have a ‘can-do’ attitude and work well independently and in a team
You are self-driven and take full ownership of your ideas to solve challenging problems in a rapidly changing environment
You welcome feedback and critique, responding with creative thinking and iterations
You enjoy working with people of diverse backgrounds, cultures and disciplines
You have excellent communication skills and an eye for detail 
You are able to strategically prioritize multiple projects and stakeholders at once
  B.Experienced
At least 3 years of experience in online copywriting with an emphasis on Marketing and B2B communications
Experience with writing for customers and optimising for metrics
A/B testing and knowledge of experimentation techniques 
Experience with user testing and shipping new products and features
  Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive. 
Please apply via our website with your English CV and link your portfolio or writing samples in the CV. We are looking forward to hearing from you!

About the company
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. 
In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more. 
Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.
We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready. 
  Booking.com core values
  Think customer first
  Succeed together
  Own It
  Learn Forever
  Do the Right Thing
About the team
Booking.com Insurance is the easiest way to protect your trip and travel with peace of mind.
As part of our Connected Trip vision, Booking.com has ambitious growth plans for the insurance business as it looks to develop a global footprint of insurance product offerings across the Group. 
Through innovation, industry sector knowledge and clear customer focus, the team’s challenge is to substantially enhance the group’s customer Insurance experience and drive a profitable account. 
Working in collaboration with leading industry partners, our insurance products are designed to give customers assurance they have the protection they need to allow them to relax and enjoy the trip -  great value cover backed by a first class experience should they need to make a claim.
About the Role
A key step towards achieving these goals is the delivery of a new suite of claims handling & policy admin tools that will enable our Insurance teams to offer a top quality claims service across the growing range of insurance products. 
The Technical Product Manager & their product team will be working within our existing Insurance Platform on new capabilities to interpret policy data, enable customer self service for policy amendments and renewal requests, integrate with third party claims handling services & underwriting partners and develop a comprehensive suite of operational,  commercial and regulatory reporting capabilities. 
The initial focus for this team will be developing the full range of Policy Amendment capabilities to support our recently launched Room Cancellation and Single Trip Travel insurance products. This team will also play a critical role in the development of future annual insurance products where our Policy Administration will need to extend to manage the full policy lifecycle including renewals. 
To drive this evolution we are looking for a highly motivated Technical Product Manager who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and lives to delight the customer. 
You’ll actively drive the product strategy for the product area, delivering product excellence and innovation working closely with your product team and with external systems partners. 
We expect you’ll be deeply committed to solving user pain points and identifying opportunities to improve their experience. 
You will put data at the heart of how you design, develop and implement product solutions that address clear user needs and are aligned to the company's vision and strategy.
Part of the Trips Business Unit of Booking.com based in Manchester, this role sits within our Insurance Product Group.
This is primarily an individual contributor role, where it is possible to coach and mentor others depending on skills, experience, development plans and business needs.
As part of a growing tech company, high performers can expect extensive opportunities for progression and development. 
Responsibilities:
To successfully deliver innovative products in a fast-paced working environment you will need to:
Develop a deep understanding of current and future customer needs in respect of insurance cover and the supporting claims experience.
Gather data & insight from the insurance market, our sales funnel, competitors and our CS & claims teams to identify and inform prioritisation of product opportunities 
Work with the Senior Product Manager and key stakeholders to define the overall vision, strategy and roadmap for your insurance product line
Maintain a strong focus on monitoring and measurement of your product to inform our commercial relationship with our insurance partners
Ensure your team are developing products in accordance with all relevant insurance regulatory and compliance guidelines 
Address any regulatory or compliance risks identified with your product, adapting to new legislation and regulatory changes by the required deadlines.
Complete all necessary insurance refresher training and CPD as per IDD guidelines 
Work collaboratively with a team of developers, designers and testers to deliver products that delight our customers
Be accountable for the end-to-end delivery of your product
Ensure the team has well defined epics & stories, aligned to Objectives and Key Results 
Write, review and take responsibility for clear, concise and comprehensive technical documentation.
Adhere to the default principles for architecture, quality and non-functional requirements
Work with agile coaches and your team to drive continuous efficiency improvements and  better ways of working 
Communicate with multiple key stakeholders to keep them up to date and bought into your product development
Your skills and experience:
You will be working with our product teams, architects and principals to shape the future of our core Insurance platforms.  We expect you to have strong analytical skills, understand technology and be able to collaborate with stakeholders across the organisation. 
3-5 years experience working as a Product Manager in an insurance or other regulated product environment
Understand and enjoy the challenges of working within the financial services regulatory ecosystem
Robust business analysis skills, techniques including writing user stories, acceptance criteria and documenting technical requirements.
Experience completing excellent product discovery.
Proficient in working within an Agile product-based organisation.
Solid experience of modelling system workflows, components and data models.
Solid experience of running workshops.
Experience communicating concepts and ideas to stakeholders at all levels within organisations.
Confident personality to influence decision-making at all levels within an organisation.
Ability to simplify complex problems into component parts and evaluate systematically.
Evidence of problem solving and providing creative solutions.
 Desirable Skills: 
Experience of working on policy administration, claims and / or CS systems.
Experience of working with external systems providers and technical partners.
Experience of working with data and SQL.
Understanding of monitoring and analytical tools such as Kibana and Grafana.
Benefits
25 vacation days (rising to 28) to go exploring
Generous accommodation discount, so you can explore for less
Bonus package
Pension with up to 10% matched company contribution
Huge learning and development platform tailored to you
Shopping and leisure discounts through Perkbox
Interest-free travel loans/discounted car parking
Competitive maternity/paternity/adoption leave
Flexible working, including working from home

Account Executive - Bristol
This is a full time position based in our amazing Manchester Office!
  The Company

It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
Do you enjoy taking ownership and being responsible for your own internal business portfolio? Do you thrive in building strong relationships over the phone? Can you help Booking.com’s partners grow their business by providing them with analysis, growth opportunities and new products and services? If your answer is “yes”, you might have what it takes to be the next Account Executive at our Manchester office!

What you’ll be doing:
Pro-active communication with partners in your region by telephone and by internal messaging to assist with the development of Booking.com’s business
Responsible for a portfolio of partners where you are the first point of contact, answering questions and following up when needed
Responsible for maintaining a stable relationship with the accommodation partners (i.e. frequent performance calls and contact to ensure they offer Booking.com’s customers the best availability and competitive pricing)
Be knowledgeable on Booking.com’s products so that their benefits and usage can be explained to Partners
Identify opportunities for partners that will help improve Booking.com’s business by using its internal segmentation to prioritise
Help identifying new potential partner leads and pass these leads on for further follow up
Responsible for taking Customer Service escalations which relate to their managed portfolio and solving these in the most efficient manner for the business, partner and customer
Support the organisation of events, such as workshops and webinars, for partners. Also expected to attend and participate in the partner events for their managed portfolio
  What you’ll bring:
Strong and engaging communication skills
Solution oriented and results driven
Ability to influence partners over the phone to implement suggestions;
Strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful
Proactive, flexible and capable of working independently as well as working in a team
Ability to prioritise own workload and efficiently manage their time
Eye for accuracy and ability to be analytical
Language: English written and verbal
  In return, we’ll provide:
A performance-based company with competitive salary and bonuses
A great platform for learning and development
The opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds from all over the planet
Please submit your CV and motivation letter in English.

Our brand new FinTech business unit – with teams in Amsterdam and Shanghai – develops new products and drives innovation to help us continue removing financial friction from the travel  process. That makes buying and selling travel-related products and services simpler for both travellers and partners.
Creating payment experiences is a big responsibility and a big challenge, but we have a real opportunity to have a true impact on our travellers, solve real problems and enable them to experience the world better. From offering unique payment timings to solving customers FX problems we focus on excelling in the basics but constantly innovating at the same time. 
Being the internal payment provider for the different verticals in booking.com is a big task to accomplish and we have a responsibility and desire to offer the best service level to those verticals as you would expect when working with a global leader in the payment industry to allow them to utilize payments as a means to grow their business.  
The client management team optimizes the way we manage and provide services and solutions to our internal clients. The client managers will work alongside solution engineers, product managers, Development teams, Partnerships managers and more, to translate the needs of a client to solutions on the payment side and help them to grow and optimize their user experience. 
What you’ll be doing:
Knows how to become our clients trusted advisor, understanding their needs, but also challenging them when appropriate.
Collaborate with the rest of the FinTech department and beyond to translate client feedback into our product roadmap and help optimise our product solutions and expand them.
Be proactive in reaching out to clients to make sure they are utilising the FinTech BU solutions at its full potential.
Identify clients that may need an upgrade or downgrade of existing solutions and work with tech teams and product managers to resolve the situation.
Perform and report on Client performance analyses to track feature adoption and recommend strategies to improve adoption/Metrics when needed.
Arrange integration testing and UAT (internal and external).
Defining a clear strategy for onboarding and supporting clients with new product roll outs.
Be accountable to drive high usage of payments solutions within clients, by driving the creation and execution of a thorough and action-oriented adoption plan.
Demonstrate advanced insights and understanding of clients business/industry and challenge appropriately the way a client views both their business and processes (in relation to payments)
Create value for clients by ensuring they clearly define business outcomes and then build a “success plan” with the appropriately identified objectives, stakeholders, milestones, risks and metrics needed to achieve them.
Leverage payment industry knowledge and deep functional expertise to expand the clients utilisation of innovation around payments
Put simply, your focus is Customer Success = Payments Success = Booking.com Success
Daily point of contact for key stakeholders (PMM, EM, PM, Solution Partners, Data Providers and internal teams or tracks) for escalations of incidents related with the existing integration
What you’ll bring:
You are an opportunity magnet and can identify and implement up-selling additional services at every opportunity and you are willing to obtain feedback from customers regarding potential product enhancements and new service opportunities.
You’re fluent in persuasion and always strive to achieve and surpass set objectives
You demonstrate an interest in in-depth research of your customers, identify key aspects of their business and have the ability to innovate to create business incrementality.
Be the voice of the client and the driving force behind product innovation and business optimizations from in-depth product and market understanding
Ability to map the customer’s business process to product capability
You have at least 3 years experience working with managing clients in a Payments and/or financial transactions environment, ideally in an online global marketplace
You are Data-driven and base your decisions on facts rather than opinions
Experience in running governance of complex deployment and usage projects within large organizations
You have experience with working with a large variety of internal stakeholders, including marketing, legal, compliance, finance and other product areas
Top-notch executive engagement skills with an ability to establish trusted advisor relationships with business decision makers
Deep passion for making others successful
Experience in running governance of complex deployment and usage projects within large organizations
Top-notch executive engagement skills with an ability to establish trusted advisor relationships with business decision makers
In return, we’ll provide:
The Client Manager, FinTech position is open to worldwide candidates. We provide assistance to you and your family with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated 300+ technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year.
Headquarters located in one of the most vibrant cities in Europe: Amsterdam;
Performance based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential;
Trainings, regular hackathons and opportunities to travel and attend global conferences, when travel resumes;
Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits;
Company sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture;
Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world.
Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

Booking.com is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists. You will be working with stakeholders throughout the company to generate understanding, strategy and suggest actions based on data. If you consider yourself to be that unique hybrid of data hacker, business analyst, communicator and mentor that maintains a strong customer focus and values pragmatism over perfection, then we’d like to hear from you.
There are several data science teams within Booking.com each consisting of 3-8 people. All of these teams have their own scope within the business; we have Data Scientists focusing on the front end of our website, content of the pages, demands of our products, customer satisfaction and loyalty. Every team takes full responsibility for all data analysis within their area; however there is also considerable collaboration amongst teams. We often align on business goals, learn from each other and socialise after work almost every Friday.
B.responsible
Transform large, complex data sets into pragmatic, actionable insights.  
Leverage data to identify, quantify and influence tangible business gain.
Ability to see beyond the numbers, be the voice of data when communicating to decision makers, product owners and team leaders.
Have the capacity to thrive in our fast-paced environment, adapt quickly and take ownership of your work.
Challenge ideas and methods while working together with talented, highly skilled team members.
Contribute to the growth of Booking.com through interviewing, on-boarding, or other recruitment efforts
B.skilled
Minimum 3 years of experience in a relevant role
Experience solving real problems using data mining techniques and with statistical rigour
Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, bioinformatics, etc.)
Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics and programming. Strong working knowledge of, Python, Hadoop, SQL, and/or R.
Excellent communication skills; the ability to convey complex analysis results clearly and with conviction to all levels of stakeholders
B.offered
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits.  IT also has regular hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.
This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.  We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.

The Trips Data team at Booking.com looks after data for everything but the stay at Booking.com.  This includes data platforms, data governance & quality, data warehousing, data enablement, data enrichment,  enabling teams across the organisation to use data to understand and manage our business performance and improve the experience of our customers.
We are looking for an enthusiastic and resilient Group Product Manager to join our Data Leadership to work with key stakeholders to lead the Data Enablement team across Trips data.  
About the Role 
You will take a senior role in leading our data strategy with the rest of the data leadership  and  take full ownership of planning, resourcing, defining the roadmap and future data products and services landscape for Data Enablement for Trips Data.  As an expert in data, you will  leverage your strength and experience in delivering data solutions to inspire and lead multiple cross-functional data product teams, whilst managing a team of Data Product Managers.
We are looking for someone passionate about driving benefit through provision of reliable, accurate, governed data solutions to data consumers to enable insight and data driven decision making.  Who can lead a high performing team in creating great data products  that enhance and synergise our understanding of Trips customers and their needs across the business.
This is a managerial role where it is possible to learn and be mentored by others to learn the skills, acquire the experience, and grow through a development plan to become an expert  leader in data product management.  
Responsibilities: 
To successfully deliver change in a fast paced working environment you will need to:
Own, design, develop and implement data product roadmaps and strategy based on user needs and the company's product & technology strategy and vision.  Influence decision making at all levels. 
Accountable for the end-to-end delivery of data products within your portfolio
Develop a deep understanding of the current and future customer data needs and pain-points across all areas of the business and translate them into data solutions.
Responsible for collaboration and strategic alignment across verticals.
Prioritise and communicate initiatives with key stakeholders on a regular basis to ensure that all projects and existing functionality are moving towards our defined OKRs.  
Manage a team of Data Product Managers to collect, understand, and communicate the business data requirements for Products and Services and translating them into well defined epics, user stories and acceptance criteria.
Gather, analyse, and report on data usage, quality, data flows to benchmark and measure the performance of the product.
Ensure that the appropriate solution and data  governance, compliance and resilience is built into solutions
Contribute to the evolution of principles and best-practice for data management, data governance, architecture, quality
Coach and develop the team by setting objectives, development plans and providing regular feedback.
Your skills and experience
Have strong experience in understanding data requirements and leading a team  to deliver data solutions for user consumption in an ecommerce or travel related field
Have great organisational skills, able to manage and deliver complex data products and projects simultaneously and are able to flex when plans change
Rich experience of creating data pipelines, improving data workflows, components and data models - working closely with engineers and architects to design and deliver scalable data solutions
Expert Problem Solver - Ability to identify and analyse complex issues, problems or opportunities to achieve effective solutions, by applying structured thinking and breaking them down into component parts to form a logical train of thought that can be easily followed and understood by others.
Expert communication skills - be able to communicate with the business at all levels and across disciplines - data specific, technical and non-technical.   Being able to write clear and concise product goals, requirements, status updates and product results.
Strong stakeholder management, collaboration and influencing skills - able to bring diverse stakeholders together to agree and move forward with an approach or plan.
Proficient in working within an Agile product-based organisation with good organisational and project management skills.
Be highly analytical and methodical in your approach to problem solving and recommend effective action plans to resolve issues.  Having a track record in developing methodologies to measure the delivery of data products that drive better decisions and understanding
You must have a clear sense of ownership and deliver and maintain the highest quality across the solutions you produce
Desirable Skills: 
Understanding of data management principles, including data governance, quality and architecture
Experience in delivering managing tools to enhance data capabilities
Experience in data technologies such as Hadoop, AWS, Kafka, SQL Server, Snowflake, Collibra
Benefits
25 vacation days (rising to 28) to go exploring
Generous accommodation discount, so you can explore for less
Bonus package 
Pension with up to 10% matched company contribution
Huge learning and development platform tailored to you
Shopping and leisure discounts through Perkbox
Interest free travel loans/discounted car parking
Competitive maternity/paternity/adoption leave
Flexible / Hybrid working
Wellbeing focus, with weekly onsite yoga 
Mental health first-aiders and free face-to-face support
  This role is based in London with no relocation support provided.

Booking.com is the world’s #1 accommodation site and the 3rd largest global e-commerce player.  Due to the ongoing development and growth of Booking.com, there is rapid evolution of the global and local obligations and improvements required within the International Finance (Tax) team. 
As a company we are fully dedicated to comply with our new (tax) obligations and to also initiate any future improvements, but a great deal of work in several departments is to be done to adjust to the changing tax landscape. We need to keep up with the change and are looking for a Project Manager, based in Amsterdam, to help us lead these initiatives, execute them on time and with great quality.
As Project Manager, you will coordinate & manage complex business critical initiatives. This may span across finance domains or multiple departments. The role involves close interaction with the Tax, Finance, FinTech, Payments teams to execute complex projects regarding new tax obligations, processes, data & reporting and future improvements based on set short- to long-term plans.
Your goal is to structure, plan, coordinate, and drive such teams/departments to deliver, while keeping the overall roadmap & success in sight. We seek a strong stakeholder manager who will take full ownership and accountability for projects with a global scope.
If the idea of managing complex stakeholder groups and helping the tax team achieve its roadmap is exciting to you, this may be your next career move.
B.Responsible:
Own the successful delivery of the end-to-end project lifecycle 
Responsible for the timely delivery of the project/initiative(s)
Define project scope and success criteria aligning with business objectives
Understand milestones and impediments. Tracks and report progress, manages overall timelines, dependencies, risks & issues & monitor interdependencies (within & outside project)  
Create clear project plans together with involved departments and collaborate with cross functional teams to identify & build action plans
Enable team members & leaders from involved departments to make quality decisions
Hold project members accountable for the delivery of their part of the project
Engage stakeholders at all levels inside and outside of the organisation
Supports building of PM capabilities within the organization and other teams
B.Skilled:
Experienced project manager with 3-5 years with a proven track record in managing the full end-to-end project lifecycle on business/strategic projects
Hands-on work experience in finance operations, within business/digital transformation is preferred
Be able to think through long term technology solutions whilst implementing quick wins throughout the project lifecycle
Enjoys a fast paced, dynamic environment and able to work under pressure managing multiple projects in parallel in an ambiguous environment
Pragmatic and self-starter, able to solve several impediments by him/herself & can-do mindset
Project Management
PMP or Agile Project Management or equivalent certification is preferred. Ability to adopt fit for purpose methodologies to execute a project 
Independently draft an end-to-end project plan with the ability to break up a complex problem into actionable and easy to understand solutions
Solid understanding of change management and able to guide stakeholders through change
Analytically skilled and can master data handling, able to tell a  clear story with data/insights
Communication & relationship management
Strong communicator who can deal with ambiguity & conflicting priorities, focussing on collaboration, building relationships within connected teams within the organisation
Ability to work with and align with multiple senior stakeholders across all levels of the organization
Skilled negotiator who focuses on win-win solutions to tough challenges and is able to help drive priority and encourage decision making
Not afraid of conflict and willing to set hard deadlines and show strong dedication to various causes
Organized & structured 
Acute business understanding and can translate business commercial requirements into operational deliverables
Structured, results driven & eager to make an impact
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills with excellent organizational agility and able to meet tight deadlines and prioritize in a rapidly changing environment

We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonus. We also offer what is called the “Booking Deal” with competitive benefits. This position is open to any candidate globally and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in The Netherlands.

About B2B Marketing Communications
The B2B Marketing Communications track is part of the Business Marketing division within the Marketing department of Booking.com. Our audiences are all of Booking.com’s B2B partner audiences - supply (eg. accommodations), demand (eg. affiliate partnerships), industry (eg. tourism bodies) and technology (eg. connectivity providers).
Our B2B marketing efforts are focused across six key crafts:
Brand strategy and management 
Brand measurement 
Communications
CX (or in our case, PX - partner experience)
Integrated marketing campaigns
Content marketing 
About The Role
We are looking for a B2B Content Marketing Senior Specialist to support our content marketing craft. This role is responsible for our content management and production efforts for all business partner audiences, as a component of our holistic B2B marketing communication efforts.  
This role owns the management of content across key B2B partner touch points.  This role also focuses on content production, mainly, content on our Partner Hub, Connectivity Hub, and Partnerships Hub.  The role helps maintain high content standards by managing how our content is produced, including management of our content calendar and deployment.
This role includes both supporting existing content types (digital editorial, education and commercial content) while being able to explore new content types, such as white papers or podcasts.
The B2B Content Marketing Senior Specialist achieves this by owning related tasks required to deliver content to our B2B partners, ensuring pieces of content are produced and managed in a consistent & quality way on our content channels.
Success in this role relies on being able to consistently and reliably deliver tasks related to content management, while also collaborating with teams & stakeholders to ensure maximum operational efficiency in the deployment & ongoing management phases of our content production cycle.
This role ensures close alignment with key stakeholders, including content marketing managers, translation teams and channel owners.
B.Responsible
Own content deployment related to our content marketing programs for key business partner audiences
Ensure Partner Hub, Connectivity Hub, and Partnerships Hub content for key content streams (primarily, but not limited to editorial content, commercial content, educational content and campaign landing pages) is correctly uploaded and prepared for translations, maintaining quality standards
Ensure consistent use of established naming conventions & taxonomies to deliver the best partner experience
Take responsibility for maintaining our content marketing calendar, in collaboration with B2B Content Marketing Managers
Demonstrate effective and efficient stakeholder management across teams and departments, contributing to strong relationships by communicating upcoming content releases and publishing cycles and creating positive stakeholder engagements on content being produced and deployed 
Support B2B Content Marketing Managers in measuring and reporting on the effectiveness of content across perception and performance metrics
B.Skilled
A minimum of 4 years in a relevant content management or production role
Proven track record in content management, including experience managing content within a CMS (content management system)
Track record in exploring and activating new content types, such as podcasts and white papers
Experience thriving in a complex multi-stakeholder environment
Experience measuring and reporting on the effectiveness of content, ideally across perception and behavioural metrics
Excellent stakeholder management skills.

Job Title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer - Accommodation Tech
B2B Partner Experience Insights Senior Specialist

Job Description:
Booking.com is the largest  online travel agency in the world! We serve hundreds of millions of users through our platform in 43 languages and offer more than 28 million reported accommodation listings. At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. We maintain petabytes of data including and not limited to; customer information, reservations, accommodation information, accommodation availability, destination information, etc.
About the Team
Marketing Technology is at our core so that is why we are constantly evolving and adapting our systems to be able to work with the best technology out there. Working in the Performance Marketing department you will be exposed to Java, Python, Perl, MySql, Cassandra, Kafka, Kubernetes, Hadoop, BigQuery, ElasticSearch and more. You will not only get the chance to utilise these technologies to solve the problems on hand in a scalable and reliable way but you will also be contributing to our goal to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
We are composed of world class engineers, data scientists and marketers focused on driving acquisition of new customers via messaging, online advertising and site and content optimization. Behind each of these pillars is a highly scaled infrastructure of system, tools, data pipelines and ML infrastructure that makes sure we are spending our money wisely and attract traffic to our website as efficiently as possible. This means you will be working in a dynamic and commercially oriented setting using the latest technologies, and with a lot of autonomy to make a direct impact on our business. 
B.Responsible
As a Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for developing complete web applications, both on the backend and frontend, for monitoring, addressing performance, and scaling our online marketing and advertising systems. Important aspects of the job include:
Rapidly developing next-generation scalable, flexible, and high-performance systems with a focus on building, maintaining and monitoring data pipelines in the public cloud and on-premise
Ensuring reliability and increasing the maturity of all systems via the use of system health monitoring tools and building new health indicators as needed
Working independently, taking ownership, acting as an intermediary for problems, with both technical and non-technical audiences
Solving issues with the existing systems, prioritising based on business and technical needs and communicating impact to the team and users
Collaborating with adjacent teams and other stakeholders to deliver on business objectives
Contributing to the growth of Booking.com through interviewing, on-boarding, or other recruitment efforts.

B.Skilled
We are looking for self-starters who are great at solving problems, who initiate discussions, are solutions-oriented, customer focused and believe that any challenge can be scaled with the right mindset and tools. We have found that people who match the following requirements are the ones who fit us best:
Minimum of 3 years software development experience.
Strong working knowledge and experience with one or more server-side programming languages  (Java, Perl, C++, Python)
Experience building interactive front-end web UIs with HTML, CSS and JavaScript; familiarity with modern web development frameworks, like React.
Demonstrable experience with MySQL or similar relational databases
Experience with distributed systems and solid understanding of Service Oriented Architecture and Microservices
Excellent communication; written and spoken and experience working with non-technical stakeholders
High level of ownership - own your systems end-to-end and are comfortable performing incident management.
B.Offered
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world-renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work.
Working in a fast-paced and performance-driven culture, career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.
Training, hackathons and opportunities to travel and attend global conferences.
Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits.
Company sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture.
Headquarters located in one of the most vibrant cities in Europe: Amsterdam.
Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world.

The Booking.com Treasury team is looking for a Treasury Analyst to execute on the Company's investment program and liquidity management. 
You will be part of a global team consisting of 30+ people and the position forms an integral part of the Front-Office Team at Booking.com. The preferred candidate will have 1-3 years of relevant experience, preferably from a large international corporate organisation, bank or an asset management firm with exposure to Fixed Income products trading and/or Portfolio Management activities.

Reporting to the Group Treasury Manager - Investments, the preferred candidate should have a high attention to detail and be accustomed to working in a fast paced environment, while working collaboratively with various internal and external teams to successfully meet agreed deliverables.
You will be key in the execution of the company’s excess cash investment trades and play an active role in reporting, compliance, trading infrastructure maintenance, KYC requests. In addition, you will be supporting the team with general Treasury activities. 
The successful candidate will join a team of 6 Front-Office Treasury professionals who are collectively responsible for the management of all FX and Investment activities, alongside Liquidity Forecasting for the Booking.com Group. You will be the main contact point for trade execution queries related to investment instruments and escalation point in the event of issues during the trading cycle. 
You will be accustomed to a work environment that thrives on change, innovation and be able to manage competing priorities while working under pressure to deliver on goals that are set within the team. Due to the rapid and continuous growth of the organization, the tasks and duties of this role will evolve over time. You will be keen to develop and grow within the role and challenge yourself to take on additional projects and responsibilities as they present themselves.
 B. Responsible:
Active role in the execution of money market trades for multiple Group entities
Deliver various month end reports and cover analytical tasks connected to investment products, ensuring the accuracy of data in all reported material; 
Assist with the modelling and review of optimal investment strategies for the Company's fixed income program, including the determination of the appropriate asset allocation based on risk and return trade-offs;
Assist in the analysis, development and documentation of forward looking plans, procedures and controls related to various investment programs;
Review, maintain and enhance Front-Office related policies, guidelines and desk procedures;
Manage relationships with external investment managers including due diligence, monitoring, performance, compliance and trade execution;
Partner with internal stakeholders (e.g. Corporate Accounting, Tax and Risk & Control teams) in order to satisfy evolving business requirements;
Actively contribute to the team by identifying and proposing changes to both internal and external processes in order to increase compliance, efficiency and generate cost reductions.
B.Skilled:
1-3 years of experience in a Treasury function within a large corporate setting.
Master degree (in Finance, Macroeconomics, Engineering, Statistics, similar quantitative field or equivalent practical experience)
Excellent analytical skills and strong proficiency in Excel
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to influence others.
Strong interpersonal skills
Strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful
Solution oriented and result driven
Proactive and capable of working independently as well as working in a team
Strong knowledge of micro and macroeconomic factors, with the ability to translate these into risk-based decisions.
Able to demonstrate relentless tenacity to drive business objectives and deliver results.
Systems knowledge; SAP/ Reval TMS, S&P Capital IQ, Bloomberg, Clearwater Analytics.

Established in 1996 in Amsterdam, Booking.com has grown from a small Dutch start-up to the third largest e-commerce company in the world. Booking.com is the largest business within Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) and accounts for the vast majority of Booking Holdings’ total revenue. Booking Holdings is a leading Fortune 500 e-commerce conglomerate with a market cap of approximately $80 billion.
With a mission to make it easier for everyone to experience the world, Booking.com invests in digital technology that helps take the friction out of travel. Booking.com connects travellers with the world’s largest selection of incredible places to stay, including everything from apartments, vacation homes, and family-run B&Bs to 5-star luxury resorts and even tree houses. The Booking.com website and mobile apps are available in over 40 languages, offer more than +28 million total reported listings, and cover +140K destinations in +200 countries worldwide. 
At Booking.com we’re working to seamlessly connect every aspect of travel, and the Insurance team is one of the cornerstones of our connected trip vision. Our mission is to grow our range of products to give travellers peace of mind when booking any part of their trip. 
The Trips business unit that Insurance is part of, will bridge the Booking.com of today with the Booking of tomorrow, leading the evolution of Booking.com from a single-product company to a multi-product offering company with an unprecedented, personalised travel experience at the heart of its success.
Commercial Director, Insurance
The Commercial Director, Insurance is the second in command for the growing insurance vertical, and a key member of the Insurance Management Team. The role works to build the vertical into a successful business through a combination of oversight, management, and individual contribution.
The role requires full ownership of significant parts of the business, with a principal focus on portfolio level commercial management, and internal and external partnering. All delivered in a compliant manner, within a regulated environment.
The role has statutory responsibilities (e.g. Entity directorship, regulated positions, UK/FCA controlled function, NL/AFM policymaker).
This role will also have a number of direct reports - an Insurance Manager, for support in delivery, and this role will also be responsible for our pool of Insurance Associates and Analysts, and rotating pool of junior resources in the team who are allocated to different projects. This role will be responsible for their allocation and development.
The role is the owner of our key partnerships. This includes commercial responsibility, management of relationships, and product portfolio oversight.
The role is also the primary person responsible for the effective partnering with internal dependent functions (e.g. StratOps, HR, Accounting, Tax, FP&A, Operations (exc. Customer Service, Claims), Legal).
The role takes on responsibility for strategic planning, such as setting the roadmap, OKRs, and expansion strategy for the vertical. This role also has oversight of the budget, and financial forecasting.
The role also has responsibility for market expansion and special projects - e.g. US expansion.
The role is highly visible, and will likely interact with dozens of internal and external stakeholders, representing and driving the insurance vertical forward from junior through to LT levels.
Key Responsibilities:
Strategic oversight of many different parts of the insurance portfolio, including management and day-to-day oversight of specific areas. This will include oversight of business partnerships with all other Booking.com / Booking Transport functions (e.g. Finance, HR, Legal), as well as product focussed areas. The role will also require cross portfolio oversight of insurance.
The role will have several direct reports, including management of the junior insurance resource pool, and an Insurance Manager.
Ownership of our external partnerships (insurance carriers, TPA’s, brokers), including top-level commercial negotiations, day-to-day relationship management, and portfolio performance oversight.
Through the cycle delivery of new insurance products across the Booking.com landscape - including: Ideation, design, structuring, planning, and implementation.
Working with our StratOps teams to deliver a comprehensive insurance strategy, timelines, resource plans to deliver ambitious EBITDA goals over the next 5 years.
Special projects management (e.g. US Expansion) - and other high profile big deliveries.
Portfolio oversight and management of existing insurance products.
Implementation of new organizational structure to support the current and future insurance ambitions of Booking.com – including if need be integration and shaping of the existing insurance business.
Market and competitor analysis, feeding into market strategy and product design.
Working with external advisors and regulators to ensure regulatory compliance in every geography.
Working with the wider risk management team to appropriately integrate with enterprise risk.
Supporting the development of improved MI, tools, ways of working and training programmes.
Ideal Experience & Skills:
At least 8 years’ experience within management type roles, with a preference for insurance or financial services experience (but not mandatory).
Ability to work in an entrepreneurial ‘start-up’ type environment with moving targets and ambitions.
Experience with working in a regulated industry, and understanding of risk management and compliance topics in this context.
Experience of working across multi-cultural geographies and targeting global launches / roll outs.
Experience in managing cross-functional stakeholders with competing objectives, with a particular focus on non-insurance experts.
Confident, clear and concise communication skills with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts in oral and written communications.
First class commercial problem solving, analysis and decision-making ability, with proven capability to take high levels of ownership and accountability and operate independently.
Commercially minded, with experience of constructing and presenting business cases, supporting models, and financial projections.
Ability to thrive under pressure, deal with ambiguity and get things done.
Experience in managing relationships with insurance supervisors (Desired).
Ability to work in a technology company, with an understanding of product management and build (Desired).
Ability to work in a highly data driven environment. Designing and launching experiments, research, or other analysis to justify business decisions (Desired).
Experience in the design and launch of new insurance products (Desired).
CRITICAL LEADERSHIP CAPABILITIES
Leading Change
Publicly identifies needed changes or directions that need adjustment, challenges assumptions and norms.
The ability to “think big” and simultaneously understand and appreciate the details necessary to operationalize overarching strategies and goals; The ability to make sense of complex issues and ambiguous situations. 
Challenges assumptions about “the way things are done”.
Communicates explicitly what must change, why changes are necessary, and possible outcomes and costs.
Adjusts communication style to the audience to help them understand and accept the change.
Encourages people to support and propose changes and ideas.
Building relationships, Collaborating and Influencing
Establishes relationships and enhances the levels of cooperation, collaboration, and trust that exist between people, interacting with others personally, competently, and effectively. Establishes relationships inside and outside of the organization. Fosters a culture that makes people feel valued and respected and leverages even difficult or tense circumstances to enhance relationships.
Negotiates with a genuine give-and-take approach, where both acts as true peers and decisions are shared.
Spends time identifying all stakeholders necessary and meets or connects with all of them, neglecting no one to shape a collective consensus.
Identifies opportunities to build relationships that will help others achieve their objectives and reaches out to those people or new people.
Driving Results
Responds resourcefully, flexibly, and positively when faced with new challenges and demands. Willingly and effectively deals with the stress and complexities of various situations. Moves forward productively under conditions of change or uncertainty
Demonstrates and fosters a sense of urgency, a “can-do” spirit, a sense of optimism, ownership, and strong commitment to achieving goals and organizational success. Demonstrates a strong sense of ownership and a commitment to achieving meaningful results.   
Checks work of self and others against required quality standards.
Reviews performance and progress on a regular basis to ensure team is achieving results.
Tests to see if goals are sufficiently challenging and implements corrective action based on deviations.

As the Partner Services Change Management Lead, you will be responsible for rolling out changes to our Partner Services organization of 4000+ people.
As a PS Change Management Lead, you’re at the center of global initiated changes  focused on helping our accommodation partners and/or our internal staff. You will work closely with various central teams on a wide variety of high impacting changes such as product roll outs, process improvements to frameworks that drive the performance of our people.
At the same time, you get to learn, understand and extensively collaborate with our local teams around the globe..
The role requires someone who is a team player, well organized and strong in change and project management and influencing skills. You will be asked to support/coach your team of Senior Change and Implementation Specialists on how to drive the successful execution of changes. You will put these skills to great use as you manage multiple High Impacting changes at the same time, partner with senior level change owners and drive/support to build our strategy that allows our operations to understand and drive changes. 
Responsibilities:
Coach and develop their team of Change and Implementation Specialists
Driving changes to meet organizational strategic goals through effective management of change
Scope, design and implement change management strategies and plans that maximize employee adoption of change of high impacting large scale initiatives and minimize resistance
Work with peers and across silos centrally and regionally, connect the work of disparate groups to ensure change timing, understanding and contention are managed
Build consensus around best practices in change management - within the team and regionally
Continuously drive initiatives to improve the implementation processes for the team
Work with the various implementation teams across the company to align on processes we follow & optimize together 
Collaborate with regional stakeholders in order to ensure the best change experience for LPS, coaching regional teams in the best approaches for landing changes in their regions
Monitor and design aftercare/follow up plans to further support successful adoption/landing of the change
Able to assimilate a lot of information whilst cutting through the volume and complexity in order to focus on the priorities
Effective and top quality time and workload management skills, due to the volume and complexity of projects that are assigned to this roll
Skills:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
Broad Job Knowledge (5-8 years)
3- 5 years of progressive experience in a change adoption function is required. 
Experience must include significant work with senior leadership on change management.
Strong understanding of Change Management methodologies, Release Management & Implementation Management.
