Job Title: Senior Tech Product Manager - Marketing Rewards Platform
Job Description:
Our Company
Founded in 1996 in Amsterdam, Booking.com has grown from a small Dutch start-up to one of the world’s leading digital travel companies. Part of Booking Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: BKNG), Booking.com’s mission is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
By investing in technology that takes the friction out of travel, Booking.com seamlessly connects millions of travelers to memorable experiences, a variety of transportation options, and incredible places to stay – from homes to hotels, and much more. As one of the world’s largest travel marketplaces for both established brands and entrepreneurs of all sizes, Booking.com enables properties around the world to reach a global audience and grow their businesses.
At Booking.com, we are all involved in making hundreds of decisions every day. The decisions we make are a reflection of our values -  they reflect what is important to us, both as individuals and as an organization. 
Booking.com was recently ranked #3 in the Financial Times’ 2021 Diversity Leaders list of European employers, and we couldn’t be more proud. It’s a great recognition for our colleagues around the world, who effortlessly work to create a welcoming and open environment in which people can connect and learn from each other. 
Senior Technical Product Manager - Rewards
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world.
The Digital Marketing department’s mission is to be the experts in performance marketing. We deliver proven and effective performance marketing services to ensure that Booking.com can drive profitable growth through its marketing channels. One of these channels is ‘Rewards & Incentives’, which focuses on customer retention and acquisition through promotion constructs. 
Within the Rewards & Incentives family, the Tech PM will be leading the Rewards Core team that operates at the heart of our promotion platform strategy. The team’s objective is to enable internal clients to reward customers via marketing campaigns through a feature-complete, self-service and stable rewards platform. You will be tackling multiple complex problems and collaborating across departments to enable new promotional capabilities and integrate services to provide an even better customer experience. The Tech PM is responsible for providing scalable, robust and reliable services powering booking.com funded promotions across the whole company.
Responsibilities
Defining the vision (end goal, one year and beyond) and roadmap (how to achieve it, quarter-per-quarter) for the team.
Working with internal clients to translate needs into development requirements that drive impact for the business.
Owning the ideation, post mortem, prioritization, backlog, customer feedback loop processes.
Guiding new features, systems and services from inception to launch while keeping (internal) customers at the center of everything.
Measuring and reporting the team’s progress and impact to the business in a transparent and effective way. This includes defining key business and services success metrics, tracking them, and improving upon them.
Using data to inform team priorities and decision making.
Being the advocate for the team’s customers and stakeholders and keeping the track, customers, stakeholders, and the wider business up-to-date with team progress.
Requirements for the role
At least 5 years of experience as a Technical Product Manager, domain experience in (travel) ecommerce is preferred.
Since the product is a platform we are looking for a person with a strong technical background - enough to be comfortable with developing this critical service and translate tech insights into business opportunities. An engineering degree is preferred.
Proven experience of working effectively with and communicating to a diverse set of stakeholders.
Understand what an exceptional user experience entails and how to deliver it whilst balancing against other competing priorities.
Be commercially aware and have a strategic mind, able to identify business opportunities and deliver against them.
Have excellent communication skills and be able to communicate with all levels in the business.
Be a highly motivated self-starter with a flexible, can-do attitude.
Team player with a bottom-up ideation process.
An analytical orientation and strong problem-solving skills demonstrated by the ability to structure issues and analyze alternative solutions.
Able to understand and formulate meaningful business metrics.
Fluent in the English language both spoken and written.
We offer
This role is open to worldwide candidates. We provide assistance for you and your family with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated thousands of technology professionals to Amsterdam.
Headquarters located in one of the most vibrant cities in Europe: Amsterdam
Performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential
Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits
Company-sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture
Competence advancements via online resources, trainings, on-the-job opportunities, conferences and community initiatives
Competitive compensation and benefits package
Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world
Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

Recruiter - Technology
At Booking.com, our mission is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.
The Recruiter role is responsible for executing the talent acquisition strategy and delivering hiring results for their function within the technology team in Bucharest.
You will be a a passionate candidate advocate with proven analytical capabilities and multitasking skills, extreme attention to detail, and the ability to effectively prioritise and multi-task. The Recruiter will also be a self-starter with operational recruiting experience and a passion for recruiting, a high level of flexibility, commitment, and the ability to tackle ambiguity.
They collaborate with their TA Manager, senior members of their business functions and HR colleagues to ensure quality, quantity and timely communication.
Tasks & Responsibilities:
Self-sufficient and able to work with little direct supervision
Strong track record of solving complex problems
Acts as a talent advisor by identifying appropriate stakeholders for hiring needs, providing outstanding guidance to hiring managers and their interview teams to shape their talent needs to best match the needs of Booking.com and external talent
Gathers market data and landscape for the Hiring Manager to support and influence hiring strategies and decision making, and is informed of market trends and recruiting practices
Acts as a Brand Ambassador, builds out talent networks and activates knowledgeable industry sources to develop and generate an ongoing pool of candidates through a diverse mix of sources
Delivers on the promise to recruit a diverse candidate pipeline and slate
Is proactive in achieving hiring targets through an effective selection process
Uses data to create, measure and scale smart recruiting tactics
Manages the hiring process and a first class candidate experience end-to-end, with support of the coordinators and sourcers when and where applicable
Works closely with the business and HR colleagues throughout the search process providing consistent communication and incredible service
Executes labor legislation and required changes to ensure compliance
Manages (pre-)closing of the candidates and hiring managers
Follows global guidelines to ensure consistency and alignment of all TA products, tools, services and initiatives
Provides feedback, suggestions and input to the TA Manager/Team Lead to improve the recruitment process in the organisation, its effectiveness and adoption
Continually develops domain knowledge of the business function
Handles multiple problems simultaneously with high judgment
Ideal experience & profile:
Demonstrable recruiting experience in technology, preferably in-house experience in a fast-paced start-up, e-commerce or hyper-growth tech company.
Experience with both high volume recruitment as well as specialist searches
Has strong analytical skills; ability to leverage data to support a business case then pursues creative solutions, ability to create, measure, and scale the right workflow between candidates, hiring managers, and the recruiting team to ensure results 
Has a strong track record of solving complex problems, designing creative strategies, and delivering significant impact as a recruiter
Has a proven ability to work well under pressure, capable of adapting and responding to change and able to multitask
Experienced negotiator and ability to (pre)close on deals
Has strong stakeholder management; demonstrated ability to partner with key stakeholders in execution of recruiting initiatives, partners and influences (senior) leadership, is self-confident and capable in building proactive and meaningful relationships throughout our global organisation
Has a strong work ethic; self-directed, resourceful, works independently, motivated by own drive and enthusiasm, has demonstrated the ability to work well in a team
Has strong organisational skills and ability to manage complex operational processes
Demonstrates personal accountability and integrity
Is collaborative, focuses on team spirit and knowledge sharing, and understand the value of working as one team
Is inquisitive; a strong desire to learn new things and improving existing processes
Thoughtful; thinks strategically, but stays on top of tactical execution – anticipates roadblocks and proactively creates solutions to ensure success

Job Title: Commercial Excellence Manager - Central Partner Services
Job Description:
Our mission in Global Commercial Excellence within Partner Services is to maximize value for partners and Booking by delivering the right value & experience distributed through the right omni-channel partner-centric approach.
The main building blocks to accomplish this mission are:
Developing and implementing methodology, logic, and data for Partner Performance Management and Commercial value steering
Coordinate and drive tactical steering through target-setting and prioritization tools, supported by proactive opportunity identification and global optimization
Driving new Strategic Execution & Commercial programs in PS
Developing Distribution and Go-to-Market capabilities
Within the Commercial Excellence department we have set up the Commercial Planning team to own the Commercial planning and target setting process across all our channels and steer Commercial performance by reviewing progress towards agreed commercial objectives and address to & follow-up on key business opportunities with relevant teams and stakeholders. 
The Global Commercial Excellence Manager defines and manages the process of target setting, acts as commercial and business partner to key stakeholders and owns the process of managing commercial performance reviews. 
The position will work very closely together within the Commercial Planning and with the Commercial Development team. As part of the responsibilities a close connection towards a diverse range of stakeholders - ranging from channel stakeholders (Regional Partner Services, Digital Partner Experience & Connectivity) to product and strategy teams as part of our Accommodations Business unit. 
In order to perform the role successfully, a high level of commercial thinking, problem-solving, effective communication and stakeholder management skills are mandatory, ideally combined with deep knowledge of the online travel & accommodations business. A self-starting attitude with knowledge and experience developing commercial processes would be a plus.
Responsibilities:
Business ownership for defining, managing and running the process of target setting and/or Commercial Performance reviews across all distribution channels (Regional Partner Services teams, Digital Partner Experience & Connectivity)
Commercial and business partner to key stakeholders on the assigned areas of responsibility - collecting feedback from stakeholders, driving problem-solving to arrive at better outcomes, generating hypotheses for analytics
Monitor Global Performance on all channels and regions and address business opportunities arising out of the performance reviews
Provide guidance to prioritize products selected for distribution through each channel
Orchestrates development and distribution of key commercial reports & follow-up on key commercial performance topics
Collect and systematize feedback on largest unaddressed business opportunities in the market & build an ongoing feedback loop/mechanism
Identifies ways to improve the collaboration on commercial performance topics across different stakeholders
Skills:
Commercial Thinking
Strong knowledge on accommodation partner business & operations
Anticipate partner needs and proactively recommend solutions on improved partner performance
Expert knowledge on the market competition, B.com (OTA landscape, trends, incentives, etc.)
Deep understanding and knowledge of revenue management principles relevant for accommodations & how they are applied by partners
Apply cross-channel understanding that scalably improves partner business
Strong knowledge on distribution channels
Problem Solving
Ability to identify, articulate and structure key commercial challenges & opportunities independently;
Highly proficient in deriving conclusions based on quantitative and qualitative analysis
Finding & creating compelling solutions starting from a high-level concept
Finding the right balance between solving the detail vs. understanding the bigger picture
Ability to turn commercial opportunities & challenges into actionable steps
Communication
Construct clear, concise & compelling written materials & bigger narratives (presentations & documents)
Ability to verbally explain context, challenges and solutions in a clear & concise manner
Emerging ability to adjust communication style and draft clear communications depending on the stakeholder
Effectively understand your own and other people's emotions and use this understanding as part of the overall communication to build psychological safety
Impact & Delivery
Results-/Outcome driven – excels in getting things accomplished with a proactive & can-do attitude
5+ years experience in hospitality operations, project management, eCommerce or a related field
Ability to manage relationships a diverse range of stakeholders & build networks of relationships across the organization
Ability to persuade differently focused teams to implement ideas that have a significant impact on commercial performance
Ability to provide effective formal and informal feedback and mentoring people across the organization

The Company

It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
Do you enjoy taking ownership and being responsible for your own internal business portfolio? Do you thrive in building strong relationships over the phone? Can you help Booking.com’s partners grow their business by providing them with analysis, growth opportunities and new products and services? If your answer is “yes”, you might have what it takes to be the next Account Executive at our Athens office!

What you’ll be doing:
Pro-active communication with partners in your region by telephone and by internal messaging to assist with the development of Booking.com’s business
Responsible for a portfolio of partners where you are the first point of contact, answering questions and following up when needed
Responsible for maintaining a stable relationship with the accommodation partners (i.e. frequent performance calls and contact to ensure they offer Booking.com’s customers the best availability and competitive pricing)
Be knowledgeable on Booking.com’s products so that their benefits and usage can be explained to Partners
Identify opportunities for partners that will help improve Booking.com’s business by using its internal segmentation to prioritise
Help identifying new potential partner leads and pass these leads on for further follow up
Responsible for taking Customer Service escalations which relate to their managed portfolio and solving these in the most efficient manner for the business, partner and customer
Support the organisation of events, such as workshops and webinars, for partners. Also expected to attend and participate in the partner events for their managed portfolio
What you’ll bring:
Strong and engaging communication skills
Solution oriented and results driven
Ability to influence partners over the phone to implement suggestions;
Strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful
Proactive, flexible and capable of working independently as well as working in a team
Ability to prioritise own workload and efficiently manage their time
Eye for accuracy and ability to be analytical
Language: English and Greek written and verbal
In return, we’ll provide:
A performance-based company with competitive salary and bonuses
A great platform for learning and development
The opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds from all over the planet
Please submit your CV and motivation letter in English.

About Accommodations
The Accommodations Business Unit plays a vital role in the company’s future success and has many processes / mutual KPIs and relationships to manage and maintain with other Business Units and Functions. The Business Operations team in Accommodations is responsible for the governance and programme management of strategic initiatives within the unit and the unit’s dependencies with other Business Units and Functions across the company - essentially establishing the connective tissue between strategy and operational execution.  
About the role
The Program Manager Accommodations will be part of the Business Operations team and is responsible for the governance and E2E program management of several streams of work (or portfolio’s) within Accommodations. The Program Manager will partner with various teams across the company to support, and proactively work with them, to facilitate the work occurring between them and other business units and centralized functions. 
First and foremost, the Program Manager will ensure that the team's roadmaps/plans focus on agreed business priorities, dependencies and strategies, and they deliver against the shared objectives and main activities with key milestones that have been set by the Accommodations Leadership Team. 
The Program Manager will support the team(s) in scoping and managing program(s), along with identifying and managing the relevant dependencies in order to minimize risks and challenges. The Program Manager ensures that the functional workload of the department is managed in a consistent manner, whilst working externally with the business units & central functions to build engagement and where needed, governance over decisions needed for work to be signed off. 
You will be responsible with limited to no supervision to define scope, kick-off, manage and execute every phase of complex department programs, specifically:
Drive vision for initiative/program towards clear business objectives, scope, requirements & success criteria
Create clear planning documents and roadmaps together with involved teams and departments including setup and maintenance of dependency management
Establish a solid governance routine which involves (sr) mgmt updates and reporting. Holds stakeholders and business partners accountable of next steps and objectives and proactively identifies risks and issues
Enable teams & leaders to make quality decisions and support  in prioritization exercises
Required Skills
Strong project management skills/experience including experience with a range of different methodologies and techniques. Preferably having a background in Agile Project management, PMI certification and / or LEAN
Proven track record to independently lead high complexity (end-2-end) projects, drive multiple medium complexity projects and/or manage program portfolio of projects 
Have a solid business understanding, independently use quantitative and qualitative data to drive decision making
Analytical skilled and mastering data handling and measuring success, ability to tell a clear story with data/insights
Change management experience & mind-set
Strong interpersonal skills focused on collaboration. 
Effectively communicate including large audiences
Ability to influence and steer leadership, senior management and groups
Ability to break up a complex problem into actionable and easy to understand solutions.
Able to function well within ambiguity and in a constantly changing environment
Experience in product development, UX, Design, Copywriting craft and/or business operations is a plus
B.offered
Delicious catered lunches
A huge platform for learning and development
Performance-based bonuses
The opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds from all over the planet
Relocation package and ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in The Netherlands
Other perks and benefits

Job Title: Global Senior Program Manager - Cares & Community
Job Description:
At Booking.com, our mission is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. While that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.
With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening career opportunities within our People team that will have a strong impact on our mission.
The Program and Community Manager owns and manages the global Booking Cares employee volunteer program & strategy and our local initiatives and relationships in our headquarters in Amsterdam. This program integrates with broader CSR and related Employee Engagement programmes at Booking.com. You will  lead the identification of global and local partners and priorities for volunteerism linked to our pillars around sustainability, inclusion & diversity, and wellbeing and the creation of scaleable global solutions in partnership with the business. 
As the Amsterdam Community manager you will localise the implementation of the strategy. This will be achieved by targeting and working with business & local NGOs to identify and implement local community initiatives.
As a Project manager you help drive the People Agenda aligned to our business objectives managing a portfolio of initiatives that span multiple business units, people areas and geographies. In this role you lead and coordinate with cross-functional teams across HR and the business, ensuring effective implementation and the adoption of new initiatives. 
  As the Booking Cares Program Owner you will:
Own development and implementation of global volunteerism strategy and ambitions.
Lead an ambassador network of regional champions to deliver local solutions related to community impact. 
Respond to requests and inquiries from regional teams, including interpreting data and targets, researching data sources and providing general performance analysis as needed.
Work with leadership to provide assessment and evaluation for discussions and decisions on impact plans.
Provide technical and practical advice on CSR specifically around tooling to drive change at scale.
Work with regional key business functions to incorporate volunteerism and community impact into their planning, talent development, and team building and supports scalable solutions to enable such plans.
Represent the organisation with external working groups and shares insights back to the business.
Provide on-site leadership, establishing practices, templates, tools and partnerships to expand and mature project capabilities within the team and department
Develop a trusted adviser relationship with the People Leadership Team and business leaders.
Collaborate with our Internal Communication team on the design, development, delivery and management of communications.
Daily operation and activation of global employee volunteer programme
Setting objectives, roadmaps and success metrics for the program and innovating for future growth
Being a community manager to the program to create and execute communication plans for the program
Being a Product Owner of the program platform and being able to understand the connection between users and platform developments
Maintain an annual program budget
Full cycle execution of the program ability to balance operational and strategic tasks
Supporting and connecting our team of Cares Connectors & ERGs worldwide
Experience with our tooling partner Benevity is desired

As the local Community Manager you will:
Work with local NGOs to support implementation of community initiatives in our headquarters market of Amsterdam
Support global Booking Cares program implementation in the region 
Manage a portfolio of Netherlands based initiatives with the support of local ambassadors; including instituting change management required to support the program
Apply structured methodology to and lead both project and change management activities
Apply change management processes and tools to create a strategy to support adoption of the changes required by a project or initiative.
Engage stakeholders at all levels in the organization
Break down business challenges into smaller problems with actionable solutions
Track and report progress
To  be successful in these roles you will have:
Leadership, skills including the ability to lead up, across and down multiple people and business organizations
5+ years of experience managing the full project and change lifecycle
A solid understanding of how people go through the change curve and the change process
Exceptional communication skills
5+ years of experience maintaining relationships and working with business stakeholders within a cross-functional matrix environment
Proven ability  to work effectively at all levels in an organization
Proven ability to influence others and move toward a common vision or goal
Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations and under pressure
Organized with a natural inclination for planning strategy and tactics
Problem solving and root cause identification skills
Acute business acumen and understanding of organizational issues and challenges
Experience with large-scale organizational change efforts is an advantage
Knowledge of different HR fields such as Reward, Performance Management,L&D, Operations and HR Technology  is an advantage
Fluent in Dutch (Desirable)

About Booking.com
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world. 
With over 1.6 million room nights booked every day, accommodation represents the largest share of our business to date. Our mission is to deliver the best customer experience and the most varied selection of properties.
At Booking.com we combine the best traits of a start-up with the resources of planet Earth’s  #1 accommodation website. We are working towards creating the ultimate travel experience, building and improving great products for both travelers and the accommodation partners.
  About the Accommodations Business Unit
We are responsible for the design & delivery of services and products to offer customers the best selection of properties and rooms. Our products & services are available on the Web, Mobile and API platforms, and span over all aspects of Booking.com accommodation business – from getting inventory from partners to displaying rooms to our customers. Our focus area is to provide customers with the best selection of properties & rooms by understanding customer intent, getting more relevant properties and rooms, and using existing inventory as effectively as possible.
B.Responsible 
As a Data Analyst you’ll work within an analytics team, and with stakeholders throughout the company, to support data-driven decision making. You’ll spend your time translating business problems into data problems that you then solve with your expertise in wrangling data, running appropriate analyses, and communicating complex ideas to a range of stakeholders. You’ll help us to unlock the power of our data by designing and maintaining key reports, metrics  and workflows to ensure the right information is available to the right people at the right time. Your focus will always be on business impact, with a strong bias towards pragmatism over perfection. 
Important aspects of the job include:
Work independently on data collection and preparation.
Use past experience, and seek for help in complex scenarios, to translate business problems into data stories
Maintain and drive key reports, metrics and workflows running within your scope.
Be able to communicate results and outcomes clearly to stakeholders based on your knowledge and experience.
Communicate effectively, collaboratively and challenge constructively to create rapport and establish trust.
Actively participate in business and/or analytics team activities and suggest ways of achieving objectives (standup, planning meeting, retrospectives)
Network and proactively connect with craft peers beyond the team scope
Use previous knowledge and experience on data analysis and visualization to answer business questions in the most efficient way
Be familiar with the larger data ecosystem at Booking and how it relates to your data and the work you do.
Collaborate and be open to giving and receiving feedback with peers and direct stakeholders.
Be flexible in adopting and proposing new approaches and expanding your technical competencies when a more efficient way presents itself.
Get significant deep knowledge about the operational, tactical and strategic workings of the department. 
Maintain a main focus on business and technical opportunities.
We have found that people who match the following requirements are the ones who fit us best:
Driven and results oriented personality
Open to feedback and always looking for ways to improve your own performance
Able to understand details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture
Analytical and curious mindset
Strong interpersonal skills
Open and friendly attitude
Strong knowledge and experience on data analysis.
Experience in data management, data visualization and quality.
Knowledge and experience using data analysis and visualization tools (e.g: tableau, data studio, powerbi, mixpanel, etc)
Knowledge and experience with at least one data analysis language (SQL at least. Python or similar is a bonus)
Is flexible in adopting and proposing new approaches and expanding their technical competencies when a more efficient way presents itself.
Experience in, or awareness of, an experimentation culture
Awareness of statistical models used within their scope
B.Offered
Headquarters located in one of the most vibrant cities in Europe: Amsterdam 
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide
Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture
Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com

Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

The Company:
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.
In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.
Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.
We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the world’s leading online hotel reservation service) is looking for people to support our business in the fast-growing hotel markets.
Booking.com is seeking a full time GIS Team Lead in our Barcelona office. 
B.Responsible:
The GIS Team Lead supervises GIS Specialists in various countries. Manages and motivates employees from the GIS track. Has a strong grasp of GIS industry knowledge and experience as well as required technical skills. Responsible for delivering on team targets and KPIs. Directly manage a team of up to 10 GIS Specialists globally.
B.Capable:
Support, lead and develop a direct team of GIS Specialists across multiple locations.
Capacity and workload management, ensure delivery and improvement on KPIs, SLAs, targets through team coverage and availability.
Implementation of GIS initiatives - primarily training, application, work-flow integration, and spatial analysis.
Strong knowledge of multiple data sources across geographies (both spatial & non-spatial) for GPS data collection and coordination
Exposure to BI/Data visualization platforms (Excel, Tableau, Power BI, etc.) and demonstrated handling, processing, and deriving insights from non geo data.
Experience managing ArcSDE and required editing needs;
Perform analysis on GIS datasets for relevance, accuracy, and quality;
Checking for accuracy of GIS and geospatial deliverables and reports;
Coordinating with the Solutions team, project managers, and stakeholders 
Maintain and improve defined quality and productivity standards for the team(s) Identify and grow talent, provide feedback, coach, train and support direct reports.
Conduct performance reviews according to performance cycle.
Contribute to Booking.com’s growth through interviewing, onboarding or other recruitment / staffing requirements.
Be an effective change manager and lead team(s) through periods of change, displaying motivating and encouraging behaviours.
Drive engagement of teams, aligning team goals with the company vision, marketing objectives andAgency strategy.
Create and nurture an environment oriented to open communication and mutual trust, entrepreneurial thinking, and cohesive team effort.
Build strong working relationships with relevant stakeholders (local leadership and local HR, area management as well as central Content Agency teams).
Be a role model for company policies and procedures, and ensuring the team understands and adheres to them.
Allocation and management of team travel & entertainment budgets.
B.Skilled:
Bachelor degree.
3 - 5 years of relevant experience related to the role. 
3+ years of experience in a management function.
Experience with leading and coaching global teams.
In-depth knowledge of ESRI's software, including ArcGIS suite (catchment analysis, geo referencing etc.).
Strong spreadsheet and database manipulation, including SQL, to leverage various data sources for use in GIS projects.
Experience / knowledge in geospatial programming using Python, R and JavaScript.
Analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and draw conclusions to make business decisions.
Excellent understanding of delivering on content services in e-commerce.
Strong collaborator, willingness to partner with colleagues and sees teamwork as critical to success.
Proactive, sense of responsibility and ability to work independently.
Exceptional communication skills with the ability to stay balanced and resourceful.
Positive attitude with a focus on solutions.
Flexible change champion being able to operate in a dynamic environment.
Knowledge of an additional language is a plus.
B.offered.
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and competitive compensation, including bonus. We also offer what is called the “Booking Deal” with competitive benefits.
Booking.com BV is the world’s #1 accommodation site and the 3rd largest global e-commerce player. The diverse team, 15,000 strong, is united by a single mission: to empower people to experience the world. We connect travelers with the world’s largest selection of incredible places to stay, including everything from apartments, vacation homes, and family-run B&Bs to 5-star luxury resorts, tree houses and even igloos. Each day, more than 1,200,000 room nights are reserved on our platform.

Job Title: Senior Software Developer - Cloud Enablement - Core Infrastructure
Job Description:
At Booking.com, our mission is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.
Cloud Enablement Teams within Core Infrastructure
Do you want to build software that impacts millions of customers around the world, tackling some of the world's most complex ecommerce challenges? We are looking for talented infrastructure backend developers to join our Cloud Enablement Teams for Core Infrastructure department in our Amsterdam HQ. 
In Core Infrastructure we design, build and operate all the technology that our Booking.com product development teams need in order to deliver great travel products to our customers.
This includes, for instance, our on premise data centers, our cloud hosted Kubernetes clusters, MySQL/Cassandra/Elasticsearch database environment, HAProxy load balancers, Envoy service mesh, APigee gateway, Kafka streaming service, Hadoop big data storage, Graphite time series, Grafana dashboard platform, monitoring & alerting tools, CI/CD tooling, Perl/Java/Node.js/Typescript language frameworks and more...
B.Responsible
Combine hands on coding with working on impactful project(s) and supporting other team members,
Solve business problems, work cross-functionally and lead initiatives to improve our development process and business opportunities within Booking.com,
Rapidly developing and operating scalable, flexible, and high-performance infrastructure systems on premise and in the cloud;
Overall system architecture, scalability, reliability, and performance;
Rational support, triage and solve issues with internal systems, prioritizing based on customer impact;
Acting as an intermediary for problems, with both technical and non-technical audiences;
Participating in code and design reviews to maintain our high development standards;
Apply good engineering and security practices for the systems you build.
Knowledge of automated software testing, continuous integration, release management. 
A data-driven approach to problem solving and optimization
  B.Skills
You have strong programming skills and experience with 2+ server-side programming languages, including Java
Experience with at least one major cloud provider ( Google or AWS ). Having obtained a certification is a plus
You have 7+ years of experience as a Software Developer, you’ve worked with web applications, distributed systems and product(s) that impact millions of customers,
Experience with design, development, testing, and monitoring of large-scale and data-intensive systems
You have driven successful technical, business and people related initiatives that improved productivity, performance and quality,
Experience with developing and operating technologies comparable to the ones we use (see list above);
Experienced debugging, diagnosing, and trouble-shooting complex production software;
Demonstrate best practices when developing and maintaining services built on microservice architecture.
Strong understanding of system performance and scaling;
Write high quality code that is robust and easy to maintain;
Preferably a university/master degree in Mathematics or Software Engineering;
Excellent communication; written and spoken;
  B.Offer
Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide
Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com

Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands - Booking.com, KAYAK, Priceline, Agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. During 2019, the Company had consolidated revenues and net income of $15.1 billion and $4.9 billion, respectively, and a current market value of approximately $90 billion.
About the role
Booking Holdings is looking for an IT Support Team Lead to support the development and execution of our Center of Excellence (CoE) at Bangalore, India.  Booking Holdings will build technical expertise within these centers, to serve various brands and entities within the Holding portfolio.  The Bangalore COE is a key enabler of our global talent strategy for several technology functions such as Cybersecurity, Fraud monitoring/analytics, IT etc. In IT Services, we design, build and maintain all the corporate technology our Booking.com workforce needs day-to-day, so they can in-turn deliver great products to our customers.
A key enabler of success is the establishment of strong IT support capabilities and solutions in the Bangalore COE organization as well as the COE Program team.
The IT support Team lead role is responsible for assisting and enabling our workforce in our Bangalore COE, which includes providing excellent user support, analyzing and addressing IT related problems, and looking for solutions to automate or improve our processes.  This happens in close collaboration with our Global IT Services organization based in Amsterdam.  In addition, the IT support Team Lead role will be providing leadership, direction, and engagement to the team to ensure quality and effective teamwork.
B.Responsible
Technical responsibilities and duties
Ensure excellent technical support (in-person, remotely via phone, email or live chat) is provided to the COE workforce (both badged and outsourced resources) you you and your team
Ensure that hardware and software issues are dealt with swiftly, performing new starter setups, ordering equipment, and completing user account amendments while consulting with the IT services team in Amsterdam
Ensure a positive customer experience in a timely, efficient, and professional manner
Proactively provide regular communication to users and stakeholders on the progress of outstanding support tickets and resolution
Focus on quality with first time fixes and low reopened tickets
Assist where required in inventory and accurate Asset Management, provisioning across a range of devices and accessories
Actively participate in the creation and upkeep of knowledge base articles
Capture all support and project work via ticketing systems
Teach and instruct employees around software and hardware functionality
Constantly learn and take on new challenges
Effectively identify problems, escalating to other teams where necessary
Take delivery and provide installations of PC's, laptops, monitors, and peripherals when appropriate
Identify recurring problems, spot trends, and perform root cause analysis
Escalate major incidents rapidly to raise awareness of business-critical faults
Understand your customer, consulting widely and communicating effectively to all levels within the organization
Find efficiencies to reduce toil and develop automations to improve processes
Be up to date with any required content training
Participate in on call rotation schedules where appropriate
People and Stakeholder Management
Provide direction and guidance to the team in a dynamic and changing environment
Steer the team through effective communication according to team targets and goals
Take ownership of issues and be responsible for team actions
Facilitate experiment and innovation within the team
Understand the technical problems and provide guidance in effective problem resolution
Maintain the backlog and prioritize based on business needs
Empower team members and encourage better and more productive teamwork
Recognize and develop the talent of team members
Understand the impact of your actions to the business
Assess team members' performance according to the company guidelines
Act and behave as a role model for the team
Influence others by having and encouraging a positive attitude and mindset 
Provide meaningful reports and data to support your decisions or assessments
B.Skills
At least a Bachelor’s Degree in computer or engineering field, or technical training, or equivalent experience
At least 5 years of experience in technical customer support, IT operations, or systems administration.
At least 2 years of experience leading a team
Preferably work experience in COE and/or GBS environment
Confident in supporting desktop hardware and peripherals across a variety of devices
Strong knowledge and working experience of configuration, support and failure analysis of Windows and MAC/Apple operating systems
Good understanding of a Windows domain, DNS, DHCP, Active Directory and Microsoft Office
Good working knowledge of Slack, Google Workspace, Chrome, and Gmail
Experience using a ticketing system for logging, escalating, and resolving issues
Experience imaging machines with SCCM, JAMF, Casper or similar
Experience supporting mobile devices, phones, and tablets
Good understanding of wired and wireless networking and how to troubleshoot them
Experience troubleshooting standalone and network printers
Outstanding communication skills in English (written and verbal)
Team player and ability to work independently with limited supervision
Patience and the ability to remain calm under pressure, whilst showing initiative and considering the wider impact
A natural ability to learn quickly and to easily absorb technical knowledge
Self-motivated team player with a 'can-do' attitude
Excellent time-management skills;  and prioritizing work effectively
A logical, methodical approach to analyzing faults and solving problems, with a keen attention to detail
ITIL knowledge desirable 
Multiple years of experience as a hands-on IT Support technician
Experience managing teams; including prioritizing and planning
Ability to understand trends in data and be able to transform it into meaningful reports
Proven track record in developing talent and empowering members of the team
Excellent communications skills, adapting style to audience and situation
Experience in conducting performance reviews and giving constructive and effective feedback
Experience with delegating and empowering team members 
Comfort dealing with ambiguity and a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment
Travel Required : 10%-25% average during normal circumstances
About BKNG 
Booking Holdings is the world leader in online travel & related services. Our teams work around the clock to build and improve the technology that empowers people to more freely travel across borders, time zones, languages and cultures. At Booking Holdings, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world every day through seamless technology powered by our six major brands: 
Booking.com
KAYAK
priceline
agoda
Rentalcars.com
OpenTable
Through the Booking Holdings brands, we help our customers reach all corners of the earth. Our ability to provide great service rests on how well we understand our diverse customer base, which is why having a diverse team is so important to us. We bring together employees from all walks of life and we are proud to provide the kind of inclusive environment that stimulates innovation, creativity and collaboration.

Job Title: Head of Human Resources/ HR Leader
Job Description:
Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands - Booking.com, KAYAK, Priceline, Agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. During 2019, the Company had consolidated revenues and net income of $15.1 billion and $4.9 billion, respectively, and a current market value of approximately $60 billion.
About Role:
Booking Holdings is looking for an experienced people leader to lead the HR function in our delivery center in Bangalore, India. Booking Holdings would like to build technical expertise within these centers, referred to as ‘Centers of Excellence (COE)’ to serve various brands/entities within the Holding portfolio. This leadership role will support the establishment and scaling up the center from a people and talent perspective. This role will involve working closely with the COE Leader and other corporate stakeholders (HR, Program Management etc.) in developing and executing a world class talent management strategy and quickly establishing the Booking Holdings Bangalore COE as a top place to work and an employer of choice in India. 
The focus for 2022 Q2 onwards is to support the leadership in establishing the COE, lead the creation of a talent strategy, design a comprehensive HR policy suitable for the COE, create an end-to-end HR process, and lead talent recruitment efforts to attract the best talent to join and grow their careers at Booking Holdings’ Bangalore COE.
B. Responsible
There will be many measures of success to this role, however, at a high-level they fall into the following keys areas. Requiring a very hands-on approach in startup phase but will mature into a more established team over time.
Talent Acquisition & Employment Brand
Recruitment of temporary and permanent employees in Bangalore, India
Pipeline future workforce – responsible for establishing local University recruiting relationships and apprenticeship programs 
Create an “Employer of Choice” culture that attracts, develops and retains world class talent
People Operations & Culture 
Play an active part of Bangalore COE management team and contribute in developing a world class COE organization 
Support the COE and organizational leadership by being a trusted member of the core team of the Bangalore COE in helping drive COE strategy, operations and scale-up
Support build-up of a culture of innovation, excellence and high performance
Maintain a strong connection with the People Leadership Team (PLT) at Booking Holdings Headquarters 
Build & Manage HR team
Help create and mature all aspects of the People and HR function within the COE including the following HR related sub-functions: Talent Acquisition (TA), Compensation and Benefits (Total Rewards), Employee Relations (ER), Performance Management, HR policies/advisory, Workday administration, Leadership Development, Training, etc.
Lead and build out the HR / People Resourcing team at Bangalore COE
Monitor and stay up to date on recruitment best practices and trends in employer branding, and ensure that your team has the necessary competence and expertise to meet current and future business needs.
Workforce Planning & Analysis 
Plan for and anticipate short- and long-term people support needs
Responsible for the local configuration of a Workday tenant (that sits at a Booking Holdings level) to local in-country norms 
Work in partnership with leaders (HRBPs, process owners, team leads etc.) in business units/brands across the organization (including within the COE) to effectively and efficiently meet their people related needs/requirements.
B.Skills
Master’s degree in HR, organizational psychology, business administration or similar.
Minimum 7-10 years of broad-based HR experience; to include: HR Advisory, Talent Acquisition, Employment Branding and Total Rewards
Minimum 5 years in a leadership role, managing a team
Previous leadership experience in a Center of Excellence/Shared Services Center or similar customer-facing type of environment will be a plus
Deep understanding of offshore COE/Shared Services organizations and models.
Knowledge of and experience with how to attract new employees, including understanding of the unique needs of early career professionals (e.g., Millennials and GenZ)
Knowledge of social media and how to effectively use these channels to communicate and engage with different target audiences
Ability to motivate and develop others, including working thought other teams and managers
Ability to continually seek and strive for improvements in processes and the work you do, process improvement and OpEx minded
Understanding of the Indian employment law, regulatory environment, and educational system
Champion of new technology and confident user of various IT tools and technology platforms
Proficiency in English
Strategic leader with an aptitude for identifying and developing talent and building strong teams and organizational culture
Prior experience and success in creating step-change improvements to people processes and creating a world-class employee experience
International experience:  Self-awareness of communication style and cultural differences
Self-motivated and capable of operating independently with limited oversight.  Strong sense of personal accountability for work tasks. 
Comfort dealing with ambiguity and a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment
Travel Required: 10%-15% average during normal circumstances
About BKNG 
Booking Holdings is the world leader in online travel & related services. Our teams work around the clock to build and improve the technology that empowers people to more freely travel across borders, time zones, languages and cultures. About the company
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.
In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.
Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.
We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
 Booking.com core values
Think customer first
Succeed together
Own It
Learn Forever
Do the Right Thing
About the team
More customers choose to book their hotel on our app platform than on desktop now, and our car hire experience within the Booking.com app is soon to be our leading channel for booking a car.
The Car Rental Apps teams at Booking.com, play a pivotal role in building our app platforms that offer car hire capability for all our key brands and partnership programs; giving you the opportunity to shape the customer experience of hundreds of thousands of car hire bookers each year.
About the role
We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Product Manager who thrives in a fast-paced and collaborative environment, and lives and breathes app product innovation. You will report directly to a Senior Product Manager.
This role is for strategic thinkers who are analytical in approach. You will design, develop and implement products based on user needs and the company's strategy and product missions. You’ll be committed to providing creative solutions to user (customer and partner) needs, identifying opportunities to improve their experience.
Collecting and analysing data will be necessary to unearth product opportunities and validate ideas, whether in the form of competitive research, or various quantitative and qualitative methods.
 What You’ll Do
To successfully deliver change in a fast-paced working environment you will need to:
Develop a deep understanding of current and future customer needs
Have awareness of industry trends and new technologies in the mobile apps space 
Work with the Senior Product Manager and other stakeholders to define the overall strategy for your product area
Be accountable for the end-to-end delivery of products within your product area, partnering with Marketing, Commercial and Operational teams to make this happen
Work collaboratively, building strong relationships with a delivery team of developers, architects, designers and testers to design and deliver features that will delight our customers
Ensure the team has well defined epics and stories to work against and that these are delivered to meet the defined customer needs; seeking to fail fast, learn and iterate at pace
Be responsible for feature trade-offs and prioritisation during the product development process
Communicate well, keeping the relevant members of the product leadership team and other senior stakeholders up to date with progress
Your skills and experience:
Have 3+ years’ product management experience in an agile environment 
Exceptional understanding of agile methodologies, UX design principles and mobile best practices
Strong focus on metrics and KPIs; highly skilled in various quantitative and qualitative methods to unearth product opportunities and validate ideas
Strong analysis skills and techniques; including, writing user stories and documenting technical requirements
Excellent communication skills. You should be able to communicate concepts, ideas and complex problems with the business at all levels
Evidence of problem solving and generating creative solutions
Experience completing excellent product discovery
Desired skills:
Experience working with iOS & Android mobile apps in highly transactional e-commerce sites
Knowledge of Apple & Google’s design standards 
Deep understanding of e-commerce business models
Experience of working with data and SQL
Understanding of monitoring and analytical tools such as Kibana and Grafana
Benefits
25 vacation days (rising to 28) to go exploring
Generous accommodation discount, so you can explore for less
Bonus package
Pension with up to 10% matched company contribution
Huge learning and development platform tailored to you
Shopping and leisure discounts through Perkbox
Interest free travel loans/discounted car parking
Competitive maternity/paternity/adoption leave
Flexible working, including working from home
Wellbeing focus, with weekly onsite yoga
Mental health first-aiders and free face-to-face support

Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online hotel reservation service in the world) is looking for a Senior Fraud Analyst. The goal of the Fraud Operations team is to proactively protect, prevent, detect and respond to fraudulent behavior. The team is responsible for managing security and fraud threats across the business operations globally. Continuous improvement on detection and response capabilities is key. The Fraud Operations team is part of the Security Department within Technology.
We are looking for a Sr. Fraud Analyst who is motivated to take ownership for an array of actions to address incidents for which they are held accountable: Analysts investigate and resolve fraud cases from start to finish. On the one hand they must have great communication skills to proactively inform and involve relevant internal stakeholders (e.g. Customer Service, Legal, Technology, Finance) and mentor team members. On the other hand analysts are expected to proactively initiate innovation within security and fraud operations.

B.responsible
SME within the team, maintains consistency and quality across the team by performing quality reviews  and providing feedback to team members.
Persistently undertakes exploration of new fraud threats and propose and/or implement controls and mitigation plans
Ability to identify risks pertaining to campaigns run by the business and provide relevant feedback to the program leads. 
Ability to handle and report fraud cases from start to finish.
Communicate and involve relevant internal and external stakeholders to respond to escalations and incidents (fraud and security) as a first point of contact for all stakeholders. E.g. Legal, Customer Service, Finance, Partner Services;
Ability to drive complex projects with multiple stakeholders to conclusion with a high level of impact.
Contribute to or lead other projects which reduce fraud related losses while maintaining focus on a positive customer experience.
Work effectively with team members and leadership by communicating fraud trends and sharing ideas and knowledge in a constructive and positive manner.
Use a combination of manual and automated tools to proactively analyze various data.
Proposes/Develops new tools to prevent, detect and respond to fraud.
Develop, initiate, maintain, and revise automated strategies and approaches for Booking.com’s fraud operations within the big picture of the organization.
Provide training and support by sharing outcomes of analyses about fraud trends and patterns to relevant staff.
Looks at awareness from a strategic level and seeks to address gaps.
Works with the Product team to propose a new approach for fraud detection, new tooling requirements and process improvement.
Contribute to Booking.com’s growth through mentoring peers, interviewing, on-boarding and/or other recruitment efforts.
Able to perform independently with minimal support from the line manager.
Ability to perform well in a fast paced environment and positively adapt to change

B.skilled
At least 5 years of knowledge and experience with regard to fraud domain (both analytical and case management) and at least 3 years of experience in mentoring and coaching people
BSc, MSc or equivalent, preferably in Law, Computer Science, Criminology, Physics, Econometrics,  Economics or comparable
Strong analytical mindset, ability to use SQL, Excel, Visualization tools to translate data to identify business problems/solutions 
Excellent knowledge of scripting (Python/PySpark/R) and create notebooks for efficient querying. Able to perform code review and provide peer feedback
Must have strong decision making ability and be self-disciplined
Trustworthy character
Good and effective communication skills
Ability to prioritize incoming escalations and requests appropriately using clear communications
Self-starter and able to work independently and enjoys creating and implementing new initiatives
Comfortable and fluent in English, both written and spoken
Strong commercial attitude/business-driven and interest
Experience in the travel industry is a plus
Currently living in the Netherlands or willing to relocate to the Netherlands
 
B.offered
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits.  The Technology department has training and attends/speaks at global conferences.

Technical Product Manager - Insurance  
About the company
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. 
In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more. 
Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.
We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready. 
Booking.com core values
  Think customer first
  Succeed together
  Own It
  Learn Forever
  Do the Right Thing
About the team
Booking.com Insurance is the easiest way to protect your trip and travel with peace of mind.
As part of our Connected Trip vision, Booking.com has ambitious growth plans for the insurance business as it looks to develop a global footprint of insurance product offerings across the Group. 
Through innovation, industry sector knowledge and clear customer focus, the team’s challenge is to substantially enhance the group’s customer Insurance experience and drive a profitable account. 
Working in collaboration with leading industry partners, our insurance products are designed to give customers assurance they have the protection they need to allow them to relax and enjoy the trip -  great value cover backed by a first class experience should they need to make a claim.
About the Role
A key step towards achieving these goals is the delivery of a new suite of claims handling & policy admin tools that will enable our Insurance teams to offer a top quality claims service across the growing range of insurance products. 
The Technical Product Manager & their product team will be working within our existing Insurance Platform on new capabilities to interpret policy data, triage incoming claim requests, manage in-progress cases, integrate with third party claims handling services & underwriting partners and fulfil commercial and regulatory reporting requirements. 
Whilst the first use case is the replacement of a legacy system used by our car hire insurance, the new solutions will need to be quickly scaled to support claims across our emerging product portfolio. 
To drive this evolution we are looking for a highly motivated Technical Product Manager who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and lives to delight the customer. 
You’ll actively drive the product strategy for the product area, delivering product excellence and innovation working closely with your product team and with external systems partners. 
We expect you’ll be deeply committed to solving user pain points and identifying opportunities to improve their experience. 
You will put data at the heart of how you design, develop and implement product solutions that address clear user needs and are aligned to the company's vision and strategy.
Part of the Trips Business Unit of Booking.com based in Manchester, this role sits within our Insurance Product Group.
This is primarily an individual contributor role, where it is possible to coach and mentor others depending on skills, experience, development plans and business needs.
As part of a growing tech company, high performers can expect extensive opportunities for progression and development. 
  Responsibilities:
To successfully deliver innovative products in a fast-paced working environment you will need to:
Develop a deep understanding of current and future customer needs in respect of insurance cover and the supporting claims experience.
Gather data & insight from the insurance market, our sales funnel, competitors and our claims teams to identify and inform prioritisation of product opportunities 
Work with the Senior Product Manager and key stakeholders to define the overall vision, strategy and roadmap for your insurance product line
Maintain a strong focus on monitoring and measurement of your product to inform our commercial relationship with our insurance partners
Ensure your team are developing products in accordance with all relevant insurance regulatory and compliance guidelines 
Address any regulatory or compliance risks identified with your product, adapting to new legislation and regulatory changes by the required deadlines.
Complete all necessary insurance refresher training and CPD as per IDD guidelines 
Work collaboratively with a team of developers, designers and testers to deliver products that delight our customers
Be accountable for the end-to-end delivery of your product
Ensure the team has well defined epics & stories, aligned to Objectives and Key Results 
Write, review and take responsibility for clear, concise and comprehensive technical documentation.
Adhere to the default principles for architecture, quality and non-functional requirements
Work with agile coaches and your team to drive continuous efficiency improvements and better ways of working 
Communicate with multiple key stakeholders to keep them up to date and bought into your product development
Your skills and experience:
You will be working with our product teams, architects and principals to shape the future of our core Insurance platforms.  We expect you to have strong analytical skills, understand technology and be able to collaborate with stakeholders across the organisation. 
3-5 years experience working as a Product Manager in an insurance or other regulated product environment
Understand and enjoy the challenges of working within the financial services regulatory ecosystem
Robust business analysis skills, techniques including writing user stories, acceptance criteria and documenting technical requirements.
Experience completing excellent product discovery.
Proficient in working within an Agile product-based organisation.
Solid experience of modelling system workflows, components and data models.
Solid experience of running workshops.
Experience communicating concepts and ideas to stakeholders at all levels within organisations.
Confident personality to influence decision-making at all levels within an organisation.
Ability to simplify complex problems into component parts and evaluate systematically.
Evidence of problem solving and providing creative solutions.
 Desirable Skills: 
Experience of working on claims and / or CS systems.
Experience of working with external systems providers and technical partners.
Experience of working with data and SQL.
Understanding of monitoring and analytical tools such as Kibana and Grafana.

25 vacation days (rising to 28) to go exploring
Generous accommodation discount, so you can explore for less
Bonus package
Pension with up to 10% matched company contribution
Huge learning and development platform tailored to you
Shopping and leisure discounts through Perkbox
Interest-free travel loans/discounted car parking
