Job Summary
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online hotel reservation service in the world) and/or its various support companies throughout the world are looking for people to support the business in the fast-growing hotel markets.
As a member of the Supply Distribution team in Digital Partner Experience, your main responsibility is to positively influence the performance of our partners by providing them actionable insights based on guest behaviour and market trends. After exploring and investigating data driven insights the team validates the commercial opportunity. After which it can be turned into various partner facing communications such as product value propositions, content, information for account managers or partner-facing campaigns
During specific high customer demand moments or market events throughout the year the team will lead the creation of a global or regional campaign to drive commercial opportunities based on the insights collected. You will act as the overall owner of the campaign. For the execution of the campaign you will act as a requestor to the services departments, such as Marketing, who will design and execute the campaign into a multi channel digital campaign and collaborate with team to drive a go-to-market approach via Local Partner Services & Connectivity
The role manages programs and works closely with data analysts and other teams in the Partner Performance Marketing team, which sits within Digital Partner Experience. This role gathers insights and initiates commercial campaigns in order to scale the commercial performance management of Booking.com supply partners, alongside other teams such as Digital Platforms and Digital Channels.
You will be building and maintaining strong relationships and collaborations within the Accommodation Business Unit with functions like strategy, product and PMO services. And will be working with teams like Marketing, Digital Partner Experience, Local Partner Services & Connectivity who will be your liaison in actioning the validated insights.
You deliver and distribute insights and opportunities to drive the overall commercial impact for our partners. You are the business partner and initiator for data-driven, high impacting commercial campaigns based on the key insights that the team discovers.
B.Responsible
Insights finding, validation and distribution
Own and build ways of working that uncover market level and global travel insights from our platform (working with our analytical teams).
Validate, size and prioritize the opportunity of these insights for the business to act upon in order to drive partner performance
Distribute opportunities to business stakeholders who can execute or capitalize on the opportunities.
Work with analytical teams to report back on success measurement of opportunities distributed, including reporting on proportional percentage of potential opportunity unlocked.
Work closely with stakeholders across the business to ensure these insights gain visibility and that relevant teams are kept in the loop
Campaign ownership
Own and initiate cross channel campaigns such as Summer Peak Season
Develop hypotheses and ‘problems to solve’ along with all other required inputs for existing Marketing teams to build and design campaign tactics, GTM plans and campaign narratives.
Determine and deliver target audiences including partner type breakdowns and populations based on the nature and characteristics of the opportunity.
Manage stakeholders across the business from product, to marketing, to leadership on the objectives and commercial goals of the campaigns.
Leverage additional channels alongside marketing to drive reach & engagement, such as Account Management and 3rd party providers.
Commercial Program Management
Coordinate large scale, complex projects and own the backlog of the program.
Distribute commercial insights and opportunities to various parts of the business to be actioned in a scalable and effective way
Build and define success measurements and metrics for our commercial projects and opportunities that are distributed
Work closely with analyst teams are part of projects to ensure data-driven decision making
Identify dependencies, parallel processes, roadblocks and milestones that need to be incorporated into project planning
Identify and include all relevant teams and stakeholders that need to be involved, consulted and informed.
Clearly communicate outcomes, successes and learnings to relevant audiences, including working groups, management, and leadership teams.
Stakeholder Management
Establishing long-term, productive relationships within the organization that will be contributing to their own and their team’s performance.
Be widely accepted in the organisation as owning a topic that adds business value.
  B.Skilled
Bachelor's degree or higher in an analytically focused degree such as Marketing, Economics, Engineering, Science, etc.
Experience in business analysis to find and create business opportunities.
Ability to prioritize and be decisive on which opportunities are best to follow-through or execute
Experience to collaborate with marketing (communication) teams driving global impact in a Business-to-Business context.
Proven track record of commercial impact through digital marketing efforts.
Proven experience in using data and insights to discover commercial opportunities, and swiftly take advantage of those.
Proven track record in project management and leading multi disciplinary projects.
Proven track record of change management, supporting team members and business stakeholders.
Expert in leading through influence with stakeholders.
Strong and high energy team player demonstrating flexibility and positive communication that motivates and influences achievement of team objectives.
Business and technology acumen to quickly understand Booking’s objectives and the way all parts of the company work together and define key results in their own area and drive business cases accordingly.
Creative thinker with excellent analytical skills and a learning and experimentation mindset.
Exceptional oral and written communication with the ability to facilitate discussions with both execution and leadership teams

The Company

It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
Do you enjoy taking ownership and being responsible for your own internal business portfolio? Do you thrive in building strong relationships and inspiring partners about new products and services? If your answer is “yes”, you might have what it takes to be the next Account Manager at our amazing Barcelona office!

Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com TM, the world’s leading online hotel reservation service) is looking for people to support our business in the fast-growing hotel markets.
B.responsible
You support Booking.com BV; you are responsible for informing and consulting its accommodation partners in regards to their business performance, market opportunities and industry trends. You will empower partners on how to use the system, tools and available products of Booking.com BV with the goal of optimizing their performance on the platform and creating an amazing experience for Booking’s customers.
B.capable
Communicating effectively: you can clearly express ideas and information to others and flex your style according to the specific situation and audience
Managing your market: you excel at evaluating local market characteristics, trends and drivers, and you effectively prioritize and manage the performance of a portfolio of accounts to business value
Identifying and articulating Partner needs: you are capable to create value for Partners by identifying, clarifying and prioritizing partner needs
Formulating and positioning solutions: you enjoy creating “win-win” value for partners by matching needs to relevant offerings and presenting these in compelling ways
Gaining commitment: you have the capability to move partner conversations forward and lead conversations to a successful outcome
Representing Booking.com: you can exhibit professional behavior and act as a role model of the Booking.com values before, during and after interactions with partners
Self-awareness, managing and developing yourself: you have the capability to achieve business goals and make the difference in interacting with partners by recognizing the emotions of oneself and of others and to use this information to guide thinking and behavior
B.skilled
2 years of experience in a relevant account management function
Fluent English and Spanish
Affinity or experience within e-commerce and/or travel industry
Pro-active, sense of responsibility and can work independently
Accurate, strong analytical skills and an eye for detail
Team player, self-motivated, flexible and open to change
Positive attitude
Hotel School, or University background preferred
Driver’s license
Availability to travel up to 50%
You already have a work permit to work in Spain
B.offered
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and competitive compensation, including bonus. We also offer what is called the “Booking Deal” with competitive benefits.
Booking.com BV is the world’s #1 accommodation site and the 3rd largest global e-commerce player. The diverse team, 15,000 strong, is united by a single mission: to empower people to experience the world. We connect travellers with the world’s largest selection of incredible places to stay, including everything from apartments, vacation homes, and family-run B&Bs to 5-star luxury resorts, tree houses and even igloos. Each day, more than 1,200,000 room nights are reserved on our platform.

Cyber Security Incident and Response Analyst
  The Cyber Security Incident Response Analyst (CSIRT Analyst) is a key player in providing detection, investigation and response to cyber security attacks and threats such as ransomware, spear-phishing, APT. This highly specialised technical subject matter expert position focuses on investigating threats and alerts within large-scale cross-platform environments, perform threat hunting and digital forensics in order to identify intrusions and effectively respond to mitigate security threats on the business.
Key responsibilities:
Performs technical investigation on complex security incidents to achieve efficient mitigation for active threats and identification of the root cause.
Monitors and triages different alert sources to detect potential suspicious or malicious activity, in order to trigger the proper investigation and response if needed.
Performs quality hands-on technical incident response, digital forensics, log analysis, and threat hunting.
Performs incident handling and assists Incident Lead during security incidents.
Coordinates escalation, response, resolution, and reporting of cybersecurity incidents.
Masters and uses CSIRT’s playbooks, runbooks, workflows, operational documentation, and processes. Contributes to the writing and maintaining of all such documents.
Looks for opportunities to improve documentation and standardisation of CSIRT processes
Owns and delivers on assigned projects (often around improvements to detections, processes and playbooks) while balancing execution and deliveries with operations and IR workload; Supports other team members in projects.
Drives continuous improvements of our detection and response capabilities quality and efficiency by identifying and owning improvement areas in the technology, methods, processes (including opportunities around detection tuning and automation).
Contributes to Booking.com’s growth through interviewing, on-boarding, or other recruitment efforts
  Knowledge and skills:
This role requires technology subject matter expertise in performing hands-on technical incident response, in-depth technical investigations and digital forensics (DFIR). It is an individual who reads logs, collects technical evidence and puts together the full picture. The ideal candidate is well plugged in the world of hacking and defense and adversary techniques, all with a hand-on keyboard perspective.
4+ years of operational security experience (SOC, Incident Response, Malware Analysis, Forensic Analysis, etc.)
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience and relevant certification (such as  GCIH, GCFA, GCFE, GCIA, GSEC, GCED, GREM, OSCP, OSCE  or similar)
Experience working independently to detect, handle, investigate and effectively respond to cybersecurity incidents
Ability to assess security incidents quickly and communicate/coordinate a course of action to respond to the incident, while mitigating risk and limiting the impact
Practical experience identifying adversary techniques, tactics, and procedures with enterprise security tools with a demonstrable understanding of modern attacker methodologies. 
Experience developing and maintaining operations playbooks, runbooks, and operational documentation.
Robust understanding of IT fundamentals across networking, system, cloud, virtualisation platforms and application layers and advanced understanding of at least one operating system (Windows, Linux, OSX)
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills in order to share knowledge and to communicate effectively with different stakeholders (IT and business partners)
Experience with projects or issues of high complexity that require knowledge across multiple technical areas and business units.
Willingness to be on-call, work non-standard hours upon need.
Highly disciplined and motivated: a self-starter who is able to both work independently or as a member of a team

As a Machine Learning Manager you are a driver of discipline, generating significant business impact directly and indirectly, and craft the direction of product initiatives by being driven and having full ownership of projects. You are responsible for a team of Machine Learning Scientists. You will not only work as a coach for your people but also as a technical leader, ensuring that the right technical decisions are made when building our product.
At Marketing Messaging, which is part of Booking’s Marketing department, we are developing ML tools to create personalized messages, push notifications, rewards & incentives to our customers.  You are a subject-matter expert in the theory behind one or more of the following areas of machine intelligence: recommendation systems, classification/regression problems, NLP/Computer Vision, uplift modeling and their implementation as end-to-end products that generate direct business impact. You define the strategy and vision for how to generate outsized impact through automated intelligence for a product by driving a research agenda and development plan from ideation to prototyping to full productionisation.
As a machine learning manager you will need to collaborate with different teams and stakeholders to ensure we provide messages to the right customers at the right time depending on their search intent. The team has a wide range of focus areas and stakeholders, from predicting customer’s behaviours to optimizing the content of the emails or the time of the mails and notifications, personalizing the rewards and picking the right audience are the areas of focus. The team will be responsible for managing and developing Machine Learning models and data pipelines, promoting code quality and best engineering practices.We value innovation, ownership and a result-driven attitude.

Build a strong team within their area, by coaching and developing individual contributors
Prioritise work in collaboration with product managers and other technical leaders in the department, depending on business needs and keeping stakeholders aligned at all times.
Translate machine learning vision and strategy into planning and execution, and ensure timely delivery of their plans.
Make things happen by maintaining motivation and conveying a sense of urgency, focusing on outcomes and accomplishments, while respecting the need to balance long- and short-term goals, by applying influencing techniques and decision making skills.
Develop innovative ML models, algorithms, and engineering approaches or identify existing ones, with the potential to impact our business. Design and execute applied research plans to understand, apply, test, evolve, and generalise these technologies into reusable frameworks.
Translate business problems into viable, reliable and robust ML and AI solutions, accounting for constraints of the production environment.
Monitor product health, performance and business impact and act accordingly when requirements are not met.
Solve issues by applying methods and insights gained from a variety of disciplines, navigating a variety of environments.
Drives, coaches and mentors others through evidence and clear communication, explaining advanced technical concepts in simpler terms.
Continuously evolve their craft. Keep up to date with industry and academic standard methodologies, periodically explore new technologies, introduce them to the machine learning community and promote their application in areas where they can generate impact.
Actively contribute to Machine Learning at Booking.com through training, exploration of new technologies, interviewing,onboarding and mentoring colleagues.
Push for improvements, scaling and extending machine learning tooling and infrastructure, collaborating with central teams.
  B.Skilled
Experience designing and executing end-to-end research and development plans and generating impact through large-scale machine learning model development. If possible evidenced by peer-reviewed publication, patents, open sourced code or the like.
Familiarity in the areas like e.g. Recommender Systems, Deep Learning, Information Retrieval, Computer Vision, Speech Recognition, Causal Inference, scaling ML models, etc
Relevant work or academic experience (MSc + 5 years of working experience, or PhD + 3 years of working experience), involved in the application of Machine Learning to business problems.

Experience on multiple machine learning facets: working with large data sets, model development, statistics, experimentation, data visualization, optimization, software development.

Strong working knowledge of Python, Hadoop, SQL, R, Spark or similar technologies.
Working experience with version control systems.
Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.
3+ years leading a team in a growing, fast-paced environment.

The company:
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
The role:
Booking.com™ is looking for a full time Office Administrator in our Paris office. 
The purpose of Office Administrator is to deliver a functional, safe, healthy, sustainable, welcoming and inspiring environment to everyone who enters our offices. So that our people can focus on their work to build and develop the world’s leading experiences platform while all logistical and physical environment topics are being taken care of.  
As Office Administrator you will manage the flawless and timely execution of all tasks according to the guidelines, processes and contracts that ensure an efficiently run office.These tasks range from the safety and security of an office to the maintenance and community building of the local teams. 
The Office Administrator is responsible for the flawless execution of all core responsibilities directly or indirectly through external service providers. 
In principle, the Office Administrator role is based in the local office to support day to day on-site operations, local business needs and can also be required to support other office locations remotely as well as by travelling to these locations when required. 
This role requires a human/user-centric and a commercial approach and attitude: understanding the needs of the local teams and aligning these with the global guidelines of all stakeholders.

Support central teams and external stakeholders like suppliers, HR, IT Services and Travel, Finance, Corporate Security, Global communication

Job Title: Senior Project Manager - Accommodations / Partner Services
Job Description:
The Accommodations Business Unit plays a vital role in the company’s future success and has many processes / mutual KPIs and relationships to manage and maintain with other Business Units and Functions. The Business Operations team in Accommodations is responsible for the governance and programme management of strategic initiatives within the unit and the unit’s dependencies with other Business Units and Functions across the company - essentially establishing the connective tissue between strategy and operational execution.  
The Senior Project Manager will be part of the Accommodations Business Operations team while his/her main responsibility is to organize the reporting cadence and planning cycle within the Global Partner Services as a sub department of Accommodations. Aside from this the Senior Project Manager will be responsible for project management of prioritized initiatives within the Global Partner Services scope. The Senior Project Manager will partner with the various teams within Global Partner Services as well as the central Accommodations Strategy & Business Operations team to facilitate the work occurring between them and will also actively support the teams in identifying and managing relevant dependencies between them and other teams in the organisation. 
The Senior Project Manager will ensure that the Global Partner Services team's roadmaps/plans focus on agreed business priorities, dependencies and strategies, and they deliver against the shared objectives and main activities with key milestones that have been approved by the Accommodations Leadership Team.

Structure and coordinate execution of operational and strategic plans of Global Partner Services by managing key stakeholders, dependencies, and reporting on progress of the key objectives according to the business governance cadence
Drive the Business Planning process for Global Partner Services by helping to document the project goal, KPIs, dependencies, roadmap and main deliverables via organisation planning tools (e.g. JIRA Align).
Lead independently low / medium complexity projects with global impact (cross-functional) driving them through execution, analysis, recommendation and implementation
Apply structured methodology to lead project/change management activities
With limited supervision, identify, define and scope the opportunities. 
Own the successful delivery of the end-to-end project lifecycle
Contributes to improving key processes, to secure accountability for each critical project
Apply change management processes and tools to create a strategy to support adoption of the changes required by a project or initiative.

Ability to work and productively interact with different stakeholders up to Director level.
Communication of the project updates, insights and recommendations across all stakeholders
Ensure a project closing and correct handover to Business as Usual.

Job Title: Global Operational Excellence Project Lead - Partnerships
Job Description:
The OPEX Project lead is a role model in driving and delivering complex process improvement (including  roles, performance and behaviors) initiatives from beginning to end within the Strategic Partnerships department. These improvements might be behavioral, technological or process focused and designed  to improve efficiency, partner experience (as measured by PSAT), employee experience  and/ or for legal purposes. The OPEX Project lead is a role model in prioritizing and making tactical  decisions in the interest of business results and they effectively communicate the initiative and the  results to a variety of stakeholders within and outside of Partnerships, including senior management. The OPEX  Project lead also coaches and supports other colleagues with their in-depth knowledge of Lean Six Sigma  and stakeholder skills.

PARTNERSHIPS
Our Partnerships department is composed of 400+ people in 20+ countries driving a significant share of B.com’s overall business. The team is responsible for all of the demand facing B2B relationships at B.com with full accountability for the demand facing B2B platform and suite of products, business development and account management, and B2B marketing.
We have product development teams based in Amsterdam and Manchester, with central functions and operations in Amsterdam and regional account management teams globally. Constant interaction with partners at the top of their game requires a high pace of innovation, solid understanding of travel distribution and tech, and a business acumen steeped in B2B.

KLM

Senior Director of Software Architecture
Our Company
Established in 1996 in Amsterdam, Booking.com has grown from a small Dutch start-up to the third largest ecommerce company in the world. Booking.com is the largest business within Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) and accounts for the vast majority of Booking Holdings’ total revenue. Booking Holdings is a leading Fortune 500 e-commerce conglomerate with a market cap of approximately $100 billion.
With a mission to make it easier for everyone to experience the world, Booking.com invests in digital technology that helps take the friction out of travel. Booking.com connects travelers with the world’s largest selection of incredible places to stay, including everything from apartments, vacation homes, and family-run B&Bs to 5-star luxury resorts and even tree houses. The Booking.com website and mobile apps are available in over 43 languages and customers can reach Booking.com 24/7 for assistance and support in over 43 languages. As Booking.com envisions a future in which it will serve customers a one-stop solution for all travel-related needs, we are working towards offering a fully ‘Connected Trip’, in which every aspect of the travel experience can be planned and booked through us. We are determined to build the number 1 travel brand in the world! 
At Booking.com, the decisions we make are a reflection of our Values -  they reflect what is important to us, both as individuals and as an organization. When they are shared, they build unity in a group. They build culture:
Think customer first. We obsess about adding value for our customers - guests, partners, colleagues - to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
Own it. We deliver on our promises, make informed decisions and prioritize to get the important things done today.
Learn forever. We are resilient, take time to reflect, and seek to learn – from colleagues, from the outside world and from our failures.
Succeed together. We celebrate team success, through making connections, building trust and valuing the diverse perspectives of others.
Do the right thing. We get the right results the right way. For each other, our communities and the world around us.
  Booking.com Leadership Team
Chief Executive Officer, Glenn Fogel
SVP, Chief Finance Officer (interim), Sue D’Emic                                                                                           
SVP, Chief Marketing Officer, Arjan Dijk                                                                                                                                                
SVP, Chief Legal Officer, Maria Barros
SVP, Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano   
SVP, Trips, Bryan Batista   
SVP, Accommodations, James Waters
SVP, Chief Technology Officer, Rob Francis
SVP, Fintech, Daniel Marovitz 
Profile Senior Director of Software Architecture
The role resides in London or Amsterdam and reports into the Chief Technology Officer, who leads the Central Technology organization. Central Technology provides core services to all business units for Booking.com.
The Senior Director of Software Architecture is responsible for our technical strategy and delivering capabilities for building world-leading software and applications for the online travel market. In order to achieve our business goals it is key to boost innovation and accelerating our product velocity to deliver more value to guests is one of our business competitive advantages. This role will identify friction and gaps in our existing technology stack. mitigate, then select and adapt  best-of-class technologies in the industry for use in our business according to Booking’s unique needs and priorities. The role will evangelise technology and software engineering excellence across the company.
You obsess about how to deliver great technology to accelerate product development and make the customer experience better. You look to encourage innovation and ways to help engineers use better tools and technologies to delight our guests and partners. You question the status quo, eliminate systems and processes that are not useful, and allocate resources to areas that make a difference to the business.
You oversee programs for quality and operational excellence, and build mechanisms to measure and simplify data collection and reporting. You create and maintain the standards for rigor and consistency of operations of our services, plan for capacity and growth in the business, and act on signals you find to solve problems before they affect our guests.
You develop and build a world class engineering organisation. You create scalable mechanisms for engineering teams to collaborate on big projects while promoting team decision making. You hire and develop talent through role modeling behaviors, setting clear expectations on performance and deliverable, and direct feedback on both successes and areas to learn from.
Your customers are developers and service owners across Booking. You will understand their business and the unique requirements of our business, and create standards and processes that accelerate their work and minimise friction to software engineering. Your North Star is that writing great software is creative work and development time is a precious and scarce resource.
Tasks & Responsibilities
Executing: Lead strategic technology initiatives for building world class software and products from platform languages, microservice architectures, compute environments from serverless to no-code tools, and the build, test, and deployment lifecycle of our software products.
Optimizing: you are responsible for constantly challenging the status quo trying to find new and better ways to bring great experiences to our Customers.
Extending: you set and drive a mid and long term innovation agenda to achieve the goals mentioned above with the ultimate goal to drive Customer Equity for Booking.com.
Developing teams `& talents: you set the talent strategy and drive talent development, constantly raising the bar for performance, behavior and contributions to other teams within Booking.com.
Developing culture: you maintain the current culture and actively participate in changing and challenging the culture based on changing needs. You are a role model of Think Customer First and promote customer centricity at all times.
Collaborate across Booking.com: in this role you play a vital part in helping peers develop their business units strategies in order to accelerate growth for Booking.com, defining goals alongside the Marketing, Technology, Finance, Trips Business Unit and other departments.
Developing: You set the talent needs and develop teams to deliver the strategy of the various business areas of which you are in charge.
Company strategy: you actively follow and translate developments outside Booking.com to inform our global strategy. This includes looking at market dynamics, competitor dynamics, economic dynamics and technology developments. You challenge and help set our strategy around M&A and hiring and developing Senior Talent.
Character traits: open mind, learning attitude, transparent behavior, positive, overachiever, strong communicator, proactive and collaborative.
Leading in: You actively and rigorously drive towards being able to take complete ownership and control of the domain you are responsible for by clearly defining what success (metrics) look like, setting ambitious objectives and transparently tracking progress against those, always proactively reflecting on the ROI of the effort. You hold others to the same discipline.
Leading in: you actively display, advocate and develop the leadership principles and behaviors across Booking.com, both internal and external.
Leading in: You are a shining example of rigorous, high pace execution with a healthy disregard for organisational boundaries, and conventional wisdom.
  Ideal background
12+ years of engineering leadership with demonstrated success
Experience in modern engineering languages and computer science fundamentals, platforms (containers, serverless, no-code), frameworks and creating simple and robust platforms.
  Experience leading managers and multi-disciplinary teams of engineers, SREs, technical product managers, and solution architects
Experience leading departments operationally and innovation (vision, roadmap, setting KPIs and objectives, ideation and implementation process, people management)
Experience operating large, Internet scale applications and distributed systems spanning multiple languages, platforms, front and back end services, networks and public cloud platforms. Demonstrated passion for details, and both day over day improvements and long term outlook.
Industry experience at fast moving, innovative global technology companies;

Booking.com is the world’s #1 accommodation site and the 3rd largest global e-commerce player. Our diverse team, ~12,000 strong, is united by a single mission: to empower people to experience the world. Whether in our Amsterdam HQ or at one of our 200 offices worldwide, we work hard to help make more than a million travel dreams come true every single day. 
In 2021 Booking established its own specific Fintech business unit. Already a sizable organisation of 350 FTE, we are still in hyper-growth (min 40% YoY increase), at the center of innovation of our new products and therefore of key strategic importance to Booking.com and across the wider Holdings group. Fintech’s scope includes complexities on multiple dimensions (i.e. locations, growth, brands), and most importantly we work with inspiring, ambitious, positive and smart colleagues from all over the world. 
Within the Fintech business unit, we have the Financial Systems teams, which are responsible for our internal financial tooling (i.e. SAP, Klarna, Billing) and are leading one of the biggest collaboration projects across our different brands. This puts the Financial Systems teams at the center of rapid change, growth and increased complexity, even more compared to the rest of the Fintech business unit. It is for this reason, combined with the strategic significance of the Financial Systems teams to the wider business, that we are now looking for a Senior HR Business Partner to join the HR Advisory team.
This Senior HR Business Partner role will partner, influence and advise business leaders on People related topics, actively engaging in the strategic and/or tactical direction, problem statements, business goals and priorities and how they impact the company. This role is considered to be fully part of the Financial Systems Leadership Team. 
You will report to the Senior HR Manager and work closely together with your business, other HR Advisors and our Central People Teams. 
B.responsible 
In all Business Partner roles, the core objective is to advise and partner with (different levels of) management of an allocated business unit across various (HR) topics, as well as manage (and identify) HR policy changes & its People calendar to contribute optimally to achieving organisational objectives through sufficient staffing levels, capabilities and effective organisational set up & culture. 
For the Senior HR Business Partner role, the expectations and responsibilities include:
Partner, coach and challenge business leaders and people managers on People related topics, actively engaging on tactical and strategic topics, problem statements, business goals and priorities, balancing the HR, manager, employee, and company perspectives.
Partner with (Sr) HRD or Manager to drive the People Agenda in the Financial Systems area and vice versa, therefore also proactively partnering with the Central People teams to enable the Financial Systems team to achieve its objectives. 
Strengthen the collaboration & culture of the Financial Systems teams (in the context of rapid change and high complexity) with the rest of the Fintech business unit as a priority, but also towards other business units and brands is key.
Lead the Talent Management for the teams in your scope in collaboration with the leadership team and its people managers. 
Responsible for working within organisational design principles and leading change initiatives with regard to structure design and development, reorganisations. Own the Strategic Workforce Planning & Operating Model planning together with the business and the Central People teams for Financial Systems. 
Ability to proactively signal possibilities & risks (based on data) of HR policies, procedures and processes (or lack thereof) and contribute to solutions for optimization, creating buy-in with all relevant stakeholders, guide implementation and execution in your scope (and beyond when relevant).  
Responsible for end to end delivery and adoption of critical People topics within the teams you partner with (e.g. promote and enable engagement conversations, programs that attract and retain talent, career & skills framework).
Responsible for ensuring the capabilities needed in the respective organisations are there to deliver the business targets, with a focus both on the short and long term. (e.g. partner with leadership to map capabilities & contribute to the solution to achieve this)
Create tailored solutions for people's challenges in partnership with (relevant) Central People teams. 
To be the voice of the business within the People Department. Accountable for identifying, predicting and articulating key people related business challenges. Responsible to co-create required interventions, acting as the bridge between the business and the People teams. 
Represent the People Department in front of your business leaders. Ensure the business receives consistent quality of service and guidance so the business feels the People Department is acting as one voice.
Change management incl. WoCo responsibility: Partner with your business on change initiatives. As necessary, support in WoCo consultations and preparation to ensure that HR topics are of high quality and planned well in advance. Guide your business through the WoCo process.
B.skilled 
5-8 years experience within People topic (strong preference for HR Advisory experience)
Able to develop strong relationships and influence a wide range of stakeholders within the organisation, including being comfortable to partner, coach and challenge senior C-level executives
Is excited to work in a highly complex, fast moving, international & positive environment, with a great opportunity to make a significant impact 
Demonstrable contribution to the quality and effectiveness of all people managers
Able to guide the organisation through the changing and dynamic environment via its managers
Proactive and thought-through approach to problem solving
Previous experience in a commercial, international matrix environment; 
Proactive, data-driven, takes initiative, able to prioritise without close supervision; 
Fluent in English
Dutch Labor Law experience is a plus

Job title:  Manager - Strategy and Operations - Horizontals
Location: Amsterdam
Team: Strategy and Operations 
We are well known for our experience and selection in Accommodation, The Trips BU is pivotal to our ambition to make it easier to travel the world by offering a multi-product and full trip experience. Today you can book Accommodations, Flights, Taxis and Rental cars on Booking.com but we are just getting started to make this a seamless experience. Our daily mission is to make travel, experience and exploration accessible for everyone, everywhere.
The Horizontal team in the Trips Business Unit is a key piece to enable the Connected Trip enablement, such as driving cross sell optimization, trip value propositions and Multi-Product experience. The Strategy and Ops Program Manager will be responsible for the strategy, operational governance and program management of all the work streams related to the Horizontal product team.  
The Strategy and Operations Manager will be part of the Horizontal Managing Team (MT) and support the Senior Director Horizontal and the rest of the MT to make sure the ambitious 2022 objectives are met cross all the different teams belonging to the organization (Trip Foundations, Packages, Multi Product, Data & Analytics). The role will be the single point of contact for all things strategy and business operations to the Sr Director Horizontal and the VP of Trips Tech org.
  The Role
Strategy (c.25% of role)
Develop a long term strategy for the Horizontal team and partnering with their MT to define exciting and ambitious objectives to continue to deliver the Connected Trip.
Identify strategic opportunities to optimize the cross sell impact that can be driven centrally across all the different verticals by partnering with FP&A and the Analytics team.
Work with all key stakeholders across the horizontal team to translate the key elements of the strategy into department level visions, roadmaps and goals
In partnership with the Product leadership, drive the quarterly planning process and make sure it has the right buy-in from all the different Trips verticals and horizontal teams. 
Work in partnership with the Product and Tech teams to challenge the track level goals and metrics to make sure they are consistent with the Trips vision
-> Key strategic topics: Promotions + Cross-sell, Packages, the future of customer data, multi-product future state
Business Operations (c.60% of role):
Define and implement an operating model for the newly defined management team for the area. This includes setup the governance for the different areas, identifying the right cadence and facilitate the meetings
Make sure that the whole Horizontal team is fully and correctly embedded into the Trips Operational cadence, such as OKRs updates, leadership updates, etc.
Support the Horizontal Leadership and the Product management team with the preparations of the Quarter Business Reviews, by making sure they include reliable and exciting plans for the team.  
Leads independently the preparation and the facilitation of the Trips horizontal and verticals teams connect meeting (aka Shiproom) to grant a reliable tracking of the quarter main milestones and present relevant data and learnings from the launched experiments.
Support leadership with the communications strategy for the horizontal org, such as Trips All Hands and other Trips comms.
Be a partner for the horizontal product and tech leadership to make sure the org is acting consistently with the rest of Trips and Booking.com way of working.
Support the data team to make sure they have the right engagement and buy in from the remaining Trips vertical teams. 
Strategic planning & Business Operations: Supports the budget and planning yearly cycle, driving some workstreams 
  Program Management (c15% of role):
Responsible with limited to no supervision to define scope, kick-off, manage and execute every phase of initiatives related to the areas, specifically:
Create clear planning documents and roadmaps together with involved teams and departments such as Trip Foundations or Data
Implement the right level of control for the planned milestones and make sure the eventual critical dependencies are highlighted and mitigated.
Establish a solid governance routine which involves (sr) mgmt updates and reporting. Holds stakeholders and business partners accountable of next steps and objectives and proactively identifies risks and issues.
Enables teams & leaders to make quality decisions and supports prioritization exercises.
Think customer first by identifying opportunities to improve the impact & experience for our customers (internal or external), partners and our business.
Establish a productive working relationship between all the involved teams and functions to deliver against our strategy.
Productively interacts with and manages senior stakeholders (up to VP level).
Responsibilities
5-8 years experience in similar role
Proven track record to independently lead high complexity (end-2-end) projects, drive multiple medium complexity projects and/or manage program portfolio of projects 
Strategic mindset and business strategy background
Have a solid business understanding, independently use quantitative and qualitative data to drive decision making
Analytical skilled and mastering data handling and measuring success, ability to tell a clear story with data/insights
Think holistically and be able to articulate long term vision for the project management craft and own programs
Strong interpersonal skills focused on collaboration. Building and maintain lasting relationships and connections with diverse teams, across the organisation and outside
Effectively communicate including large audiences
Ability to influence and steer leadership, senior management and groups (up to Senior Director level). Can productively interact with VP level
Ability to break up a complex problem into actionable and easy to understand solutions.
Able to function well within ambiguity and in a constantly changing environment

We are well known for our experience and selection in Accommodation, The Trips BU is pivotal to our ambition to make it easier to travel the world by offering a multi-product and full trip experience. Today you can book Accommodations, Flights, Taxis and Rental cars on Booking.com but we are just getting started to make this a seamless experience. Our daily mission is to make travel, experience and exploration accessible for everyone, everywhere.
Our Strategy, Business OPs and PMO team is a key enabler to make sure the department key objectives and the right governance and execution are driven in a reliable and efficient way. 
The Senior Project Manager is responsible for helping implement a governance model between Trips and the other B.com departments for all those shared objectives and opportunities and for the key dependencies management. As well, the role will be responsible for the governance and project management of initiatives within the Trips Department where it is relevant. 
Specifically the Senior Project Manager role will partner with the various teams within/ external to Trips Department to facilitate the work occurring between them and the business units and centralized functions. They will help the teams to scope and plan the projects by helping to document the project goal, KPIs, roadmap  and main deliverables.
The Role
In partnership with the Business Ops Mgr, be responsible to create a cross departments governance model which can efficiently support the execution of Trips key initiatives. 
Create a proficuous networking with the other departments PMOs teams and with the key areas leaders in Trips
Implement a regular and reliable tracking of the Trips main areas initiatives and operational KPIs.
Help implementing an efficient way of working / Project management standards and useful resources 
Lead independently medium complexity projects with global impact (cross-functional) driving them through execution, analysis, recommendation and implementation
Engage and influence stakeholders at all levels inside and if required outside of the organisation: work collaboratively with business unit partners and corporate support teams to drive enterprise strategy execution and partner on segment or functional strategy projects
Drive the Project scoping and Planning by helping to document the project goal, KPIs, roadmap  and main deliverables.
Track and report progress; Creates clear planning documents together with involved departments 
Ensure a project closing and correct handover to Business as usual.
Ability to work and productively interact with different stakeholders up to Director level.
Skills Required
Solid familiarity with project/change management approaches, tools and phases of the project lifecycle
Ability to lead multiple low /medium complexity projects or portfolio of projects
A solid understanding of how people go through the change curve and the change process
Ability to establish and maintain strong relationships (both within a team and with wider stakeholders)
Ability to work effectively and influence up to Director level

Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations and under pressure
Organized with a natural inclination for planning strategy and tactics
With limited supervision, ability to use quantitative and qualitative data to drive decision making 
Strategic thinking, able to contribute to long term vision  
Strong Problem solving and root cause identification skills
Basic business acumen and understanding of organizational issues and challenges
Experience with large-scale organizational change efforts is an advantage
Knowledge of similar industries and/or business projects is an advantage.
PMP or Agile Project Management or equivalent certification is preferred.

Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online hotel reservation service in the world) is looking for people to support our business travel product, Booking.com for Business. Booking.com is offering a unique opportunity for an Analyst to join the Booking for Business team within the Strategy, Sustainability and Business Development Department, based in Amsterdam.
The Data Analyst role is key in building a robust analytics framework that enables data-driven decision making by providing analytical insights, developing performance indicators, optimizing data capture processes and building scalable analytics tools. They offer actionable insights into the performance of the operational teams as well as technical products e.g Machine learnings models for bidding optimizations of our display and social ads campaigns. In addition, the Data Analyst  builds forecasting models, supports A/B testing experiments, and data flow integrations both within Booking.com and externally with our partner Serko based in New Zealand.
This role is critical for the organization as it provides the most crucial insights and supports change management with data engineering large datasets, building automating workflows and visualization tools that facilitate efficiency and scalability.
  B.Responsible
  Designing key metrics that quantify the success of operational and product initiatives 
  Support operational teams in capacity planning, forecasting with automated reporting solutions
  Organize and present your findings in a meaningful way to make sure your stakeholders are able to make the right decision
  Build dashboards that help internal stakeholders understand the performance of their business segment and identify action points in Tableau
  Develop databases through data engineering and transformation in Hadoop
  Design and implement decision making tools that enable data-driven decision making
  Monitor data and information management processes to ensure data quality and consistency
  Identify new data sources, perform data discovery to understand data values and relationships
  B.Skilled
  Strong analytical skills and statistics knowledge
  Proven experience in conducting analyses with an operational / commercial focus
  Experience with Tableau or similar BI tool (Data Studio, Power BI, …)
  Experience working with big data (experience in SQL, Hadoop, or BigQuery)
  2+  years of experience in programming/scripting (Python, R, SQL, Bash…)
  The ability to convey complex analysis results clearly and with conviction to all levels of stakeholders
  Team player with strong interpersonal, relationship-building, and stakeholder management skills
  Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail 
  Fluent level of written and spoken English is required
  B.offered
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and competitive salary plus bonus. We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits.
In this position, you will be able to grow, both technically and commercially. We have an internal process in place where you’ll be offered the possibility to move within the Analytics community to tackle new challenges as your skill set evolves, while making a great contribution and impact to our success.
  The hiring company Booking.com BV is the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online accommodation reservation service in the world. Booking.com BV is looking for a Data Analyst - Performance in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. All references to “Booking.com" refer to Booking.com BV.

Job Title: Key Account Manager Global Corporate Partnerships
Job Description:
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
We are looking for a Global Key Account Manager Corporate Accounts to be based in one of ours offices in Amsterdam, London or Milan.
As a Key Account Manager, Global Corporate Accounts you will be responsible for managing new and existing relationships with high potential large enterprise clients.
You will Inform new business customers about the services offered by Booking.com You will also manage and maintain existing relationships with high potential Travel Management Companies (TMCs) and Online Booking Engines (OBEs).
This full time position could be based in Amsterdam, London or Milan.
Plese submit your application in English.
What you will be doing
Promote Booking.com’s brand name and its online reservation services to the global OBE/TMC clients
Support Booking.com in building and maintaining a professional network within the TMC/ B2B travel space
Support Booking.com in bringing the product closer to OBE/TMCs business customers; from initial sign-up, to onboarding and finally making Booking.com content their preferred choice
Provide the Booking.com for Business online tooling as a solution to OBE/TMC’s for their direct customers
Work with high potential OBE/TMC clients on long-term goals and new initiatives to support Booking.com in maximizing growth and meeting customer needs
Liaise with high potential OBE/TMC partners and internal support departments to solve ongoing issues
Aggregate and analyze feedback to support future product initiatives
Work closely with internal stakeholders across Customer Experience, Marketing, Product and Analytics. Provide local perspective on preferred approach
Proactively identify opportunities to improve the customer experience and improve operational efficiency
Provide training (workshops and webinars) to potential and existing OBE/TMC partners
  What you will bring
Experienced in sector, partnerships, commercial, complex deal structure
3+ years experience in a B2B role in e-commerce, SaaS, business travel environments
Successful track-record of managing a pipeline of Travel Management Companies from origination to closure
Ability to demonstrate strong networking skills in order to connect with different internal and external stakeholders
Understanding the dynamics of the travel sector, particularly hotels
Excellent communication skills and ability  influence the right people at the right level
Reliable and results oriented
Analytical with ability to operate in a data driven environment
Willing to travel

The Role
The Executive Business Partner will partner with the Global Head of Talent and effectively manage the business unit cadence and provide high level administrative and tactical support to our leaders.  This role is essential to enable the Global Head of Talent and their senior LT to scale up by managing day to day and mid term activities and creating the space to work on long term strategy. 
This role will be fully responsible to ensure the Global Head of Talent office is aware of deliverables and their timelines and ensure communication is cascaded up & down as needed. 
This position requires strategic thinking and business acumen as well as the ability to develop processes to facilitate short and long term planning and execution. Building and maintaining strong stakeholders relationships, both internal and external are a key aspect of this role. Must be skilled in cross-group collaboration at all levels with excellent communication skills and comfortable operating in a fast-paced environment
  Executive partnering 
Be a trusted advisor on individual and team dynamics.
Partner directly with Global Head of Talent to prioritise their activities based on the business priorities. 
Create, maintain & influence relationships with both internal and external stakeholders to support business activities. 
Full ownership of Global Head of Talent’s calendar. Clear alignment on the business priorities, interdependencies and needs of Global Head of Talent and the business. 
in Partnership with PMOs, FP&A, Internal communications and other relevant stakeholders, create the BU cadence, own the agenda and plan forecasts on behalf of Global Head of Talent. Partners with Strategic Planning Lead to continuously improve design and governance of BU Leadership Team cadence
Coordinate and actively facilitate BU LT Meetings. Own actions taking and follow ups. Partner with the Strategic Planning Lead to agree on approach for improvements for accountability, ownership, and general delivery/follow-up of the BU priorities
Inbox management:  organizing inbox, replying to emails, picking up tasks from their email. You speak the same language as Global Head of Talent and are able to prepare and/or send out emails on their behalf to internal and external stakeholders. 
Manage, own & initiate the onboarding process on behalf of Global Head of Talent. Prepare all-onboarding documentation and schedule as well as overseeing all technical and operational aspects of the onboarding. 
Has regular touch points with the Strategic Planning Lead- partnering to agree approach to improvements for accountability, ownership, and general delivery/follow-up of the BU priorities
Fully responsible for all tasks that are designed for delegation. (Workday, concur, Ivalua,etc..) as well as raising POs / adding vendors & follow up as and when needed
Be aware & adhere to the budget policies
Oversees the planning of biz trips/travel needs for Global Head of Talent & teams (e.g. logistics and visas, including coordinating itineraries across multiple stakeholders and gathering/developing/collating preparation materials for meetings/presentations.)
Support with with the hiring process by conducting interviews for the craft 
Oversees the planning of biz trips/travel needs for Global Head of Talent & teams (e.g. logistics and visas, including coordinating itineraries across multiple stakeholders and gathering/developing/collating preparation materials for meetings/presentations.)
Facilitate process for signatures for Global Head of Talent
Project management & Communications
Identify areas of improvements and work with PMs  project manage the change
Upon request, review and advise on language, channel and overall content of outgoing communications
Assists in end to end planning of meetings and events. This can include but is not limited to offsites, all-hands, Q&A's and working sessions.
Partners with IC in planning, organising and executing communication initiatives. Facilitates a strong connection between IC and the respective leader/department, allowing them to understand short-term and long-term opportunities for communications.
Acts as the leaders eyes and ears, identifying areas of concern or of good opportunity to utilise internal comms.
Collaborate with the IC team in planning and execution of global initiatives. This can include but is not limited to scheduling, identifying/inviting attendees, logistical planning and support on the day.
Required Skills
5+ years relevant experience e.g. administration/ operational/ business support/executive assistant, preferably in large/multinational organization
creative and ‘out of the box’ thinking in order to proactively drive business 
People oriented; strong relationship and stakeholder management skills, and able to engage with people across all levels, and from diverse backgrounds.
You seek to understand before you act. You take the time to check both the what and why in ambiguous situations.
Commercially aware and results-driven with an independent and proactive attitude
Highly organised with excellent planning skills. You take ownership and proactively solve problems.
Exhibit a strong attention to detail, ability to adapt to daily schedules and routines, and focus on efficiency without sacrificing quality.
Excellent communication. Fluent in English, verbal and written (additional language(s) an advantage but not required).
Comfortable with ambiguity and able to prioritise and make decisions without having all the information
Strong ethics and can handle confidential matters with discretion. You cultivate and promote the Booking.com values and culture within the department
Be an active member of the Leadership Support community, both across departments and within your own department
Available to offer support outside of normal business hours, or travel, as required
Excellent with G suite, including Google Calendar, Google Sheets/Slides (or similar).
Support with other tasks as may be required.

The Company

It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
Do you enjoy taking ownership and being responsible for your own internal business portfolio? Do you thrive in building strong relationships over the phone? Can you help Booking.com’s partners grow their business by providing them with analysis, growth opportunities and new products and services? If your answer is “yes”, you might have what it takes to be the next Account Executive (Portuguese Speaker) at our Johannesburg office!

What you’ll be doing:
Pro-active communication with partners in your region by telephone and by internal messaging to assist with the development of Booking.com’s business
Responsible for a portfolio of partners where you are the first point of contact, answering questions and following up when needed
Responsible for maintaining a stable relationship with the accommodation partners (i.e. frequent performance calls and contact to ensure they offer Booking.com’s customers the best availability and competitive pricing)
Be knowledgeable on Booking.com’s products so that their benefits and usage can be explained to Partners
Identify opportunities for partners that will help improve Booking.com’s business by using its internal segmentation to prioritise
Help identifying new potential partner leads and pass these leads on for further follow up
Responsible for taking Customer Service escalations which relate to their managed portfolio and solving these in the most efficient manner for the business, partner and customer
Support the organisation of events, such as workshops and webinars, for partners. Also expected to attend and participate in the partner events for their managed portfolio
What you’ll bring:
Strong and engaging communication skills
Solution oriented and results driven
Ability to influence partners over the phone to implement suggestions;
Strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful
Proactive, flexible and capable of working independently as well as working in a team
Ability to prioritise own workload and efficiently manage their time
Eye for accuracy and ability to be analytical
Language: Portuguese & English, written and verbal
In return, we’ll provide:
A performance-based company with competitive salary and bonuses
A great platform for learning and development
The opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds from all over the planet
Please submit your CV and motivation letter in English.

Booking.com is the world’s #1 accommodation site is looking for a Connectivity Support Executive.
The Connectivity Partnerships Team (part of Accommodations BU) is managing the ecosystem of technology companies (“Connectivity Partners”), which are providing IT solutions for our Accommodation Partners. These IT solutions range from Channel Management  to Property Management Systems and from online booking engines to Revenue Management. The objective of the Connectivity Partnerships team is to become the trusted advisor for Booking.com’s Connectivity Partners. Its core focus is to develop existing and recruit new connectivity partnerships to drive a joint and healthy business operation and accelerate on a mutual growth ambition.
As the world’s leading accommodation site, Booking.com is at the center of a fast transforming market where guests expect the best possible experience in arranging their travel accommodation. To lead this transformation and to deliver on Booking.com’s mission, it’s of strategic importance to drive a high adoption of the products and connectivity innovations by Booking.com’s eco-system of Connectivity Partners.
As a Connectivity Support Executive you are joining a global support team which provides operational and technical support to Connectivity Partners. These Partners connect their IT system with Booking.com’s system via XML and Json to allow the exchange of inventory & reservation data for their connected Accommodation Partners. The purpose of your role is to maintain a high quality connection between the IT systems of Booking.com and the Partners to ultimately enable a positive customer experience. You do this by providing day to day analysis & troubleshooting to Connectivity Partners, testing and rolling out new technical solutions to Partners and supporting internal Accommodation Partner teams on Connectivity issues. 
This position reports to the Technical Support Team Lead and is part of the wider Global Connectivity Support Community. You will work closely with the technical staff of the Connectivity Partners in your region. Internally you collaborate with several departments located throughout Booking.com’s offices worldwide, including our Connectivity teams in Amsterdam, Singapore, Australia and New York, and local Partner Services teams. 
To be successful in the role you need to combine a love of digging deep to resolve issues, with excellent communication skills to provide a highly satisfying experience to our Connectivity Partners and internal departments. You also need to possess strong collaboration skills to work as part of a global team and support internal departments on connectivity issues.
B.responsible
As a Connectivity Support Executive you will:
Provide 1st level ticket handling support and serve as first point of contact for Connectivity Partners, direct-connected hotel chains and internal Accommodation Partner teams. Volume of ticket contribution represents an equal percentage share across the support team (eg. 7.5% contribution on a team of fourteen CSE and Sr CSEs).
Analyze & troubleshoot Connectivity related issues to enable a flawless exchange of inventory & reservation data
Proactively review connectivity quality scores of our biggest Connectivity Partners. Collaborate with them to improve the overall connectivity quality following a set of best practices
Provide test and roll out support on new technical solutions to Connectivity Partners to drive better Accommodation Partner experiences. This entails conducting scoping calls on implementation planning & technical specifications, proactive advisory on how to program towards our interface, regular check in on progress and final testing of the new solution.
Coordinate and facilitate the roll out of new interface connections for direct-connected hotel chains
Drive the certification process of new Connectivity Partners. Provide guidance on requirements, assist them throughout the process and test the functionality
Identify product bugs, validate them and assess business impact. Work with product teams to get them addressed.
Contribute to the creation of self help content for Connectivity Partners and internal teams. Educate internal teams on technical connectivity concepts to reduce inbound volume
Identify and follow through on opportunities for structural improvement which reduce “customer” effort and/or realize internal efficiencies
Participate in global community projects to improve the Connectivity/Accommodation Partner and/or guest experience
B.skilled
Understanding of XML. Knowledge of MySQL is a plus
Analytical & problem solving skills with an eye for detail
Excellent interpersonal communication & collaboration skills. Fluent in English (spoken & written)
Driven, volunteering for new challenges without being asked, and taking ownership of your work
Willing to face all challenges with enthusiasm, and positivity. Can bend and twist with the changes as they come your way.
Ability to prioritize and deliver according to deadlines and SLAs
Ability to effectively work within a fast growing and changing organization
Customer focused & can-do attitude

We’re looking for a strong collaborator who can work across multiple projects and set an example of the team around them when it comes to best practices. This person should have a keen eye for detail and design consistency across Cars and the wider design community. We’re on the lookout for someone with a strong background in designing for apps (iOS & Android), where the successful candidate will lead the design on our car rental experience on the booking.com app.
The Lead Designer is a critical thinker who has sought-after expertise in the principles, concepts, and theories of product design and related areas including copywriting and research. They leverage their knowledge and insight to challenge established practices and uncover new business value in existing products and services. They comfortably take on known and anticipated product design challenges and deftly balance design strategy, customer needs, and business goals to influence and provide clear strategic and tactical solutions. They display a commitment to design excellence in their work across a small number of teams and guide the overall design direction to ensure an extraordinary level of quality in the work their peers produce.
Key responsibilities
Demonstrates advanced understanding and application of user-centered design concepts, methods, and techniques to enable and advance quality design and outcomes. They lead the creation of design solutions and contributes when needed; develops innovative ideas and solutions through their expertise in their area and understanding of Booking's products and services. 
Works with design leadership and others to ensure product, craft, quality, and accessibility standards and requirements are applied across their tracks, teams and products. 
Influences cross-functional teams across products and takes into consideration the full user journey. Identifies potential touch points across Guest, Partner, and Customer services and works with others to design and develop a complete customer experience. 
Has leading knowledge of prototyping tools / environments, web or native app interface engines, and leads creation of interfaces where appropriate. 
Drives vision and roadmaps for a product, including longer term assessment of future needs and mapping of current initiatives against it with peers in research and product. 
Guides teams in completing complex objectives; Identifies multi-product or complex, interdependent design process problems, then proposes and implements well-researched solutions that have impact across reasonable timelines. 
Proactively helps others to develop, champion, and refine ideas or initiatives that solve business and/or user needs both inside and outside of their area of direct responsibility. Guides designers in appropriate ways to validate hypotheses through user-testing, quantitative and qualitative methods. 
Encourages and enables designers and others to facilitate workshops, sprints, critiques, reviews or other collaborative processes; Engages other disciplines and key stakeholders in order to provide direction. 
Work with designers and others in order to elevate the practical application of design, guide design thinking and execution, and advocate for and help maintain a high quality standard of the work being done by teams across the company on a day-to-day basis. 
Utilizes leadership and negotiation skills to influence outcomes both within and outside the functional unit or area and delivers effective communication on design and product solutions and business initiatives across tracks, teams, and to senior management. 
Drives organizational design and recruiting efforts for their area of business and initiatives to grow individuals and strengthen the craft community across Booking. 
Actively participates in initiatives to grow and strengthen the craft community. Promotes their domain in the wider community and across their BU in order to spread awareness and create a more consistent user experience.
  Knowledge and skills:
8-12 years of relevant experience designing for digital products / native mobile apps
Strong interpersonal and leadership skills 
Strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful 
Solution oriented and result driven 
Proactive, flexible and capable of working independently as well as working in a team 
Good communication and analytical skills 
Ability to multi-task & flexible attitude 
Demonstrates advanced understanding and application of user-centered design concepts, methods, and techniques to enable and advance quality design and outcomes. 
Has leading knowledge of prototyping tools or prototyping environments; has leading knowledge of web or native app interface engines. 
Displays a commitment to design excellence and exceptional quality in their production-ready work. 
Comfortable taking on known and anticipated product design challenges and work to produce innovative and comprehensively-detailed designs in order to drive strategic direction and tactical execution. 
Leverage their knowledge and insight to challenge established practices and uncover new business value in existing products and services. Elevate the practical application of design, guide design thinking and execution, and advocate for and help maintain a high quality standard of the work being done by teams across the company. 
Identifies project risks, makes recommendations to lessen risk and is comfortable raising project issues with several levels of leadership.
Strong project management. Creates vision, mission, and achievable milestones for bigger, influential design or experience initiatives. Makes recommendations to leadership and stakeholders on what is possible if we use our research, talent, and time wisely.
A portfolio which demonstrates previous design experience, breadth and depth of design skills, a case study or two which illustrate challenges, methods, roles, and outcomes.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree a plus.
Language: English
