The hiring company Booking.com (Singapore) Pte Ltd is one of Booking.com BV’s support companies in Singapore. Booking.com (Singapore) Pte Ltd is looking for an Account Manager Partnerships. Booking.com BV is the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online accommodation reservation service in the world. All references to “Booking.com" refer to Booking.com BV.

At Booking.com, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world. We began by taking hotel bookings online over 20 years ago and we’ve been shaping the travel industry ever since. Today, we’re building a platform that connects all parts of the trip – from accommodation to transport, tickets, tours and more. 
As part of our Connected Trip ambition, Booking.com wants to ensure that customers have peace of mind when booking their travel - particularly in uncertain times. Part of this ambition is the delivery of insurance products to give our customers assurance that there is protection, should anything happen.
Our Transportation unit already has a mature insurance business aimed at offering its car rental customers’ this peace of mind, and we are planning to use this as a springboard on which to build further. We seek to unify our insurance resources, and build a foundation on which to deliver insurance products to all of our segments, including: Accommodations, transportation, flights and attractions.
Booking.com has ambitious growth plans for the insurance business. Example opportunities include traditional areas such as travel protection, alongside new categories, such as home-sharing protection for our vacation rental segment.
The key strategic aims are to: Build an insurance operating model that can deliver to our insurance requirements, and to use this to expand and grow a global footprint of general insurance product offerings throughout the Group. Through innovation and industry sector knowledge and single-threaded focus, the challenge is to substantially enhance the group’s customer Insurance experience and drive a profitable account.

Job Title: Account Manager - San Juan - French speaker
Job Description:
Do you enjoy taking ownership and being responsible for your own internal business portfolio? Do you thrive in building strong relationships and inspiring partners about new products and services? If your answer is “yes”, you might have what it takes to be the next Account Manager at our San Juan office!
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the world’s leading online hotel reservation service) is looking for people to support our business in the fast-growing hotel markets.
  B.responsible
You support Booking.com BV; you are responsible for informing and consulting its accommodation partners in regards to their business performance, market opportunities and industry trends. You will empower partners on how to use the system, tools and available products of Booking.com BV with the goal of optimizing their performance on the platform and creating an amazing experience for Booking.com’s customers.
  B.capable
Communicating effectively: you can clearly express ideas and information to others and flex your style according to the specific situation and audience
Managing your market: you excel at evaluating local market characteristics, trends and drivers, and you effectively prioritize and manage the performance of a portfolio of accounts to business value
Identifying and articulating Partner needs: you are capable to create value for Partners by identifying, clarifying and prioritizing partner needs
Formulating and positioning solutions: you enjoy creating “win-win” value for partners by matching needs to relevant offerings and presenting these in compelling ways
Gaining commitment: you have the capability to move partner conversations forward and lead conversations to a successful outcome
Representing Booking.com: you can exhibit professional behavior and act as a role model of the Booking.com values before, during and after interactions with partners
Self-awareness, managing and developing yourself: you have the capability to achieve business goals and make the difference in interacting with partners by recognizing the emotions of oneself and of others and to use this information to guide thinking and behavior

Fluent English and French speaking and writing
Affinity or experience within e-commerce and/or travel industry

B.offered
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and competitive compensation, including bonus.

Director of Engineering DMLP
Established in 1996 in Amsterdam, Booking.com has grown from a small Dutch start-up to the third largest e-commerce company in the world. Booking.com is the largest business within Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) and accounts for the vast majority of Booking Holdings’ total revenue. Booking Holdings is a leading Fortune 500 e-commerce conglomerate with a market cap of approximately $80 billion.
With a mission to make it easier for everyone to experience the world, Booking.com invests in digital technology that helps take the friction out of travel. Booking.com connects travellers with the world’s largest selection of incredible places to stay, including everything from apartments, vacation homes, and family-run B&Bs to 5-star luxury resorts and even tree houses. The Booking.com website and mobile apps are available in over 40 languages, offer more than +28 million total reported listings, and cover +140K destinations in +200 countries worldwide.
Our Data & Machine Learning Platform (DMLP) organization is accountable for providing services that support the data modernization across Booking.com, so that more business value can be extracted out of our data, e.g. more personalization, loyalty and segmentation. Therefore, from production to consumption, we provide an E2E modernized data infrastructure that enables the production and consumption of owned, available and quality data. Our Foundational Capabilities are built on Data Governance policies to enable reliable data management across Booking.com. 
We have just set on this journey, and as Director of Engineering you would be coming in from the ground to define and drive the (technology) strategy to extract more value out of our data. These would be the type of services under your ownership: 
Data consumption platform including consumption through workflows, machine learning and data warehousing
Data production platform including governed ingestion into our cloud data platform
Foundational capabilities such as cloud data storage and data management capabilities 
We hire the best and the brightest professionals, and we empower them to innovate, you need to have:
Technology leadership experience at driving frameworks and foundational services
Deep technical experience as this is an foundational role in the guts of our platforms
Technology thought leadership on reliability engineering, operational excellence and quality engineering
Strong understanding of distributed systems and SOA
Solid awareness of emerging technology trends that enable a world class developer experience
Ability to lead a team of top talent in an engineering organisation consisting of Frameworks, Middleware, Critical Services, Data Platform, Systems Engineering
B. Responsible
People & Function Leadership
Lead, inspire and motivate your Engineering function through leading by example and defining what success looks like, giving ownership and providing clarity when necessary
Line manage Senior Managers as well as top technical talent, such as Principals
Communicate strategy in a compelling manner to multiple teams and relevant stakeholders
Foster inclusion by holding self and others accountable
Drive people centric initiatives that enable workforce diversity
Partner in and outside of our Business unit to lead and shape the people agenda across Booking.com
Create a learning environment by coaching, maintaining two-way feedback, helping people extract and share personal learnings, and supporting teams to constantly adapt

At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world.
We’re a truly global e-commerce company, with business operations in nearly every country and city on the planet. And we want to make it easy for everyone, anywhere in the world, to pay for their travel or do business with our platform – whenever and however it’s convenient for them.
Our brand new FinTech business unit – with teams in Amsterdam, London, and Shanghai – develops new products and drives innovation to help us continue removing financial friction from the travel  process. That makes buying and selling travel-related products and services simpler for both travellers and partners.
With this in mind, we are looking for the world’s finest Site Reliability Engineers to join us on this adventure and to help shape the future of travel with Booking.com!
 We are looking for a Site Reliability Engineer, to join our Payment Reliability team.
So is an SRE opportunity with Booking right for you?
The core premise for the Booking SRE lies in treating operational issues as a software problem. We code our way out of problems where operations are concerned addressing availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency challenges within the vast infrastructure here at Booking.
You will impact millions of people all over the globe with your creative solutions
You will be working in one of the biggest e-commerce companies in the world
You will solve interesting problems at scale by writing and deploying code across tens of thousands of servers
You will have the opportunity to collaborate with many of the world’s leading SREs
You will be free to launch your own ideas and solutions within our complex production environment
Here are some of the tools and technologies we use to achieve this: Python, Go, Puppet, Kubernetes, Elasticsearch, Prometheus, HAProxy, Cassandra, Kafka etc
What you’ll be doing:
Architect, write and implement software that improves the stability, scalability, availability and latency of the Booking.com products
Own multiple services and have the autonomy to do what suits the business and our customers
Solve problems occurring with our highly available production systems and create solutions and automation tools to prevent them from happening again
Construct effective systems to monitor the health of your system, and to handle outages
Build and run capacity tests to manage the growth of your systems
Plan for reliability by designing systems to work across our multinational data-centres
Produce tools to assist the product development teams with successfully deploying 1000s of change sets every day
Share the on-call rotation and be an escalation contact for incidents
Contribute to Booking.com's growth through interviewing and recruitment efforts
Working in close collaboration with multi-functional teams
What you’ll bring:
Minimum 5 years of experience with building & maintaining complex, scalable, and distributed systems
Good understanding of Software Reliability Engineering and Computer Science principles
Ability to formulate software solutions from scratch is essential
Solid understanding of Service Oriented Architecture, Microservices & OOP patterns
Hands-on experience in Linux administration and troubleshooting
Creative approach to problem-solving
Ability to define SLIs and SLOs
Fluency in the English language both spoken and written
Additional experience in networking, security or storage is an advantage
In return, we’ll provide:
An opportunity to contribute to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real time impact of your work on millions of travelers worldwide.
Be part of a truly international fast paced environment and performance driven culture.
Various opportunities to grow technically and personally via side projects, hackathons, conferences and your involvement in the community.
Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits
Diverse and creative colleagues from every corner of the world
With over 70 different nationalities within the technology department alone, you will be able to absorb new skills and grow your career in a multicultural environment.
We value Diversity of all types and in an open, dynamic workplace. This has been a pillar at Booking.com since day one, and something we continue to strongly believe in and build today.
Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

Engineering Manager – Mobile
Who are we?
At Booking.com, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world. We began by taking hotel bookings online over 20 years ago and we’ve been shaping the travel industry ever since. Today, we’re building a platform that connects all parts of the trip – from accommodation to transport, tickets, tours and more.
From our HQ in Manchester, our Transportation team helps people get where they want to go, anywhere in the world. Whether customers want the freedom of a car, the ease of a taxi or the economy of public transport, we make it all possible.
This role is for one of our Apps teams, owning the apps for the RentalCars brand and the car rental section of the Booking.com apps. You will be leading a multi-disciplinary team with backend, Android, and iOS developers to achieve our mission to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. 
Our team is passionate about helping people travel. They see challenges as opportunities. And they’re always ready for change.

It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
Do you enjoy taking ownership and being responsible for your own internal business portfolio? Do you thrive in building strong relationships and inspiring partners about new products and services? If your answer is “yes”, you might have what it takes to be the next Account Manager.
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the world’s leading online hotel reservation service) is looking for people to support our business in the fast-growing hotel markets.
Booking.com is seeking a full time Account Manager in our Florence office.
Please submit your application in English.
B.responsible:
You support Booking.com BV; you are responsible for informing and consulting its accommodation partners in regards to their business performance, market opportunities and industry trends. You will empower partners on how to use the system, tools and available products of Booking.com BV with the goal of optimizing their performance on the platform and creating an amazing experience for Booking.com’s customers.
  B.capable:
Communicating effectively: you can clearly express ideas and information to others and flex your style according to the specific situation and audience
Managing your market: you excel at evaluating local market characteristics, trends and drivers, and you effectively prioritize and manage the performance of a portfolio of accounts to business value
Identifying and articulating Partner needs: you are capable to create value for Partners by identifying, clarifying and prioritizing partner needs
Formulating and positioning solutions: you enjoy creating “win-win” value for partners by matching needs to relevant offerings and presenting these in compelling ways
Gaining commitment: you have the capability to move partner conversations forward and lead conversations to a successful outcome
Representing Booking.com: you can exhibit professional behavior and act as a role model of the Booking.com values before, during and after interactions with partners
Self-awareness, managing and developing yourself: you have the capability to achieve business goals and make the difference in interacting with partners by recognizing the emotions of oneself and of others and to use this information to guide thinking and behavior.
  B.skilled:
2 years of experience in a relevant account management function
Fluent English and Italian speaker and writer
Affinity or experience within e-commerce and/or travel industry are considered a plus
Pro-active, sense of responsibility and can work independently
Accurate, strong analytical skills and an eye for detail
Team player, self-motivated, flexible and open to change
Positive attitude
Hotel School, or University background preferred
Driver’s license
Availability to travel up to 50%
  B.offered:
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and competitive compensation, including bonus. We also offer a hybrid home-to-office policy and what is called the “Booking Deal” with competitive benefits.
Booking.com BV is the world’s #1 accommodation site and the 3rd largest global e-commerce player. The diverse team, 15,000 strong, is united by a single mission: to empower people to experience the world. We connect travelers with the world’s largest selection of incredible places to stay, including everything from apartments, vacation homes, and family-run B&Bs to 5-star luxury resorts, tree houses and even igloos. Each day, more than 1,200,000 room nights are reserved on our platform.

Job Title: Commercial Support Executive - Global Accounts EMEA
Job Description:

In addition, this role works closely with a number of other departments in the organization including: other regional chain teams, the local partner services teams, chain operations, and the connectivity team. 
The Global Accounts team is based in Amsterdam as part of the hotels department, and is the team that is responsible for contracting and managing the relationships with all major Hotel Chains worldwide. 
To be successful in this role, you will need to demonstrate the ability to design, follow and improve upon processes which support the commercial goals of Booking.com. Having the ability to prepare analysis and reporting to drive the commercial business with our Global Chain Accommodation Partners is key. This comes with understanding the product roadmap, and challenges and opportunities on the various initiatives. We are looking for a determined team player who is proactively identifying roadblocks with processes and looking for solutions.

At Booking.com, we are seeking a Web Analyst
As a Web Analyst, you will be part of the Digital Content Platforms team within Booking.com Digital Partner Experience (DPE) department. Within DPE, we focus on scaling the management of our global accommodation partner base and empowering them to discover our commercial growth opportunities. 
You will play a great part in analysing existing data and providing insights to increase the reach and effectiveness of our partner facing content and marketing campaigns on our Partner Hub platform. 
In this role, you will be optimising the performance of the Partner Hub through innovation and experimentation strategies as well as driving projects that increase website traffic. 
You will manage complex projects and marketing campaigns on our platforms that create high quality digital experiences for our partners. 
Responsibilities 
Ownership on maintaining and optimising for the main KPIs of the Partner Hub (including the platforms reach, engagement and conversions) and providing feedback to your main stakeholders. 
Analyse existing data and provide insights to content teams.
Create and maintain Google Analytics dashboards.
Collaborate with other analysts on specific projects or stakeholder requests.
Analyse partner needs and pain points to design solutions that drive the desired partners behaviours on the platform. 
Project management, working closely together with your main stakeholders (like analysts, development and product teams and content and brand marketing teams) 
Use hypothesis building and experimentation methods to test and iterate in order to optimise key metrics.
Drive efficiency within the team by consistently innovating processes and approaches and look for the opportunities of scalability. 
Skills 
3-5 years of experience in digital marketing with a focus on web performance or content marketing. Preferably across multiple regions in multiple languages. 
Experience in setting content marketing KPIs and setting performance benchmarks.
Extensive knowledge and experience in working with Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager and Google Optimise. SQL knowledge is a plus. 
Experience in working with CMS systems (Drupal, Wordpress)
Great stakeholder and communication skills, to closely work with a vast network of stakeholders across different levels and departments of the business. 
Excellent organizational skills, ability to prioritize tasks and manage time efficiently. High performer that is able to manage multiple complex projects at the same time and open to change.

JOB DESCRIPTION FOR: 
Director of Corporate Compliance & Integrity
Our Company
Established in 1996 in Amsterdam, Booking.com has grown from a small Dutch start-up to the third largest ecommerce company in the world. Booking.com is the largest business within Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) and accounts for the vast majority of Booking Holdings’ total revenue. Booking Holdings is a leading Fortune 500 e-commerce conglomerate with a market cap of approximately $100 billion.
With a mission to make it easier for everyone to experience the world, Booking.com invests in digital technology that helps take the friction out of travel. Booking.com connects travelers with the world’s largest selection of incredible places to stay, including everything from apartments, vacation homes, and family-run B&Bs to 5-star luxury resorts and even tree houses. The Booking.com website and mobile apps are available in over 43 languages and customers can reach Booking.com 24/7 for assistance and support in over 43 languages. As Booking.com envisions a future in which it will serve customers a one-stop solution for all travel-related needs, we are working towards offering a fully ‘Connected Trip’, in which every aspect of the travel experience can be planned and booked through us. We are determined to build the number 1 travel brand in the world! 
At Booking.com, the decisions we make are a reflection of our Values -  they reflect what is important to us, both as individuals and as an organization. When they are shared, they build unity in a group. They build culture:
Think customer first. We obsess about adding value for our customers - guests, partners, colleagues - to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
Own it. We deliver on our promises, make informed decisions and prioritize to get the important things done today.
Learn forever. We are resilient, take time to reflect, and seek to learn – from colleagues, from the outside world and from our failures.
Succeed together. We celebrate team success, through making connections, building trust and valuing the diverse perspectives of others.
Do the right thing. We get the right results the right way. For each other, our communities and the world around us.
  Booking.com Leadership Team
Chief Executive Officer, Glenn Fogel
SVP, Chief Finance Officer (interim), Sue D’Emic                                                                                           
SVP, Chief Marketing Officer, Arjan Dijk                                                                                                                                                
SVP, Chief Legal Officer, Maria Barros
SVP, Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano   
SVP, Trips, Bryan Batista   
SVP, Accommodations, James Waters
SVP, Chief Technology Officer, Rob Francis
SVP, Fintech, Daniel Marovitz 
  Profile Director of Corporate Compliance & Integrity
This position will play a lead role in providing oversight compliance counselling and leadership for all business groups in the company (including managing the regional compliance programs) as well as leading the company’s investigations function. In this role, you will be expected to develop and drive initiatives to promote a culture of responsible business practices and ethical conduct. You will ensure the Leadership Team, senior management and employees are in compliance with the relevant laws and regulations globally; company policies and procedures are being followed; and behavior in the organization meets the Booking.com Code of Conduct.
The right candidate will have substantive legal experience in a broad spectrum of compliance areas, with primary focus on internal investigations, whistleblowing laws, internal fraud, anti-bribery and corruption laws, and conflicts of interest. You will have experience working with senior business leaders to promote the compliance program agenda and responding to quickly developing regulatory changes (change management experience) and investigation matters. You are a seasoned leader with versatility and a strong commitment to ethics and integrity.
The position will report to Femi Thomas, our Chief Compliance Officer & Global Head of Litigation and will have a team consisting of six reporting to her/him.
Key responsibilities:
Maturing the company’s internal investigations program and capabilities - including the tool and technology integration, developing appropriate skills and resources to meet growing regulatory demands in integrity investigations, developing mechanisms for conducting non-investigative compliance assessments.
Promoting a healthy working relationship with key reporting stakeholders - including external auditors, regulators and enforcement authorities.
Procuring and interpreting legal advice to the various business units to ensure effective controls and promote compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
Leading the regional compliance teams - consisting of lawyers and other professionals in EMEA, APAC, NORAM and LATAM regions, and promoting the localization of the compliance program.
Contributing to the development of ESG (Environmental, Social and Corporate Governance) programs in line with broader company objectives and overseeing the human rights risk management program for Booking.com.
Contributing to the overall maturation of the compliance program as a member of the Compliance and Ethics Leadership Team.
The ideal candidate for the role will have:
A minimum of 12 years’ experience in a relevant or transferable area of law
4+ years experience leading, developing and building teams - including experience managing diverse and distanced teams
A Law degree with relevant post-qualification leadership experience in compliance and ethics and internal investigations gained at a reputable law firm and or large corporate
Experience building compliance program components
A strategic mindset and be able to effectively discuss with and advise management regarding complex legal matters and challenging situations
Experience identifying and liaising with local counsel around the globe, identifying suitable partners, commissioning work, challenging deliverables etc
Strong influencing skills are a must, including the ability to collaborate and problem-solve in a data-driven, international business
Experience interacting with external auditors and senior executive leadership
Experience working with major internal investigations platforms (Navex) and eDiscovery platforms
Experience managing internal resources/budget, and building a strategic plan and related budget request for the team, with clear deliverables and milestones
Fluency in English (a must-have; additional European languages are a benefit)
Ability to travel up to 20%
Further skills we are looking for:
Aligning with Booking.com’s Values (Think Customer First, Succeed Together, Own It, Learn Forever, Do the Right Thing)
Being curious, flexible, and a creative & pragmatic problem solver
Confident yet collaborative
Ability to influence stakeholders across all levels within the organisation
Being proactive, resilient and having the drive to get things done
Having sound judgement and the ability to see the big picture and simultaneously appreciate the details necessary to operationalise the strategy
Having the courage to take positions and make tough judgment calls
Being a team player, self aware and a good listener - a diverse group will always find the best solution!
Ability to move with agility, prioritise workloads and meet deadlines
Forward thinking with an interest in emerging issues in legal and policy

Data Engineer (Data Enablement) 
  About the company
Not long ago, booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was complex and time consuming. Now it is simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.
  In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.
  Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.
  We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
  Booking.com core values
Think Customer First
Succeed Together
Own It
Learn Forever
Do the Right Thing
  Trips Business Unit (TBU) direction
  At Booking.com we’re working to seamlessly connect every aspect of travel, and the TBU team is one of the cornerstones of our connected trip vision. We’re dedicated to helping travellers uncover the best transport options available to them around the world. To do this we need to offer the broadest selection of bookable transport options, and effortlessly match the right options to the right person at the right time. Our goal is to offer travellers the widest choice and the best customer experience no matter what transport option they choose.
  About the teams.
The Trips Data & Science team at Booking.com look after data for ‘everything but the stay’ at Booking.com: Car Rental, Taxis, Public Transport, Attractions, and Flights.  This includes data platforms, management, warehousing, enrichment and machine learning functionality,  enabling teams across the organisation to understand and manage our business performance and improve the experience of our customers. You will be responsible for delivering products that advance data excellence and innovation within your product team, and across the business, helping us shape Booking.com’s Transport data journey.
   Data Enablement Team
We are looking for an enthusiastic and proactive Data Engineer to join our Data Enablement Team to drive the rapid and robust delivery of data pipelines. You will be an advocate for our cloud migration, driving benefit through data modelling, supporting product teams, supporting key initiatives, transforming/enriching data, creating data pipelines, working with analysis to enable data driven insight and decision making across all elements of Trips.
  B. Responsible 
As a Data Engineer, you’ll join TBU to work alongside curious, energetic, and focused people. You are responsible for delivering our vision to create a fully integrated, scalable, high performance and compliant data platform and pipelines. You’ll help roadmap and deliver replacements for the current ad-hoc data solutions with strong foundations built on modern technologies and practices that will make it easy to produce large quantities of high quality data for consumption and analysis .
Important aspects and responsibilities of the job include:
Data engineering
Using standardized tooling and procedures work with business users to model and implement data pipelines which are performant, scalable, secure, well governed and monitorable.
Diagnose and solve customer issues with data and data pipelines. Perform root cause analysis and where appropriate enhancements to prevent recurrence.
End-to-end ownership of data quality in our core datasets and data pipelines. Engage with other teams to help them identify and resolve data quality issues
Keeping the data complete, accessible, and consumable in an environment of rapid product development
Be responsible for maintaining data security, integrity and governance by effectively following company standards and best practices
Adhere to the defaults principles for architecture, quality and non-functional requirements
Design, build, test and deliver quality code in line with guidance and best practices of the department, following standard testing techniques and methods that adhere to the test strategy
Contributing to the growth of Booking.com through interviewing, on-boarding, or other recruitment efforts
  End to end System Ownership
Work with teams who wish to produce data to ensure such things as data cataloguing, governance, life span, SLO and quality are all considered.
Work with our data analytical community supporting them with complex data mining, analysis and profiling. 
Is responsible to reduce business continuity risks by applying state-of-the-art practices, tooling, and writing appropriate documentation such as runbooks and OpDocs
  Critical thinking
Is responsible for systematically identifying patterns and underlying issues in complex situations to find solutions by applying logical and analytical thinking.
Continuous Quality and Process Improvement
Is responsible  for the design and implementation of relevant improvements by defining adapted/new process flows, standards, and practices that enable business performance
Effective communication
Is responsible for delivering clear, well-structured, and meaningful information to a target audience by using suitable communication mediums and language tailored to the audience
Is responsible for achieving mutually agreeable solutions by being adaptable, communicating ideas in clear coherent language
Is responsible for asking relevant (follow-up) questions to properly engage with the speaker and really understand what they are saying, by applying listening and reflection techniques
  B. Skilled 
We are looking for driven Data Engineers who enjoy solving problems, are proactive, collaborative and goal orientated. Who are communicative and believe that any challenge can be scaled with the right mindset, collaboration and tools:
Demonstrable experience of building big data pipelines in distributed environments with Kafka, Hadoop, Spark (would consider MySQL, SQL Server, Python).Experience of embedding data governance, quality, lineage, retention,  monitoring and alerting into pipelines
Passionate about Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery and Agile
Understanding of cloud security best practices
(SNR) Extensive experience with a cloud platforms (AWS preferable)
Experience with a cloud platforms (AWS preferable)
Good understanding of security principles and writing secure code
Experience of working on large scale, well governed and compliant systems
Good understanding of basic analytics and machine learning concepts
Excellent communication, written and spoken
  Level of education - Appropriate degree or suitable background and experience

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world.
Team Mission and Purpose
We are well known for our experience and selection in Accommodation, The Trips BU is pivotal to our ambition to make it easier to travel the world by offering a multi-product and full trip experience. Today you can book Accommodations, Flights, Taxis and Rental cars on Booking.com but we are just getting started to make this a seamless experience. Our daily mission is to make travel, experience and exploration accessible for everyone, everywhere. 
The Multi-Product team in the Trips Business Unit owns the operations for Multi-Product propositions and is responsible for the governance and program management of all the preparatory work to launch a packaged product in the market in 2023. This will involve working closely with all the Booking functions for the packaged product to be financially, legally, compliant and operational ready.  In the next two years we want to evolve our customer experience and our back-end processes so that we can comfortably handle connected trip travellers. 
The Program Manager is responsible for the governance and E2E program management of several streams of work within the Multi-Product team. The Program Manager partners with different teams to support, and proactively works with them, to facilitate the work occurring between them and other business units and centralized functions.
The Program Manager also identifies key requirements needed from cross - functional teams and eventually external vendors. First and foremost, the Program Manager ensures that the project's roadmaps/plans are delivered according to  agreed business priorities, dependencies and strategies. Whilst the scope of this role is fully around Multi-Product, you'll form part of the wider PMO community in Trips (10+ people) and Booking (100+ people).
B.Responsible
Leads independently multiple complex projects with global cross functional impact and manages overall portfolio of projects.
Responsible with limited to no supervision to define scope, kick-off, manage and execute every phase of complex programs, specifically:
Drive vision for initiative/program towards clear business objectives, scope, requirements & success criteria.
Create clear planning documents and roadmaps together with involved teams and departments, including setup and maintenance of dependency management.
Establish a solid governance routine which involves (sr) mgmt updates and reporting. Holds stakeholders and business partners accountable of next steps and objectives and proactively identifies risks and issues.
Enables teams & leaders to make quality decisions and supports prioritization exercises.
The scope of the roles goes beyond program management. Strategic and business thinking is required to improve the quality of all programs and initiatives.
Think customer first by identifying opportunities to improve the impact & experience for our customers (internal or external), partners and our business.
Establish a productive working relationship between all the involved teams and functions to deliver against our strategy.
Supports the budget and planning yearly cycle for the team.
Productively interacts with and manages senior stakeholders (up to VP level).
B.Skilled
Strong project management skills/experience (minimum of 8 years) including experience with a range of different methodologies and techniques. Preferably having a background in Agile Project management, PMI certification and / or LEAN.
Proven track record to independently lead high complexity (end-2-end) projects, drive multiple medium complexity projects and/or manage a portfolio of projects.
Experience in the Package/Tour industry, Travel Operations, or Platform industry within a regulatory environment is a strong plus.
Have a solid business understanding.
Ability to break up a complex problem into actionable and easy to understand solutions.
Analytical skills and mastering data handling and measuring success, ability to tell a clear story with data/insights.
Change management experience & mind-set.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, focused on collaboration. Also at ease with large audiences.
Strong stakeholder management, building and maintaining lasting relationships and connections with diverse teams, across the organization and outside.
Ability to influence and steer leadership, senior management and groups.
Able to function well within ambiguity and in a constantly changing environment.

An opportunity to contribute to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real time impact of your work on millions of travelers worldwide.
Be part of a truly international fast paced environment and performance driven culture.
Various opportunities to grow technically and personally via side projects, hackathons, conferences and your involvement in the community.

Diverse and creative colleagues from every corner of the world.

Workday Application Specialist (Recruitment)
  Booking.com is the world’s #1 accommodation site and the 3rd largest global e-commerce player. Our mission – to empower people to experience the world – is spearheaded from our headquarters in Amsterdam, where employees from many nationalities develop our business in more than 200 countries worldwide. We have scaled at incredible speed and we are currently embarking on our next chapter – experiences, loyalty, messaging, homes & apartments - and we are actively recruiting the next generation of experienced professionals.
The Application Specialist for People Systems performs Configuration activities on different People Systems supporting a number of different modules. The Application Specialist researches, designs, documents, maintains and implements new functionality in People Systems focussing on user experience, scalable design and best practises. Responsible for implementing scalable and secure configurations along with fixing issues raised by the Business owners. Proactively monitors new features released by Product and identifies and promotes changes to improve System design and user experience.
  Responsibilities

Document and maintain Configuration designs for our implemented modules. Assist in building and maintaining internal technical documentation, manuals, policies, and processes;
End to end ownership of providing solution after doing the impact assessment for Design, Architecture, User Experience , supporting testing & Implementation
Adhere to People Systems SOx controls & standards to maintain and implement configurations 
Collaborating with colleagues demonstrating the Booking Values “ Think Customer First” “Succeeding together” “Own It” “Learn Forever” & “Do the Right Thing”
  Qualifications:
Strong technical background and a Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or similar;
Should have minimum 3-5 Years in Recruitment Applications like Workday Recruitment/ Greenhouse / Eightfold with Implementation & Support for Workflow configuration, Job Setup, Offer Process setup, Security design, Application setup, Release Upgrades

About the Role
We’re looking for a talented UX Writing Manager to join our UX Writing and Content Design organization in our Accommodations department where our mission is to deliver the best value and easiest travel experiences to our customers. You’ll join a close-knit community made up of more than 50 writers collaborating on product design, development and data analysis.  
UX Writing Managers must be strong leaders who are deeply committed to growing and supporting others in their day-to-day and their career. Their primary focus is on empowering their team to do their best work rather than doing hands-on writing themselves. They must have a clear understanding of priorities and work to effectively balance those alongside the needs of their direct reports, ensuring a shared understanding of expectations and minimizing surprises.
You’ll enjoy the extensive support, community and resources of a large, experienced UX organization made up of nearly 200 writers, designers and researchers. You’ll report to a Senior UX Writing Manager and be part of a team of other managers and leaders who will support you in your own growth and development. 
To learn more about UX Writing at Booking.com check out B.Writes, our Medium publication,

We’re looking for a Senior UX Writer to join our UX Writing and Content Design organisation, in our Accommodations department. We’re a close-knit community made up of more than 50 writers. And we’re right there in the thick of it, collaborating on product design, development and data analysis.

At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. We maintain peta bytes of data including but not limited to; customer information, reservations, accommodation information, accommodation availability, destination information, etc

As a copywriter, you’ll be responsible for conceptualising and writing compelling copy for B2B, B2C and internal communications designed to engage and inspire different audiences – from property owners to travellers and even Booking.com employees.
You’ll be one of seven copywriters in the Content Agency’s creative copy team, part of our fast-paced Marketing department. You’ll write for various products, channels and campaigns across the business, working closely with other copywriters, UX writers, designers, project and product managers, product marketing managers, language specialists and other colleagues – many based in our Amsterdam HQ and plenty more in our 198 local offices in 70+ countries around the world.
Flexing between different styles, tones and formats, you’ll write everything from short blurbs and catchy headers to longer-form emails, articles, interviews and blog posts – all while staying true to the Booking.com voice. Your work will help to continuously improve the quality and performance of our existing content and to shape and deliver exciting new copy-related projects in support of the Booking.com mission to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
The role is ideal for an experienced copywriter with a keen interest in all parts of the content creation process, from shaping initial concepts to final execution of highly polished, audience-centric copy. It requires the ability to consult and problem-solve with other teams around the business to gain a deep understanding of stakeholders’ content needs and provide creative copy solutions.
The ideal candidate will combine strong ideation skills with the ability to robustly and collaboratively manage stakeholder relationships – and be able to balance the creative element of the role with the need to produce copy at pace and hit regular deadlines. You’ll also be comfortable both giving and receiving feedback on copy, in collaboration with fellow copywriters as well as stakeholders.
What you’ll do:
Deliver high-quality copy to tight deadlines
Write in line with detailed briefs, adhering to the Booking.com brand tone of voice and style guide
Flex effortlessly between writing styles and formats to meet the needs of different audiences
Use in-house tools to prepare copy for our internal language teams to translate and localise into up to 45 languages, and liaise with them throughout the process
Collaborate with key stakeholders regarding projects and briefs
Contribute to improving consistency and enhancing the business impact of our copy
Take ownership of copy projects and provide feedback to other writers
Respond positively and constructively to feedback from peers and stakeholders
Proactively support key department initiatives and team goals
  Who you are:
3+ years’ experience working as a professional copywriter, in-house, at an agency or as a freelancer
Experience or understanding of working with translation teams and writing copy that considers cultural sensitivities and localisation challenges
Commercial awareness, a curious mindset and general life experience, able to write on a wide range of topics – from travel guides to emails about tax law changes
Collaborative and open to feedback from peers, stakeholders and leaders
Resilient, thrives under pressure, adapts to change
Capacity for thinking both strategically and creatively
Ability to balance creativity with business objectives to provide pragmatic copy solutions
Capacity and willingness to use a range of tools to understand copy and content data
Highly organised and communicative, with the ability to understand and explain concepts in a concrete way
Focused and flexible, with an unflappable positive attitude and great people skills
Native/native-level English speaker, with the ability to write in flawless British English
We’re a performance-based company that offers career advancement opportunities and competitive compensation. We also offer the ‘Booking Deal’ with other exciting perks and benefits.
Please apply via our website with your CV in English and a portfolio of writing samples.

At Booking.com, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world. We began by taking hotel bookings online over 20 years ago and we’ve been shaping the travel industry ever since. Today, we’re building a platform that connects all parts of the trip – from accommodation to flights, transport, tickets, tours and more.
The Trips Data Engineering team at Booking.com looks after data for ‘everything but the stay’: Car rental, Taxi, Public Transport, Attractions, Flights, and Insurance. This role will reside in Manchester or London and reports into the Senior Director of Trips Tech Horizontal Services
As the Director of Trips Data Engineering, you sit at the intersection between the Trips verticals and Booking’s Big Data platform. Key dimensions of your role include:
The stability and operational readiness of our existing data platforms for running our Trips Businesses today
Cloud native modernisation of our data pipelines in and out of Booking’s Big Data Platform
Roadmap, planning and execution of the deprecation and end of life of legacy on premise hadoop and other technologies
Ensuring we have connected data across the verticals
Building the data tools and applications that support engineering of Trips verticals and cross vertical concerns
You will lead a department who work across multiple disciplines and locations including, software engineers, machine learning scientists, data engineers and data product managers focused on scaling our products and platforms. You will guide the best and the brightest professionals we hire and aim to empower individuals rather than restrict them.
Your role will operate in the mid to long term strategic narrative of the organisation ensuring that the organisation is set up for success through building a fantastic team, excellent ways of working and great technology. You can hold your own in a technical argument, but you know getting out of the way is often the best option. You get things done via influence not authority. You unlock the creativity of your team and inspire them to build the best for our customers.
You will take ownership for data governance, data quality, consistency and stability. You ensure that we have the right Service Levels for both availability and timeliness of data. Your services are used by teams with needs for highly structured and governed data like finance, data science and product analytics and you work closely with Privacy to ensure we design for compliance and trust.
As our product offerings expand to multiple experiences via the Connected Trip, your team will be instrumental in a modernization effort in all areas described. You will influence the business and developer community as our business adopts the use of public cloud and replatforming of our application stack, how data is structured & stored, how pipelines are built & deployed, machine learning models are built, trained and operated.
Responsibilities
People & Function Leadership
Lead, inspire and motivate your function through leading by example and setting expectations around what success looks like, giving ownership and providing clarity when necessary
Ensure timely, high availability of quality data to understand and manage our business performance and improve the experience of our customers. hat data pipelines incorporate privacy and security elements
Measure success KPIs and report on tracks and team performance and business impact
Be an expert in managing stakeholders across the different departments and the Booking.com Leadership Team. Communicate strategy in a compelling manner to multiple teams and relevant stakeholders
Build a strong leadership team, by coaching and developing Senior Software Engineering Managers, Data Managers and Principals
Recruit, retain and grow world-class talent in Data Management, Software Engineering, Data Engineering and Machine Learning Science
Foster inclusion by holding self and others accountable
Drive people centric initiatives that enable workforce diversity
Partner in and outside of our Business unit to lead and shape the people agenda across Booking.com
Create a learning environment by coaching, two-way feedback, helping people extract and share personal learnings, and support teams to constantly adapt
Foster a positive, trust by default culture where people can innovate, work as a team and celebrate success
Technology, Architecture & Product Strategy
Build the vision, set the engineering and product strategy, and define the roadmap for effective data platforms and pipelines to support the Trips verticals
Build and maintain strong connections with the Big Data Technologies group leveraging and converging technology roadmap
Be a strategic thought partner and influence senior stakeholders across the the broader business to set and align the strategic direction of your function
Make decisions in complex and ambiguous situations, and guide others in their decision making by recognizing and challenging assumptions, introducing relevant data and multiple perspectives
Ensure that the Booking architecture principles and engineering practices are adhered to, and that there is direction and alignment for each product.
Anticipate the need for changes based on context, and set renewed courses of action to engage teams and achieve goals, while striving to make the impact clear and understandable
Drive innovation in your function
Own the architecture across your function
Skills and Experience
8+ years of Leadership Experience with high traffic sites (1,000,000+ visitors per day), preferably E-commerce sites
Demonstrable experience of building, shaping and leading a cross functional Engineering, Machine Learning and Data function or business unit at scale (100+ people)
Must have demonstrable experience of leading and delivering Big Data modernisation at scale across an e-commerce organization
5+ Experience with Big Data and Machine Learning technologies
Experience with managing and coaching teams of senior Data, Machine Learning and engineering managers
Experience leading departments operationally and innovation wise (vision and KPIs/objectives setting, ideation and implementation process, people management)
Experience working with multiple senior stakeholders (product, engineering, finance, recruitment, external partners)
Demonstrable experience of working in Agile environments and more importantly an Agile culture and ethos
Demonstrable experience of setting, leading and influencing both the Engineering and Business strategy to the medium and long-term
Experience with managing and coaching teams of senior tech leaders including building and growing teams
Independent, pragmatic and proactive work attitude
Well versed in Engineering craft
Cloud based technologies
Building a DevOps culture
Be humble and human
Excellent communication skills
Strong commercial acumen

Summary
A Senior Design Manager is a leader of Design managers and a peer to the leaders of Product, Writing, Research, and Engineering. This manager is an exemplary leader in the craft of Design, with proven experience managing the design efforts of multiple groups of designers. Senior Design Managers move easily and readily from strategy and oversight to sweating the details and uplifting the overall experience. As leaders and managers, they attend to the growth and impact of their direct reports, the business needs and product goals of the department and business unit, and the alignment of the two in a healthy and productive way. They work to elevate the whole of the design organization as a function and architect compelling recruiting, retention, and development plans for their teams. They inspire and unite with their vision of the future. They love connecting the dots amongst teams and disciplines, sponsoring innovative and experience-changing initiatives, and upholding a commitment to design excellence in their work and in their influence on others--ensuring an extraordinary level of quality and cohesion in the work we produce.
This position reports to the Director of Design for the Accommodations Business Unit.
  Pricing Department
The Pricing team is responsible for pricing, discount, and deal acquisition from our accommodation partners (chains, hotels, boutique hotels, homes, and more) and for publishing compelling offers to new and existing customers. We are also responsible for Booking.com’s loyalty program, Genius. We work with our partners to secure compelling properties and benefits and with our customers to deliver competitive and engaging values which propel loyalty and revenue. The Senior Design Manager will help us imagine the best way to present a myriad of opportunities and programs to our partners; will help us illustrate the simplest and easiest way to offer personalized and weighted pricing and loyalty programs, added values, and benefits to our customers; and will partner with other teams across the our business unit and marketing to create and implement design systems and components, engagement initiatives, brand and loyalty programs. The SDM oversees two to three Design Managers and one to three individual contributors and will partner closely with peer ABU SDMs, Pricing Product Directors and Group Product Managers, the Pricing UX Copy Manager, User Research personnel, Engineering Managers and the Engineering Director.
  Pricing Senior Designer Manager Responsibilities
Manages a team of managers; helps reports prioritize work across teams to ensure the right balance of product and community focused initiatives and projects and works to align resources against these in a way that capitalizes on individual and team strengths.
Acts as organization architect: proactively identifies designer headcount needs and works with their direct reports and overall business area leadership in order to plan, recruit, interview, and hire to fill those needs. Works with design managers to maintain manageable workloads and priorities.
Works with individuals and groups to define clear and measurable strategic and tactical goals across tracks and teams that are aligned with business, design, and stakeholder needs for their area of business.
Go-to person in their area of business for matters of product design processes, as well as how design can better serve their product area or business topics; in this case, strong connections with marketing and brand, content, and loyalty programs, visual polish is ideal.
Demonstrates experience managing stakeholders, processes, business priorities, and projects across the Pricing and Genius area of business and exert influence toward positive outcomes and quality end-to-end experiences. Connects the dots between the work of their teams and those outside their areas of business and facilitates collaborative processes to provide continual direction in design and innovation.
Demonstrates fluent understanding of track area's business models and strategies; Actively contributes to strategy through collaboration with other track leadership and managers.
Manages out and up as effectively as down. Actively networks across the business and proactively builds productive relationships across disciplines of all levels.
Shares expert knowledge of user flows, product features, and underlying technologies across teams and tracks; contributes to advancements in Booking.com's design and development principles, standards, components, and practices.
Champions adherence and consistency to established design and UX copy principles, components, and guidelines across their area of business at all levels and disciplines.ensures relevant understanding and support from area leadership and key stakeholders.
Demonstrates awareness of current and upcoming trends in market, technology and design; shares this knowledge widely and encourages others to learn.
Actively engages with other managers and departments in order to improve management processes, design foundations, performance, and growth.
  Role Requirements
8+ years’ in larger organisations with software/UX design experience with at least 5 years in a management and leadership role; agency and UI experience, campaign experience a plus; travel and e-commerce experience a plus.
Strong interpersonal skills, communication skills, independence, drive; influence without authority experience and knowhow.
Experience managing and/or collaborating with copy, content, research employees and initiatives a plus; able to direct or influence formative and evaluative research.
An array of design skills and execution experience, from visual design and brand implementation to interaction design and information architecture to loyalty and engagement; demonstrated end-to-end focus on quality and cohesion, from awareness to brand to product experience and support preferred. 
Experience developing and/or utilizing design systems and components across multiple platforms and products. Advanced understanding and application of user-centered design concepts, methods, prototyping, and techniques in service of quality design and outcomes for mobile and web experiences.
Commitment to design excellence and exceptional polish and attention to detail. Ability to move deftly from strategy to tactical implementation and bring others along.
Comfort and confidence in challenging established practices to uncover or deploy new methods and new business approaches to engagement, loyalty, and revenue
Strong project management experience. Creation of vision, mission, and achievable milestones for bigger, influential design or experience initiatives. Makes recommendations to leadership and stakeholders on what is possible if we use our research, talent, and time wisely.
A portfolio which demonstrates previous design experience, breadth and depth of design skill developed and applied, deft management and leadership abilities and accomplishments.
Bachelor’s or Master’s a plus.
  We Offer
Full relocation support for you and your family (if the case) to move to Amsterdam - one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe. We have fine-tuned this process by successfully relocating 300+ Technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year alone!
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide.
Working in a fast-paced and performance-driven culture.
Opportunity to utilise software, management, and design expertise, leadership capabilities, and entrepreneurial spirit.
Promote and drive impactful and innovative design and experience solutions.
Technical, behavioural, and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation.
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com.
  At Booking.com
We know that travel means more than booking a hotel room or flight. The dreams you have and the plans you make. The places you visit, the sights you see, the journeys you take. The people you meet and the friends you make. The taste of new foods and the feel of clean, crisp white sheets. There are countless moments that shape every travel experience and we seek leaders who can help curate and guide those moments to make every part of travel easy and enjoyable.
Data informs our design and business decisions. Technology is at our core. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code, or A/B tests. Innovation and creativity are at hand. Through our products, partners and people, we strive to make it easier for everyone to experience the world, be that through unique and remote homes to stay in, luxury hotel accommodations, hostels, long-term stays, compelling loyalty programs, transportation and flight bookings and connections. Come help us make it happen!
  We value Diversity of all types and in an open, dynamic workplace. This has been a pillar at Booking.com since day one, and something we continue to strongly believe in and build today.
Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

The Company

It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
Do you enjoy taking ownership and being responsible for your own internal business portfolio? Do you thrive in building strong relationships over the phone? Can you help Booking.com’s partners grow their business by providing them with analysis, growth opportunities and new products and services? If your answer is “yes”, you might have what it takes to be the next Account Executive at our amazing Edinburgh office!

What you’ll be doing:
Pro-active communication with partners in your region by telephone and by internal messaging to assist with the development of Booking.com’s business
Responsible for a portfolio of partners where you are the first point of contact, answering questions and following up when needed
Responsible for maintaining a stable relationship with the accommodation partners (i.e. frequent performance calls and contact to ensure they offer Booking.com’s customers the best availability and competitive pricing)
Be knowledgeable on Booking.com’s products so that their benefits and usage can be explained to Partners
Identify opportunities for partners that will help improve Booking.com’s business by using its internal segmentation to prioritise
Help identifying new potential partner leads and pass these leads on for further follow up
Responsible for taking Customer Service escalations which relate to their managed portfolio and solving these in the most efficient manner for the business, partner and customer
Support the organisation of events, such as workshops and webinars, for partners. Also expected to attend and participate in the partner events for their managed portfolio
What you’ll bring:
Strong and engaging communication skills
Solution oriented and results driven
Ability to influence partners over the phone to implement suggestions;
Strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful
Proactive, flexible and capable of working independently as well as working in a team]
Ability to prioritise own workload and efficiently manage their time
Eye for accuracy and ability to be analytical
Language: English written and verbal
A valid drivers license in the UK
In return, we’ll provide:
A performance-based company with competitive salary and bonuses
A great platform for learning and development
The opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds from all over the planet
Please submit your CV and motivation letter in English.

Booking Holdings Romania is a Center of Excellence based in Bucharest, Romania and was created to support the increasing business demands of the Booking Holdings Brands. The Center of Excellence provides access to specialized and highly skilled talent, leading industry best practices, and collaboration opportunities across all of our Brands.
As part of our Booking Holdings Romania team, you will have the opportunity to be a part of the world’s leading provider of online travel, with a mission of making it easier for everyone to experience the world through six-primary consumer facing brands: Booking.com, Priceline, Agoda, KAYAK, OpenTable and Rentalcars.com.
  About the role
The Procurement Analyst is responsible for delivering the analytics supporting spend management and sourcing projects in procurement.  The role includes working with key procurement systems and analytics tools, supporting market sourcing events, and project planning and tracking.  The position has global responsibilities across procurement and reports to the BPM Lead within Booking Holdings procurement.
  Benefits (Beyond Your Salary):
23 vacation days per year so you can explore the world
Health insurance
Meal vouchers
Performance-based bonuses to reward your hard work.
International environment full of open, creative and passionate people 
Learning and development opportunities to grow your skill-set and future career
  What You’Ll Be Doing:
Deliver the spend analytics, market insights development, events (RFP’s and related insights development) all to help drive an efficient sourcing process.
Deliver the reporting to support the PMO, including saving tracking and reporting, senior level communications.
Keep the central procurement website updated for the business.
Deliver vendor related information and insights to support vendor management.
Manage and improve the reporting tools (iValua, analytics and project management)
Support the ideation and implementation of global sourcing strategies with research and insights leading to opportunity development.
What Skills Do You Need:
Minimum of 3 years of progressive experience in consulting, analytics development, or business process improvement.
Minimum of 2 years of working in a global environment.
Experience with data analytics and project management tools.
Deep knowledge of working with excel, powerpoint and other related databases.
Experience in working with Finance, Procurement and the business owners to estimate, validate and report savings.
Ability to collaborate effectively with global teams and manage conflicting objectives to deliver value creation
Fluent English language written & spoken. 
Experience with Source-to-Pay tools (e.g., iValua, SAP Ariba) and other procurement and finance tools is highly desirable.
Why Join Us? 
  Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands – Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable.
  The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. This role with Booking Holdings Romania will be working closely with our various brands:
Booking.com: Booking.com is a global online leader in connecting travelers with the widest choice of incredible places to stay.
Priceline: Priceline is a leader in online discount travel. HQ: Norwalk, Connecticut
Agoda: Agoda is a leading global online accommodations provider based in the heart of Asia. HQ: Singapore
Rentalcars.com: Rentalcars.com is operated as part of Booking.com and offers online rental car reservation services. HQ: Manchester, England
KAYAK: KAYAK provides an online price comparison service (often referred to as a “meta-search”) that allows consumers to easily search and compare travel itineraries and prices. HQ: Stamford, Connecticut
OpenTable: OpenTable is a leading brand for booking online restaurant reservations. HQ: San Francisco, California
At Booking Holdings we help our customers to reach all corners of the earth. Our ability to provide great service rests on how well we understand our diverse customer base, which is why having a diverse team is so important to us.  We bring together employees from all walks of life and we are proud to provide the kind of inclusive environment that stimulates innovation, creativity and collaboration.

Operations and Product Support Executive - Manchester
  Operations administrative activities are a central hub within the business bridging both our customers and suppliers worldwide. We are looking for individuals who are passionate about our customer and product and can build relationships both internally within business functions and externally, with our customers and suppliers to ultimately deliver a great customer experience. The successful candidate will support colleagues, partners and customers to ensure a smooth journey by finding efficient solutions to critical problems; in order to do so the candidate will have a deep knowledge of our product and systems, will be able to build and maintain strong stakeholder relationships and have exceptional understanding of our markets.
  Key Responsibilities
Functions as the primary point of contact for non automated supplier booking which require manual intervention. Working with internal, external suppliers, partner- and customer-facing products.
Is an expert for a selection of products and handles all general incoming requests using our ticketing system (Zendesk).

Contributes to initiatives to reach the ambitions and vision of the team, whilst keeping a balance with the core responsibility of handling tickets coming from reporters.
