The Lead Recruiter role is responsible for executing the talent acquisition strategy and delivering hiring results for our marketing technology function.
You will be a a passionate customer and candidate advocate with proven analytical capabilities and multitasking skills, extreme attention to detail, and the ability to effectively prioritize and multi-task. The Lead Recruiter will also be a self-starter with operational recruiting experience and a passion for recruiting, a high level of flexibility, commitment, and the ability to tackle ambiguity.
They collaborate with their TA Manager, senior members of their business functions and HR colleagues to ensure quality, quantity and timely communication.
Key Responsibilities:
Manage full cycle recruiting efforts for critical hiring in our fast growing global organization
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders including Tech Marketing business leads, HR, sourcing & coordination
Provide strategic guidance and advice in a true partnership with Leadership team
Strong track record of solving problems, delivering impact as a Lead Recruiter, and meeting deadlines
Act as a talent advisor by providing guidance to hiring managers and their interview teams to deliver on their talent needs to best match the needs of Booking’s Tech Marketing Unit and external talent
Gather and utilise relevant data to support and influence hiring strategies including sourcing, inclusion, branding and efficiency
Act as a Brand Ambassador, builds out talent networks and activates knowledgeable industry sources to develop and generate an ongoing pool of candidates through a diverse mix of sources
Deliver on the promise to recruit a diverse candidate pipeline and slate
Uses data to create, measure and scale smart recruiting tactics
Manages the hiring process and a first class candidate experience end-to-end, with support of the coordinators and sourcers when and where applicable
IDEAL EXPERIENCE: 
8+- years of progressive recruiting experience
3+ years of senior hiring experience advising and influencing executive leadership, preferably in retained executive search and/or in-house experience for a VC, start-up, e-commerce or hyper-growth tech company. 
BA/BS degree, Masters or MBA preferred
Confirmed capability to work effectively in a team-based organization, collaborate cross-functionally and globally, exercise influence at very senior levels, and build alignment. 
Proven ability to develop and maintain relationships with key Senior stakeholders and manage relationships with third party executive search firms
Advanced ability to develop recruiting strategies for the sourcing, evaluation and selection of executive talent
Excellent negotiation skills with proven ability to sell and close executive candidates and exchange information with all levels of management.
Strong understanding of senior level compensation vehicles
Experience working in a high performance environment in a role where multiple projects and competing demands are the norm
Familiar with internet based tools for sourcing and maintaining candidates
OTHER PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS
Proactive individual that is hands on, but also a talent strategist
Superb communication skills; Capacity to create compelling conversation with top talent and engage interest
Highly articulate, able to convey complex arguments and engage with senior level executives in a polished and professional manner
Combine tenacity with tact; know when to apply more pressure and when to give in
Self assured, not easily thrown, able to think on your feet
Outgoing and gregarious, enjoy interacting with a variety of people
Inquisitive; a strong desire to learn
Executive gravitas; must be comfortable interacting with senior leaders
Strong commercial acumen; an interest and high-level understanding of business operating models, terms and metrics, plus the ability to compare this very competitors and share with external profiles and internal stakeholders

Job Title: Senior Full Stack Developer, FinTech - Wallet and Rewards
Job Description:
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world.
We’re a truly global e-commerce company, with business operations in nearly every country and city on the planet. And we want to make it easy for everyone, anywhere in the world, to pay for their travel or do business with our platform – whenever and however it’s convenient for them.
Our brand new FinTech business unit – with teams in Amsterdam, London and Shanghai – develops new products and drives innovation to help us continue removing financial friction from the travel  process. That makes buying and selling travel-related products and services simpler for both travellers and partners. The FinTech business unit is in charge of creating best in class payment experiences for bookers and merchants, and helps internal clients grow their businesses. 
Customer Payments is part of the FinTech business unit and is focused to offer a frictionless payment experience to our guests. Creating payment experiences is a big responsibility and a big challenge, but we have a real opportunity to have a true impact on our travellers, solve real problems and enable them to experience the world better. From offering unique payment timings to solving customers FX problems we focus on excelling in the basics but constantly innovating at the same time. 
What you’ll be doing:
As a Senior Full Stack Software Developer, you will be responsible for the development, performance, and scaling of our public website as well as internal systems. You should have a keen interest in modern web applications, APIs, and their relation. You integrate them in a clean and structured manner through planning and collaboration with your colleagues. You are eager to learn, improve your skills and help our platform evolve. You will work independently and will also be responsible for making technical decisions within a team. You will work side-by-side with designers, product owners, copywriters and other developers to create new features, test your own ideas, and push changes live for billions of users.
Combine hands on coding with working on impactful project(s) and supporting other team members
Development and delivery of distributed systems and services as per business needs
Solve business problems, work cross-functionally and lead initiatives to improve our development process and business opportunities within Booking.com
Collaborating with adjacent teams and other stakeholders to deliver on business objectives
Take initiative to address the larger technical needs of the product you work on and always keep the customer at the center of everything you do
Contribute to the growth of Booking.com through recruitment efforts and proactively share your knowledge to help your colleagues grow
Represent Booking.com values, both within the company and in the external community
Lead by example by taking ownership, being proactive and advocating for a collaborative working environment by turning “my ideas” into “our ideas”.
Nurture, grow and develop engineering talent in the team.
What you’ll bring:
A minimum of 6 years of experience with one or more general purpose programming languages, including but not limited to: Java, Python, Scala, C++, Perl and Web development with JavaScript (React or Vue.js preferred), HTML, CSS and HTTP.
You have experience working with applications, distributed systems and product(s) that impact millions of customer
Experience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc.
Having experience with Kafka, Maven, Docker, and Kubernetes is a plus.
You are an excellent communicator and you are able to influence and cooperate with people at all levels
You have driven successful technical, business and people related initiatives that improved productivity, performance and quality
You have a ‘can do’ attitude and you act proactively and not reactively
You are creative and not afraid to step outside of your comfort zone
Passionate learners and have a desire to work with new tools and technologies to build a great end-to-end customer experience.
You have experience with mentoring, coaching and training team members, formal and informal
In return, we’ll provide:
The Senior Full Stack position is open to worldwide candidates. We provide assistance to you and your family with a relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe. 
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide
Be part of a truly international fast paced environment and performance driven culture.
Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-job opportunities to grow via side projects, hackathons, conferences and your involvement in the community.
Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits
Performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential
Full relocation support for you and your family (if the case) to move to Amsterdam - one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe.
Company-sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture
Diverse and creative colleagues from every corner of the world
With over 70 different nationalities within the technology department alone, you will be able to absorb new skills and grow your career in a multicultural environment.
  Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

As a Program Manager you help drive the People Agenda aligned to our business objectives managing a portfolio of complex change initiatives globally, and projects that span multiples business units, people areas and geographies. In this role you lead cross-functional teams across HR and the business, ensuring effective implementation and a high adoption of HR change. 
You are capable of directly managing a number of Project Managers, Project Analysts and utilising PMO and additional resources to achieve success. You are a leader of the COE teams that you work with and continuously ensure the COE teams are on track and designing the right change for the business and employee needs. You also play a key role in ensuring employee experience centred design out of COEs, supporting their effectiveness and driving their agenda for success. 
You partner with Director and LT in a critical advisory capacity, challenging their direction and delivery and influencing as required to ensure the people plan is put first and the departments strategic priorities and effectively delivered.
B.Responsible
Lead individual/multiple COE teams to develop effective processes, approaches, procedures and products 
Develop and deliver against complex project and program plans to help drive forward COEs and ensure the People Department delivers the strategic change to the business
Drive COE effectiveness - challenging designs, delivery and sequencing of change
Expand program offering and enhancing the quality of existing projects and programs
Set the direction and hold cross-functional teams accountable for delivering against agreed objectives and people plan
Raise risk to PLT/LT and develop robust mitigation plans to overcome risk
Directly manage team(s) of project managers, analysts and cross-team functional team members as required for program success
Develop effective communication plans and communications in partnership with the COEs to ensure change lands effectively out to this business
Manage PPD budgets and support COE budgetary spend on the right change support (e.g. external agencies and consultancies) - support the SOW and contracting as necessary
Run design workshops and ensure employee experience centred design across the portfolio of projects and COE delivery
Develop, report and track success metrics on program performance to PLT and leadership 
Effectively influence and obtain sponsorship from PLT, ELT, Leadership to achieve program success and overcome resistance to change 
Develop a trusted and critical adviser relationship with the People Leadership Team, ELT and LT - ensuring that the people agenda is high up on the businesses strategic agenda and that sufficient time and attention is given to the right activities at the right time
Identifying opportunities for continual improvement across the People Department
Ensure relevant compliance, standards, policy and regulations are upheld across the project portfolio
Own the full project and change life cycle  of programs/value streams
Break down complex business challenges into smaller problems with actionable solutions for every team involved globally
Provide on-site leadership, establishing practices, templates, tools and partnerships to expand and mature program and project capabilities within the team and department
Be able to competently manage a team of direct reports to achieve the above responsibilities
Bridge the gap between COEs and HR Advisory teams to reduce silo’d working and bring greater alignment, collaboration and working dynamic to the department
B.Skilled 
Strong leadership skills including the ability to lead up, across and down multiple people and business organizations
Ability to influence and steer leadership and extended leadership
Able to develop, support and deliver people strategies
8+ years of experience managing the full project and change lifecycle and achieve business results
Exceptional communication, stakeholder management and conflict resolution skills
8+ years of experience maintaining relationships and working with (senior) business stakeholders within a cross-functional matrix environment
Proven ability  to work effectively at all levels in an organization
Proven ability to influence others and move toward a common vision or goal, overcoming obstacles and delivering solutions to problems
Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations and under pressure
Organized with a natural inclination for planning strategy and operational excellence
Problem solving and root cause identification skills
In-depth HR knowledge of practices, processes, target operating models, OD, design and employee experience
Acute business acumen and understanding of organizational issues and challenges
Experience with large-scale organizational change - including driving transformation change across regions globally
M&A experience preferable

Job Title: Senior Technology Product Manager - Identity Data Management
Job Description:
Senior Technology Product Manager - Identity Data Management
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.
Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission. We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
Booking.com is looking for a Senior Technology Product Manager to join our Horizontal Business Services department at our Amsterdam headquarters.
About Identity Platform
Identity Platform is a track within Booking.com’s Horizontal Business Services and Central Technology organization focusing on all aspects of user identities. Our vision is to enable the business to know the customers, focusing on Guests and Partners. 
Our mission is to “provide one account for everyone, through an identity platform that covers: identity and access management, centralized account management, consolidated storage of account data and centralized privacy management and compliance.”
Our strategy comprises of: 
Centralized data storage, security & governance through the User Account Storage team
Account identification & authentication for all platforms and product verticals through Identity & Access Management team 
Centralized account management and consistent user experience of personal data management through the Identity User Experience team
Customer data accessible to all the product verticals in a compliant manner, available at scale in near real-time manner, from every application stack through the Rich User Context Service team 
B.responsible
The scope of the role consists of 3 areas:
Continue the consolidation of user personal details across the business
We care deeply about the security and privacy of our customers, and we embarked on a journey to consolidate them in a centralized storage with the right governance on top (including: data ownership, discoverability, granular access control, auditability).
As a Sr Technology Product Manager for the team you would need to:
Lead your team through the decommissioning process of existing storages of personal details
Adapt the migration strategy to the constantly evolving needs and constraints imposed by the business
Constantly communicate with stakeholders and influence them on adoption of the service which provides access to the details
  Build and drive the adoption of the User API
Identity Platform product offering includes the User API which is a GraphQL friendly interface to consume the personal details of our users, tailored to the needs of the business.
As a Sr Technology Product Manager for the team you would need to:
Define 1y+ roadmap for building out the service
Listen to your customers (the business) assess their needs, prioritize and plan features
Define the go to market strategy for the User API
Create a compelling package for the User API which includes: A-grade documentation, telemetry, strong SLO & SLI’s
Drive its adoption across the business
  Build and drive the adoption of the Rich User Context Service:
In the process of creating the best experience and products for our customers when they travel around the world, there is a need for a single, consistent data model, usable (and used) by all verticals, that comprise data from our canonical customer data (user account data), near real-time customer behavioral history, transactional data and any derivative of the long term customer historical data (segmentation, cohort, etc.). 
We want to build the Rich User Context Service which makes all of this data available at scale, in near real-time manner, from every application stack.
As the Technology Product Manager for the team, you would need to:
Engage with technical stakeholders (architects, fellow technical product managers, engineers) to expand the coverage of the service following open-closed principles
Engage with a non-technical audience to identify and extract requirements from the features they plan to deliver / sponsor within their side of the business, which would drive the development of the Rich User Context Service
Collaborate with the Group Product Manager and the Senior Engineer Manager to spinoff the product team which will build the service
Own the go-to-market strategy for the Rich User Context Service including end customers feedback and feature optimization, internal customers onboarding and collaboration, drive for service adoption across Booking.com product teams and govern the consistent data model behind the service
Ruthlessly prioritize the team’s backlog, create a 1year+ roadmap and resolve impediments which would arise along the way 
B.skilled
5+ years of experience in Product Management at web based companies.
Strong track record in stakeholder management and complex roadmap development
Strong product insight (balancing customer & business needs)
Strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful
Proactive, flexible and capable of working independently as well as working in a team
Good communication (e.g. public speaking) and analytical skills
Scrappy and able to deal with ambiguity and uncertainty
Strong examples of collaboration with technology crafts to define and prioritize ideas against customer problems
Technical Background and experience with managing services in a service oriented architecture is required 
Familiarity with GraphQL, Domain Driven Design is a plus.
Solution oriented and result driven
Ability to multi-task & flexible attitude
Strong project management skills
B.offered
In this position you will have the opportunity to grow others through mentorship and pursue a management career if it is something that you would be interested in.
This position is open to worldwide candidates. We provide assistance for you and your family with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated 300+ technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year.
Headquarters located in one of the most vibrant cities in Europe: Amsterdam
Performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.
Training, regular hackathons and opportunities to travel and attend global conferences.
Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits.
Company sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture.
Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world.

About Segments
Segments is part of the Accommodations Business Unit and is responsible for delivering many critical company priorities. The teams within Segments are responsible for defining and driving product and business strategies and plans specific to key growth areas such as non-hotel accommodation types, high-value customer segments and targeting length of stay options.  
The Program Management Office (PMO) team in Segments plays a vital strategic role in the company’s ability to deliver on these broad strategic goals that will define future success as this team is responsible for liaising with key senior stakeholders, establishing the governance for prioritization, resource allocation and decision making, and execution through program management of strategic initiatives within the department, tracking and managing dependencies with other teams and Business Units across the company - essentially establishing the connective tissue between strategy and operational execution.
About the role
The Senior Program Manager will be a part of the Segments Business Operations and Program Management team and is responsible for leading a team of project managers in executing the Short-term Rental (STR) Regulatory Compliance Program through governance and E2E program management.
The Senior Program Manager will provide strategic leadership for the STR regulatory compliance program, providing guidance to help address tactical remediation of issues and thought leadership for ongoing strengthening of the effectiveness of the team.
The Senior Program Manager role partners closely with Legal and Public Affairs (including Compliance), while also managing a small STR operations and product team to advise and develop key operational strategies, implementation plans and best practices to ensure our business meets regulatory compliance requirements around the globe. They will drive the scoping of the overall program and work with the team to set the roadmaps/plans with focus on agreed business priorities and strategies. 
The Senior Program Manager also directs and supports the team to identify, manage and track requirements, dependencies, risks and challenges for key initiatives, needed from cross-functional teams (Legal, Compliance, Tax, Public Affairs, Product, Tech, Business Operations, Partner Services) and external regulatory authorities to ensure all projects are delivered to meet the requirements, with quality and on time.
The Senior Program Manager ensures that the functional workload of the STR operations and product team is managed in a consistent manner, whilst working with others to build engagement and where applicable, governance over decisions needed for work to be signed off.
  Responsibilities
First and foremost, the Senior Program Manager ensures that the team's roadmaps/plans focus on agreed business priorities, dependencies and strategies, and they deliver against the shared objectives and main activities with key milestones that have been agreed upon. Thought-leadership, lead independently and influence business decisions/priorities:
Own and drive the business's position/vision on STR regulatory compliance and influence policy through ownership of the capabilities that underpin our public affairs team’s ability to advocate to manage the impact of STR Regulations on our business (financially, reputationally and operationally)
High complexity (strategic/ critical priority) end-to-end (E2E) program management from scoping to execution, analysis, recommendation and implementations
Provide thought leadership and subject matter expertise for compliance issues.
Evolve and streamline how we manage and implement STR regulations w/ Product, Legal, Public Affairs, Compliance, Partner Services and other departments (e.g. automate where we can and put better monitors/controls in place)
Prioritization of business priorities and projects for team
Decision-making at program and/or project level based on quantitative and qualitative data
Enable teams & leaders to make quality decisions and ability to exercise escalation path to senior leadership when critically needed
Be the driving force that collaborates with business, partner services and legal/public affairs teams across Booking to make sure your teams deliver world class product and operational solutions that are highly scalable, secure, and flexible - all the while maintaining a strong customer focus.
Interact with project sponsors, project stakeholders and multiple business and functional teams to define and deliver projects from simple to complex in nature 
Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance the business needs versus regulatory constraints
Plan and manage multiple parallel projects with support from a small team of project managers
Slice through ambiguity and drive clarity where confusion exists; leveraging existing or learned expertise with strong business acumen
Maximize resources for the greater good of the organization, identify inefficient processes or waste and redirect resources as necessary
Identify, assess, track and mitigate issues and risks at multiple levels
Create, maintain and disseminate program and project information to stakeholders via regular reporting
Communicate project issues and status in a concise, accurate, and professional manner
Apply best practices to the software development lifecycle (SDLC) for projects based on experiences with a number of agile and blended approaches, as well as effectively coordinating the implementations across teams using very different approaches.
Not afraid to get their hands dirty and take on a project if required.
Requirements of special knowledge/skills
Bachelor's degree
Strong project management skills/experience including experience with a range of different methodologies and techniques. Preferably having a background in Agile Project management, PMI certification and / or LEAN
Proven track record to independently lead high complexity (end-2-end) projects, drive multiple medium complexity projects and/or manage program portfolio of projects 
Have a solid business understanding, independently use quantitative and qualitative data to drive decision making
Analytical skilled and mastering data handling and measuring success, ability to tell a clear story with data/insights
Change management experience & mind-set
Strong interpersonal skills focused on collaboration. 
Effectively communicate including large audiences
Ability to influence and steer leadership, senior management and groups
Ability to break up a complex problem into actionable and easy to understand solutions.
Able to function well within ambiguity and in a constantly changing environment
Experience in short-term rental regulatory compliance, product management and/or business operations is a plus

Job Title: Senior Engineering Manager, App Core Experience - Mobile
Job Description:
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more. Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission. We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
Our mission is to become the #1 travel app in the world. To be the #1 travel app, we need to be “top of mind” for travelers from the time they start dreaming & planning their trip, all the way till their trip is complete. We interact with millions of customers everyday via the app, and given that we are “in the hands & pockets” of our customers at all times, we have a massive opportunity to maximize user value from the app and use this to build trust and drive loyalty with them. 
We’re looking for a Senior Engineering Manager for the App Core Experience track. In this role you will be growing and leading teams and engineers, shaping the technical direction and overseeing delivery of innovation in key areas of our mobile apps, ultimately increasing the customer value of our app at different stages before, during and after travelling.
You enable your team, its growth and success. You can hold your own in a technical argument, but you know getting out of the way is often the best option. You get things done via influence, not authority. You unlock the creativity of your team and inspire them to build the best for our customers. You work closely with your product counterparts to ensure we are always working towards what’s most important for our customers. And you take full end to end responsibility for your area.
  B. Responsible
Define and own the tech strategy of the track 
Lead, mentor and inspire a group of highly engaged group of engineers and managers
Drive innovation through strategic prioritisation and technical subject matter expertise
Closely partner up with your product and UX counterparts and other senior leaders in App Core in shaping the product vision, creating the delivery roadmaps, and managing their execution across a complex set of internal and external dependencies.
Influence senior stakeholders across the business to reach and maintain strategic and tactical alignment
Lead by example by taking ownership, being proactive and collaborating
Guide software development delivery, quality and practices within your team
Nurture, grow and develop engineering talent in the team and foster a great culture
B.Skilled
Demonstrable experience in shaping and leading a software engineering across multiple teams and subjects (5+ years as a manager)
Strong understanding of mobile app development and experience leading mobile-focused teams
Track record leading teams that build new products as well as teams in charge of foundational product iteration
Experience leading through others as well as directly and a knack for growing and scaling highly engaged and productive teams
Natural leader and communicator who is collaborative and builds great relationships
A passion for connecting the dots and collaborating with various stakeholders to prioritize what maximizes business value
Experience working on the Booking App
Our Ideal Candidate Has
Broad experience directing full stack engineering work but has a passion for mobile apps
A proven track record of both building new products & scaling existing ones
A servant leadership style, is an experienced mentor and is passionate about people
Strong experience hiring and growing teams and managers
Strong commercial awareness and customer empathy
Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

As job holder you will have end-to-end ownership of the Digital Partner Content Distribution Program within the Digital Content Platforms Team, whose goal is to provide the right content at scale to our existing and potential partners that empowers them to discover support and commercial opportunities for their business.
You will innovates and optimize all program processes and interact with key stakeholders to prioritize the correct focus, drive improvement and refine the program strategy. Work, guide and support team members working in the same program to achieve overall goals and works closely with other program managers within Partner Experience to create end-to-end strategies as part of a larger Digital Content Platforms team.
Within the Digital Partner Content Distribution Program, the Digital Content Marketing Manager is responsible for the overall digital partner content distribution strategy on the partner hub platform as well as distributing content on other digital channels. 
On platform this role is owning the content distribution strategy and content calendar for the Partner Hub homepage, on platform banners and the on platform logged-in environment. 
Off platform, this role is owning the content distribution / integration strategy  of published content on the Partner Hub Content towards our GTM channels as well as our Partner Journeys and in other automated communication towards our global partner base.
Role responsibilities: 
Program ownership
Be able to drive the long-term team vision through generating new projects and initiatives, bringing all team members on board. 
Create a backlog of user stories and projects for their topic area.
Prioritize user stories and projects, based on the expected business impact. 
Define key results for their program, based on both internal business needs and external partner behaviors.
Ensure the delivery of changes and improvements in their topic area.
Define key success metrics for their area in line with company, department and team strategies, monitor overall performance, and initiate optimizations in their topic area.
Take ownership in setting and elevating standards in their area of expertise.
Program management and reporting
Provide a centralized view of weekly and monthly program status reporting ensuring that key stakeholders are aware of the health of the program and any key actions required.
Facilitate regular reviews with leadership teams to action on, highlighting key insights to inform their decision-making process. 
Ensure escalation or exception to assure project delivery success.
Innovation
Guide, consult and support a set of team members within the program and constantly drive optimization and improvements of program performance.
Develop and optimize digital marketing strategies within the domain.
Use depth and breadth of expertise to balance exploration with execution. Be able to pragmatically maintain agreed standards while continuing to explore ways to take on and solve new challenges enhancing personal and business development.
Be the voice of the partners within the organization based on the partner needs framework and research and partners’ feedback to ensure qualitative and effective communication.
Improve the digital channels in their scope to improve our partner reach, quality of communication or support specific business needs.  
Business impact
Have a clear understanding of, and influence on, the business impact of team projects.
Actively supports others to find clarity on business initiatives and is widely accepted in the business as a key driver of value creation towards business ambitions.
Able to create consistent reporting to showcase results and business impact on different projects
Controls budget, forecasts costs and prioritizes investments to maximize the return on investment on campaign, tooling and 3rd party providers.
Creates business cases that support strategy decisions and/or investment need that align with the business goals and initiative
Stakeholder management
Establish long-term, productive relationships with a diverse set of internal stakeholders.
Actively influence cross-team relationships to gain wide acceptance of interdependencies and collaboration and ensure learnings and successes are widely shared amongst relevant communities. 
Accelerate not only individual scope, but others’ topics as well, based on effective stakeholder management.
Role responsibilities 
A minimum of 5 years of digital marketing experience, including hands-on experience. 
Experience in Business-to-business marketing, working in a commercial setting of a global, multichannel e-commerce company.
Business acumen to quickly understand Booking’s objectives and key results and the way all parts of the company work together to realise our ambitions.
Self-starter with the ability to collaborate across teams and parts of the organisation to deliver results.
Excellent communication, and presentation skills with the ability to facilitate discussions with executives and execution teams, and the ability to express complex technical concepts in business terms
Creative thinker with excellent analytical skills and learning mindset.
Structural analysis to create business cases  
Business case and budget management skills 
Strong and high energy team player with a high degree of flexibility and positive communication that motivates and influences achievement of team objectives.
Excellent organizational skills, ability to prioritize tasks, and manage time efficiently. High performer with the ability to manage parallel tracks and expectations for project scope changes, seeing intersection points, and mitigating risks.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment that changes rapidly.
Digital Partner Content Distribution specific:
5+ years of experience in setting  content strategies for and executing on (prioritizing, developing and optimizing) content operations and content distribution. 
Proven experience in capturing, managing and distributing knowledge across large organizations, leading to new initiatives that improve efficiency and partner (customer) satisfaction.
Understanding of and experience in content management systems such as Drupal. 
Understanding of asset lifecycle management including meta data and governance. 
Able to develop guiding principles, standards and best practices based on business goals and content strategies 
Able to develop content personalisation strategies based on audience segments and life cycle stages.

Recruitment Manager - People
At Booking.com, our mission is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. While that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.
At the Recruitment Manager for the People function you are responsible for delivering hiring results for our People teams,  whilst partnering with Senior Leadership and colleagues in the development and execution of the global talent acquisition strategy, recruitment processes and analytics.
Reporting into the Senior Manager for all commercial and corporate functions and is based in our HQ in Amsterdam.  You’ll need amazing people skills to manage your key stakeholders in the People function across EMEA whilst identifying and securing the most coveted talent in the industry while always providing an engaging candidate experience
Benefits (Beyond Your Salary):
Lots of vacation days so you can explore the world.
Accommodation discount, so you can explore for less.
A huge learning and development platform tailored to you.
Performance-based bonuses to reward your hard work.
What You’Ll Be Doing:
Ensure the People recruitment team is proactive in achieving hiring targets, inspiring a dispersed team of recruiters.
Regular communication with hiring managers and key stakeholders across all aspects of the people function
In partnership with the recruitment leadership team, improve the recruitment process in the organisation including application of metrics, measurement, reporting and taking action to close gaps.
Establish an effective selection process and ensure adoption.
Informed of market trends and recruiting practices.
Proactively share recruitment topics, progress, innovations and results.
Conduct performance evaluations and prepare developmental plans for staff.
Continually develop domain knowledge of the business function.
Manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
Handle multiple problems simultaneously with high judgment.
Have excellent problem solving, organisational, interpersonal and motivational skills.
What You Need To Do It:
Demonstrable experience of recruiting in a fast-paced environment with a strong work ethic; self-directed, resourceful, works independently, motivated by own drive and enthusiasm, capable of working independently as well as working in a team
Leadership and managerial experience with a team 5+.
A role model in creative sourcing strategies.
Demonstrated ability to partner with key stakeholders in execution of recruiting initiatives.
Has strong project management skills; organisational skills and ability to manage complex strategic and operational processes
Strong analytical skills, ability to leverage data to support a business case then pursues creative solutions.
Engaging leader that supports teamwork and putting others forward.
Excellent communication skills, able to influence and develop strong relationships.
Proven ability to work well under pressure and capable of adapting and responding to change.
Experience working in a globally matrixed environment.
Partners and influences senior leadership; is self-confident, and capable in building proactive and meaningful relationships throughout our global organisation.
Frequent domestic and international travel is to be expected in this role.
Must be passionate about travel!
Why Join Us? 
Our mission is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. We began by taking hotel bookings online over 20 years ago and we’ve been shaping the travel industry ever since. Today, we’re building a platform that connects every part of a trip – from a great place to stay to getting there, getting around, seeing the sights and sampling local life.
The times have changed, but our core values remain the same. Our company culture and work environment continues to flourish digitally with an array of business updates, well-being programs, hackathons, virtual coffee catch-ups, music streaming events, volunteering initiatives, webinars and more. This new reality has only made our teams closer as we unite to fulfil our mission.
We continue to invest in innovation and in our People. We’re solving some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology and plan for exciting opportunities ahead.
Booking.com was recently ranked #3 in the Financial Times’ 2021 Diversity Leaders list of European employers, and we couldn’t be more proud. It’s a great recognition for our colleagues around the world, who effortlessly work to create a welcoming and open environment in which people can connect and learn from each other.

Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Customer Insights - Accommodations
Job Description:
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
The Customer Insights department is looking for data savvy professionals to join our Machine Learning team. You will have the opportunity to build machine learning products that will be used across various departments of our business to help us predict and understand our customers’ behavior, enabling us to offer them the most relevant personalized experience.
As a Machine Learning Engineer in the Valuation team, you’ll have the chance to work on our Customer Lifetime Value models and play an integral role in taking them to the next level!  You’ll have the chance to collaborate closely with other Analysts, Engineers, Product Managers and various business stakeholders and take full ownership of your work - from the initial idea generation phase to the implementation of the final product.
You will thrive at Booking.com if you are result-focused, innovative, and with a solid quantitative background, but most of all by understanding our complex business model and the logic behind it.
  B.RESPONSIBLE
Develop production-grade machine learning code, from models to features and pipelines, allowing for scalability, real-time inference, monitoring and retraining.
Build readable and reusable code, choosing the right technologies, coding methodologies and approach from carefully designed rapid prototyping to software deployment at scale. 
Monitor product health, performance and business impact and act accordingly when requirements are not met.
Identify underlying issues and opportunities across related domains and situations through application of structured thinking and logic.
Solve issues by applying methods and insights gained from a variety of disciplines, navigating a variety of environments.
Make things happen by maintaining motivation and conveying a sense of urgency, focusing on outcomes and accomplishments.
Clearly communicate with stakeholders at all levels.
Continuously evolve your craft, keeping up to date with the latest technologies.
Actively contribute to Machine Learning at Booking.com through training, exploration of new technologies, interviewing, onboarding and mentoring colleagues.
B.SKILLED
At least 3 years of relevant work experience, involved with the application of Machine Learning to business problems, preferably in a commercial environment.
Knowledge of multiple machine learning facets, such as working with large data sets, experimentation, scalability and optimization.
Experience running Machine Learning systems in production is a must.
Strong working experience in one or more general purpose programming languages, including but not limited to: Java, Scala, Python or Perl.
Strong working knowledge of Spark and SQL.
Experience working in a cloud environment and with containers/orchestration (e.g. docker/kubernetes) is a plus.
Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal; the ability to convey your message to team members and other stakeholders.
BSc or higher in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Software Engineering, or related fields.
B.Offered
Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide
Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture
Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com

The Company

It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
Do you enjoy taking ownership and being responsible for your own internal business portfolio? Do you thrive in building strong relationships and inspiring partners about new products and services? If your answer is “yes”, you might have what it takes to be the next Account Manager at our amazing Madrid office! This is a temporary contract linked to a maternity cover.

B.responsible

You will empower partners on how to use the system, tools and available products of Booking.com BV with the goal of optimizing their performance on the platform and creating an amazing experience for Booking’s customers.
B.capable
Communicating effectively: you can clearly express ideas and information to others and flex your style according to the specific situation and audience

2 years of experience in a relevant account management function
Fluent English and Spanish
Affinity or experience within e-commerce and/or travel industry
Pro-active, sense of responsibility and can work independently

Team player, self-motivated, flexible and open to change
Positive attitude

Driver’s license

You already have a work permit to work in Spain

Booking.com BV is the world’s #1 accommodation site and the 3rd largest global e-commerce player. The diverse team, 15,000 strong, is united by a single mission: to empower people to experience the world. We connect travelers with the world’s largest selection of incredible places to stay, including everything from apartments, vacation homes, and family-run B&Bs to 5-star luxury resorts, tree houses and even igloos. Each day, more than 1,200,000 room nights are reserved on our platform.

As a Senior Director Horizontal Services, you are responsible for leading the Horizontal Business Services organization  within Central Technology, a department of self steering teams focused on scaling our products and platforms. 
Our vision is to empower people to experience the world. Wherever our customers go and whatever they do, they book it with us.
With over 1.5 million room nights booked every day in our 1.5 million + accommodations worldwide, our daily mission is to make travel, experience and exploration accessible for everyone, everywhere. We’re looking for a Machine Learning Manager to join our Content Intelligence team in Tel Aviv.
We build an AI platform that understands all aspects of our content (images, reviews, etc.) to provide a personalized experience for our customers.
In this role, you will manage a big team of ML scientists & engineers, tackling challenges in Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing and ML engineering. 
As a technical manager, you should be passionate about technology, keep up to date with recent breakthroughs in the field, define and shape the team’s ML roadmap, and not be afraid to get your hands dirty with code when needed.
B.Responsible
You will be part of the Content Intelligence team that builds the Content Intelligence Platform by consuming millions of images and textual inputs every day, and then enriching it with ML capabilities. Eventually, these will serve downstream applications and personalize our customers' experience (think of a way to choose and surface the right images and reviews when customers book their next vacation).
As the ML manager of the team, you are expected to be the focal point for all technical aspects, make sure your team members deliver on their tasks, and work together with other stakeholders to define and shape the roadmap of our products. You will work independently and will also be responsible for making technical decisions within your team.
When it comes to management, your expertise in handling people will motivate and inspire them to reach outstanding success! You should have experience in developing people. You will mentor and coach your team while working closely with a Product Manager.
Your responsibilities include:
Build a strong team within their area, by coaching and developing individual contributors
Prioritise work in collaboration with Product Managers, depending on business needs and keeping stakeholders aligned at all times.
Translate machine learning vision and strategy into planning and execution, and ensure timely delivery of their plans.
Develop innovative ML models, algorithms, and engineering approaches or identify existing ones, with the potential to impact our business. Design and execute applied research plans to understand, apply, test, evolve, and generalise these technologies into reusable frameworks.
Translate business problems into viable, reliable and robust ML and AI solutions, accounting for constraints of the production environment.
Monitor product health, performance and business impact and act accordingly when requirements are not met.
Identify underlying issues and opportunities across domains and situations that are not obviously related through application of structured thinking and logic.
Solve issues by applying methods and insights gained from a variety of disciplines, navigating a variety of environments.
Make things happen by maintaining motivation and conveying a sense of urgency, focusing on outcomes and accomplishments, while respecting the need to balance long- and short-term goals, by applying influencing techniques and decision making skills.
Drive, coach and mentor others through evidence and clear communication, explaining advanced technical concepts in simpler terms.
Continuously evolve your craft. Keep up to date with industry and academic standard methodologies, periodically explore new technologies, introduce them to the machine learning community and promote their application in areas where they can generate impact.
Actively contribute to Machine Learning at Booking.com through training, exploration of new technologies, interviewing,onboarding and mentoring colleagues.
Push for improvements, scaling and extending machine learning tooling and infrastructure, collaborating with central teams.
B.Skilled
Your skills include:
Advanced knowledge and experience in Computer Vision and Natural Language Processing, engineering aspects of developing ML models at scale.
Experience designing and executing end-to-end research and development plans and generating impact through large-scale machine learning model development. Preferably evidenced by peer-reviewed publication, patents, open sourced code or the like.
Relevant work or academic experience (MSc + 5 years of working experience, or PhD + 3 years of working experience), involved in the application of Machine Learning to business problems.
Masters degree, PhD or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence, Physics, etc.).
Experience on multiple machine learning facets: working with large data sets, model development, statistics, experimentation, data visualization, optimization, software development.
Experience collaborating cross functionally in the development of machine learning products (e.g. Developers, UX specialists, Product Managers, etc.).
Strong working knowledge of Python, Java, Kafka, Hadoop, SQL, and Spark or similar technologies. Working experience with version control systems.
Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.
3+ years leading an ML team of a minimum of 4 people in a fast-paced production environment.
Successfully driving technical, business and people related initiatives that improve productivity, performance and quality while communicating with stakeholders at all levels
Leading by example, gaining respect through actions, not your title. Developing your team and motivating them to achieve their goals. Providing feedback timely and managing your key team performance indicators

Core Recruiter - Tech Marketing
At Booking.com, our mission is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.
The Tech Marketing Recruiter is part of the functional, regional and operational Talent Acquisition team and will be dedicated in supporting our Marketing Business Unit and this role will report into Global Recruitment Manager.
They collaborate with the Snr Recruiter, Team Lead, hiring managers and interview teams of their business functions and HR colleagues to ensure quality, quantity and timely communication.
The Recruiter is a passionate customer and candidate advocate with proven analytical capabilities and multitasking skills, extreme attention to detail, and the ability to effectively prioritise and multi-task. They will be a self-starter with operational recruiting experience and a passion for recruiting, a high level of flexibility, commitment, and the ability to tackle ambiguity.
  Key Responsibilities:
Manages the hiring process and a first class candidate experience end-to-end, with support of the coordinators and sourcers when and where applicable (Delivers on the promise to recruit a diverse candidate pipeline and slate)
Acts as a talent advisor by providing guidance to hiring managers and their interview teams to deliver on their talent needs to best match the needs of Booking.com and external talent
Gathers market data and landscape for the Hiring Manager to support and influence hiring strategies, and is informed of market trends and recruiting practices
Partners with hiring managers and interview teams for a seamless process, and constant process improvements
Is proactive in achieving hiring targets through an effective selection process, and develops and generate an ongoing pool of candidates through a diverse mix of sources
Uses data to create, measure and scale smart recruiting tactics, gathers data for leads and manager
Executes labor legislation and required changes to ensure compliance
Follows global guidelines to ensure consistency and alignment of all TA products, tools, services and initiatives
Continually develops domain knowledge of the business function
Proactive providing feedback and ideas to Manager and Leads
Experience / Knowledge
Must be passionate about Talent Acquisition, and have experience in both or either Digital Marketing or Tech recruitment
Is solution oriented, result driven, proactive, flexible
Has strong organisational skills and ability to manage complex operational processes
Has a strong work ethic; self-directed, resourceful, works independently, motivated by own drive and enthusiasm, has demonstrated the ability to work well in a team
Has strong stakeholder management; demonstrated ability to partner with key stakeholders in execution of recruiting initiatives, partners and influences (senior) leadership, is self-confident and capable in building proactive and meaningful relationships throughout our global organisation
Has excellent communication skills; fluent in the English language, able to influence and develop strong relationships
Has strong analytical skills, ability to leverage data to support a business case then pursues creative solutions
Has a strong track record of solving complex problems, designing creative strategies, and delivering significant impact as a recruiter
Has a proven ability to work well under pressure, capable of adapting and responding to change and able to multitask
Has strong domain knowledge and expertise in search and talent acquisition
Has experience working in a global environment
Demonstrates personal accountability and integrity
Is collaborative, focuses on team spirit and knowledge sharing, and understand the value of working as one team
Is inquisitive; a strong desire to learn new things and improving existing processes
Thoughtful; thinks strategically, but stays on top of tactical execution – anticipates roadblocks and proactively creates solutions to ensure success

About the role
A Senior Coach has the capability to demonstrate advanced skills and competencies in the craft of agile software delivery within Accommodations Business Unit. They will be capable of taking on complex multi-team problems and will be able to draw on practical experience and modern industry practices that will help them solve challenges whilst ensuring they engage and influence the right audience. They will be competent in leading initiatives that solve complex problems, spearhead new thinking or establish new lasting behavioural patterns.
A Senior Agile Coach will have experience in varied environments inside and outside of Booking.com, in an Engineering, Product or design background enabling the coach to pull on a broad range of experiences that working with Engineering teams demands. They can articulate problems they observe and determine how these are impacting the business. They can clearly communicate their assessment to all levels of the business in order to create buy-in as an enabler for change.
Senior Coaches may/are capable of teaching, mentoring and coaching their peers in order to improve the bar of the team. They will be well versed in educating and influencing their peers to understand new ways of solving problems, new ways of thinking, challenging the current thinking, new tools and if so, working with their peers to solve problems together in order to improve their peers’ capability.
A Senior Coach will be able to demonstrate the capability to drive a problem through, to draw on ideas past their standard tool kit, and, in experiencing new challenges be versed in seeing this through to completion whilst encouraging a growth mindset.
A Senior Coach will challenge their peers to think differently so as to improve the overall capability of the function. 
A Senior Coach will be self-aware enough to recognise when they're dealing with a larger complex problem. For example, in a space where a customer problem exists that might be dealt with in an isolated fashion E.g. per team, a Senior Coach will be able to demonstrate the capability to drive effective delivery by rallying the right people to take hold of the problem and lead on a different way of thinking. By doing so, the Senior Coach is improving the capability of the wider engineering function.
A Senior Coach will continue to support objectives that are aligned with the businesses priorities. When supporting a piece of work, the coach will determine how and where they can best support the area to maximise value. The Senior Coach role remains a role that supports across the spectrum of a piece of work, which should involve supporting at product team level where necessary.

The Company

It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
Do you enjoy taking ownership and being responsible for your own internal business portfolio? Do you thrive in building strong relationships over the phone? Can you help Booking.com’s partners grow their business by providing them with analysis, growth opportunities and new products and services? If your answer is “yes”, you might have what it takes to be the next Account Executive at our Bristol office!

What you’ll be doing:
Pro-active communication with partners in your region by telephone and by internal messaging to assist with the development of Booking.com’s business
Responsible for a portfolio of partners where you are the first point of contact, answering questions and following up when needed
Responsible for maintaining a stable relationship with the accommodation partners (i.e. frequent performance calls and contact to ensure they offer Booking.com’s customers the best availability and competitive pricing)
Be knowledgeable on Booking.com’s products so that their benefits and usage can be explained to Partners
Identify opportunities for partners that will help improve Booking.com’s business by using its internal segmentation to prioritise
Help identifying new potential partner leads and pass these leads on for further follow up
Responsible for taking Customer Service escalations which relate to their managed portfolio and solving these in the most efficient manner for the business, partner and customer
Support the organisation of events, such as workshops and webinars, for partners. Also expected to attend and participate in the partner events for their managed portfolio
What you’ll bring:
Strong and engaging communication skills
Solution oriented and results driven
Ability to influence partners over the phone to implement suggestions;
Strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful
Proactive, flexible and capable of working independently as well as working in a team
Ability to prioritise own workload and efficiently manage their time
Eye for accuracy and ability to be analytical
Language: English written and verbal
An up to date Drivers License
In return, we’ll provide:
A performance-based company with competitive salary and bonuses
A great platform for learning and development
The opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds from all over the planet
Please submit your CV and motivation letter in English.

This role is part of the Digital Channels team within Digital Partner Experience (DPE) who focuses on scaling the management of our supply partners and ultimately empowering these partners to discover commercial growth opportunities. Our target audience includes a diverse range of accommodations globally, who are currently in partnership or in the process of partnering with Booking.com.

You are responsible for improving the different digital channels within your scope to improve our partner reach and engagement looking at the quality of our communication towards our Partners to strengthen our partnership and build trust to secure future business.  You will need to innovate and optimize the digital channel team’s processes and interaction with key stakeholders such as project managers within the accommodation business unit to  ensure collaboration is optimized for effectiveness and efficiency.
You will generate new complex projects and initiatives based on your specific digital marketing knowledge and experience, and be responsible for role modeling campaign design, execution, optimization of channel performance and innovation for the different digital messaging channels. You need to support other team members and bring them on board on initiatives that are added to the digital channel backlog in order to enhance the performance of the different messaging channels.

Channel Performance

Role models the use of hypothesis, A/B-Testing, experimentation and iteration approach to reaching goals and optimising key metrics.

Coordinate with all necessary stakeholders (eg. copywriters, translators, analyst, creative team, technology team) to have the message ready for execution on time.
Innovation
Work on complex projects/activities/campaigns/omnichannel-approaches that enhance the performance of the digital channel that they are specialized in. 
Contribute with optimizations that are added to the channel/program backlog items.
Drive the long-term vision through generating new team topics that contribute to the delivery of team success metrics: reach and engagement of digital channels. Bring all team members on board with their innovation/improvement ideas.

Front End Developer – Flights
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We're the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world.
Mission and Purpose
Our flight business is one of the cornerstones of the connected trip. We ought to offer the best and most convenient flights to every customer, those that start their trip by buying a flight or those that are complementing their existing journey with a flight. We will do this by having the best user experience available in a product that solves all the pain points of booking a flight today.
Cross-Sell and Value Team
The Flights Cross-Sell & Value team is a newly formed customer-facing team in the Flights track that focuses on helping the Flights customers to become aware of, find, and book an accommodation for the same trip. Think about customers who have just booked a flight. What are the best accommodation options for them? How and when to show these options? How to promote marketing actions to encourage customers to book the flight and the accommodation on Booking.com? How to explain the value of booking everything for the trip in one place? When to use machine learning to do this? Finding the answers to these questions will be the challenge of this multidisciplinary team
Front End Developer in the Flights team
As a Front End Developer in Flights, you will be a key part of the development process, making sure that we implement features from ideas to the end product. You will be part of a team that has full-ownership of everything related to marketing channels and will work with a multidisciplinary team of front end developers, backend developers, copywriters and UX designers.

Our ideal candidate has an excellent eye for detail, pragmatic approach and an absolute commitment to making sure features are well implemented and bug free. Agile Coaches are focused on continuous improvement and will work at all levels to identify improvement opportunities, guide stakeholders and teams, and create a culture of psychological safety.
In addition to coaching their teams, Agile Coaches will also make an organization-wide impact by providing training to craft experts and by driving topics such as team health metrics and effective communication.

Job Title: Senior Technical Program Manager - IT Services
Job Description:
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. 
In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.
Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.
We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
We are IT Services
We are looking for a person who is both strong technically and process oriented to work with teams across the booking landscape. You will work directly with customers, engineers, and senior leadership to scope and track projects. You will also assess risk, anticipate bottlenecks, and identify project milestones. A successful candidate will have a technical background, a mastery of program/project tools and techniques, and a proficiency in business and technical writing. You will closely work with principal engineers to help develop and track the big picture ideas for future projects. 
The IT Services Department owns and maintains all the corporate technology our Booking.com workforce needs day-to-day, so they can in-turn deliver great products to our customers.
This includes, for instance; SaaS applications, Identity, SSO, collaboration tools, productivity suites, communication platforms, endpoints, laptops, VDI solutions, video conferencing, voice infrastructure, Wi-Fi connectivity, VPN, ITSM and a plethora of other bespoke developed applications.
This will be achieved through defining, analyzing, and documenting requirements in order to identify the correct solution. As part of this role, you will also define scope objectives and formulate systems to parallel across multiple business strategies to ensure solutions are scalable or practical for the problem at hand. Part of this role will require you to analyze, evaluate, refine, and review processes of both your projects and your stakeholders.
 B.responsible
Responsible for the overall development life cycle of the solution and manage complex projects with significant bottom line impact
Create documentation requirements, gather and ensure design requirements are met. Also encourage engineering teams to create documentation artifacts as a priority
Apply best practices to the software development lifecycle (SDLC) for projects based on experiences with a number of agile and blended approaches, as well effectively coordinating the implementations across teams using very different approaches
Proficiency in business and technical writing
Assist in the planning, documentation, and communication of big picture ideas with leaders at Booking.com and at the Booking Holdings level
Responsible for managing the program / project backlog and conducting Scrum and Agile ceremonies for your project teams 
Exceptional customer relationship skills including the ability to discover the true requirements’ underlying feature requests and lead engineering efforts to meet aggressive timelines with optimal solutions
Responsible for the organization, promotion, and implementation of effective programmatic initiatives to help development teams deliver better service
Possess an insatiable curiosity and ability to understand architectural and technical aspects of projects
B.skilled.
Computer Science / Engineering Bachelor’s degree or related technical field 
Technical Program Management experience 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong business and technical vision
Deep hands-on technical expertise
Able to work effectively with Jira/ Jira Align or similar products.
Able to effectively work with ambiguity and solve problems.
