The New Product & Service Integration team in Global Customer Services supports ambitious growth through the development and implementation of new CS support models for new Booking.com products, services, customer interaction channels and customer segments.
The Global Service Integration Owner is part of the New Product & Service Integration team in CS Strategic Programs and acts as a dedicated first point of contact (from CS Global Support - supported by Global Service Integration Manager) for one or more New Business Development (NBD) teams driving the design and implementation of (most) suitable customer support models, where needed in collaboration with external (CS) partners. As such the Global Service Integration Owner: 
Enables rapid product improvement and validation, by setting up an initial CS support model (ticketing system, allocation of CS agent resources/skills and feedback loop for actionable customer experience insights) that accelerates learnings on both the NBD and CS side;
Drives prioritisation and efficient investment of resources from all CS Global Support teams in the various phases of integration by successfully providing cross-departmental project management and gatekeeping under the guidance of the Global Service Integration Manager;
Contributes to driving ambitious business growth, by fully integrating the customer service on the new product in our global CS environment in a scalable way allowing new products to timely and gradually scale.

B.Responsible
Guide new products in developments through our service integration process with the end-goal of realizing BAU for the new service:
Perform full intake of the new business initiative and design initial support set-up for experimentation [Intake phase]
Support end-to-end testing of the new product before go-live [Testing phase]
Set-up initial support set-up (tooling, agents, feedback loop) and drive prioritisation of product improvements [Learning Phase]
Based on sales forecasts, planning the start, determining support set-up and getting the resources approved for first Incubation of the service in CS Operations [Incubation phase]
Drive cross-departmental efforts to generate final and detailed service blueprint ready for integration into CS Operations [Full integration/BAU phase]
B.Skilled
Extensive knowledge of CS processes, capabilities and way of working
Knowledge of and experience with functional areas within Customer Services (Workforce management, Training & Quality, Operational Excellence)
Ability to support change across teams in different business areas
Customer journey mapping, service design and process design skills
Have 3 years of experiences in cross-functional project management
Medior stakeholder management skills

Please apply with a CV and Cover Letter on one document that demonstrated the skillset required for the role addressed to Mitchell Baas.

About Booking.com
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world.
About the Team:
Booking’s Accommodations Business Unit is seeking a sharp, talented and energetic leader for our technical program management (TPM) team within the organization.  You will be leading the TPM team responsible for the smooth running of all the major technical programs and major dependencies of the Accommodations unit. This is a unique opportunity to bring in your experience and vision on how to run complex integrated (product & technology)  programs at scale with continuous delivery of value for our customers.
Our ideal candidate
Our ideal candidate will have a strong TPM background, with demonstrated experience building and leading teams of highly driven technical program managers as well as a portfolio of large, cross-organizational software development projects and will have relevant technical background in service oriented architecture, tech migrations and digital transformations.  
We are looking for an entrepreneurial and innovative individual who thrives on solving complex problems with a positive and can-do mindset. Someone who has been successful for years as a Technical Program Manager and leader and is now ready to bring in this experience and vision to help our organization to drive our complex programs to success. This means you are not only able to develop and drive high-level strategic initiatives, but can also roll up your sleeves, dig in and help drive change.  
B.responsible
As a Group TPM, your core responsibility would be to support growth and development of Technical Program Managers as they drive planning, prioritization and program execution to ensure all program objectives are achieved.  You will also have a leading role in defining the TPM practices and way of work for our organization to ensure a consistent high quality approach for all our programs.
Our organization works with autonomous agile teams so you will need to be able to take large, complex objectives and break them down into manageable pieces (milestones and releases) focused at continuous value delivery (agile way of work).  After which you need to organize the teams in the program and beyond to deliver in a successful, high quality and timely manner.
Stakeholder management, ability to influence, analytical talent, and leadership are essential to success in this role as well as people management experience and a solid technical background.
Knowledge of the following is required: service-oriented architecture, product development, build processes, agile project management, release schedules, people management, change management. 
  Together with product and technology stakeholders define the roadmap and long-term strategy of the programs and teams that you are working with.
Based on the roadmap define milestones, technology requirements and goals to be cascaded down to the teams
Organize and manage the risk management process, proactively identify and mitigate risks or define alternative scenarios
Ensure roadmaps and goals are realistic and are reviewed periodically based on current learnings and deliveries
Identify and manage key dependencies within and beyond the program
Manage multiple cross-functional product and engineering programs.
Partner with key infrastructure groups & production engineers, scientists & analysts across the company to understand and anticipate their needs as relevant to your programs

Job Title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer - Data & ML Platform

Job Description:
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world. 
With over 1.6 million room nights booked every day, accommodation represents the largest share of our business to date. We are responsible for accommodation growth, with clear ownership of all marketing, product and technology related to accommodations.  Our mission is to deliver the best customer experience and most varied selection of properties.
We are now looking for a Product Marketing Manager in the Connectivity Product Team, which is part of the Accommodations Business Unit. A few words on Connectivity:
Connectivity is an exciting track where we combine technology and product marketing to bring our best products via our providers to connected accommodations
We work in an interesting and challenging B2B2B environment where we build and market products (mostly in an API format) which are aimed at Connectivity providers (various software solutions used by accommodations)
All these need to be adopted and used by our connected accommodations so this is where the interesting B2B2B part comes in
We are targeting connected accommodations around the world who bring the majority of Booking.com’s revenue today. Therefore, you will work on a global scale and with a great impact
You will be working closely with 3 different product teams to deliver the possible experience for our connected accommodations
Being a Product Marketing Manager is about scaling and improving products, features and services that help increase partner satisfaction, improve customer experience and grow the commercial success of Booking.com. With vast amounts of data at your fingertips, you will scale, create, test and validate value propositions for partners across the globe. You will operate from within the Product Development department which is working closely with our increasing number of 1.7M+ partners across the globe.
B.responsible
Manage all aspects of product marketing across multiple products including: product proposition validation and market fit, GTM strategy, new product launch, portfolio marketing strategy and execution, positioning, messaging, potentially pricing, competitive research, internal communications and field enablement.
Represents the customer at all times, both internally and externally, while keeping eye on the business interests of B.com
Own the end-to-end GTM process from target setting, planning, implementation, reporting and retrospective
Proactively manages stakeholders across the organization to influence and share information, in the right medium, at the right time across local and global audiences
Responsible for internal communication to the field, including identifying the right channel to use with the relevant, timely and accurate product and commercial updates
Own strategy for all external communications, working with all key stakeholders (internal and external) to execute
Validate value propositions with target audience through qualitative and quantitative research methods
Provide ongoing product feedback to product teams, aggregated from multiple channels
Drive business impact or growth using data, analytical thinking and structured presentation skills
Own promotion of the product (incentives, pricing models etc)
B.skilled
A proven track record of 5+ years in a product marketing role with a proven track record in taking end-to-end responsibility of marketing scalable products, from idea generation to execution.
Experience working in a B2B environment as well as experience working with API products
Product marketing experience
Ability to use data and facts to make decisions
Strong interpersonal skills
Curious, solution oriented and result driven
Commercial skills
Ability to manage projects across multiple departments and stakeholders
Ability to multi-task & flexible attitude
Project management skills
Strong communication skills (verbal & written)
Proactive, flexible and capable of working independently as well as working in a team
Strategic thinker, able to balance long-term vision with short- and medium-term goals

Be part of a truly international fast paced environment and performance driven culture;
With over 70 different nationalities within the product and technology departments alone, you will be able to absorb new skills and grow your career in a multicultural environment;

It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. With over 1.6 million room nights booked every day, accommodation represents the largest share of our business to date. We are looking for a sharp, talented and energetic Program Manager within the Security and Fraud organization to build out security programs that deliver against an ambitious roadmap of business objectives.
The Program Manager is responsible for the governance and E2E program management of several streams of work (or portfolio’s) within the S&F department. The Program Manager role partners with the various teams within the department to support, and proactively work with them, to facilitate the work occurring between them and other business units and centralized functions (CT PMO, BizOps etc).. The Program Manager drives the scoping of the project and eventually supports the teams with the Business case creation. The Program Manager also identifies key requirements needed from cross - functional teams and eventually external vendors. The Program Manager ensures that the functional workload of the department is managed in a consistent manner, whilst working externally with the business units & central functions to build engagement and where needed governance over decisions needed for work to be signed off. The Program Manager supports the teams in identifying and managing the relevant dependencies in order to minimize the risks and the challenges.
First and foremost, the Program Manager ensures that the team's roadmaps/plans focus on agreed business priorities, dependencies and strategies, and they deliver against the shared objectives and main activities with key milestones that have been agreed upon.

High complexity (strategic/ critical priority) end-to-end (E2E) project

Change management experience & mind-set
Strong interpersonal skills focused on collaboration. Building and maintain lasting relationships and connections with diverse teams, across the organisation and outside
Effectively communicate including large audiences
Ability to influence and steer leadership, senior management and groups (up to Senior Director level). Can productively interact with VP level
Ability to break up a complex problem into actionable and easy to understand solutions.

Solution-driven attitude, capable of building a team.

 The Customer Insights department is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists.  You will have the opportunity to use data to generate insights that will be used across various departments of our business to help us predict and understand our customers’ behaviour, enabling us to offer them the most relevant personalised experience.
About the Customer Insights Team:
In Customer Insights our mission is to create a competitive advantage by building a clear understanding of customers’ total travel behavior. One of the foundational tasks to deliver this is to create a source of truth in the company for Trips Data, both at at a transactional and Customer level. Some of the main projects to deliver this involve connecting data from different products, bringing the connected trip to life in our data bases, metrics and insights, creating a data warehouse, applying use cases of this data to the business such as cross selling opportunities and many more to come. 
As a Data Manager you will supports the implementation of processes for how data is produced and consumed within the Accommodations Business Unit, including governance, architecture, and quality, in order to meet evolving business objectives and technology landscapes. You will support ownership in the central Accommodations Data Organization, and help influence on topics such as data management, governance and ownership and ensure the oversight and architecture of data flows.
B. Responsible 
Important aspects of the job include:
Support the creation of physical data models that can be operationalised within the company’s workflows and infrastructure to ensure that data solutions meet business requirements
Support the mapping of data flows between systems and workflows across the company to drive efficiency and ensure proper controls 
Support the implementation of efficient data ingestion solutions, batch processing, and event-based streams to enable real-time actions and rapid business decisions
Connect datasets from different systems into a unified solution to deliver high-value data
Monitor relevant SLIs and SLOs to support ownership of data solutions end-to-end
Support the definition of quality requirements for data assets, based on standards for all data quality dimensions, to ensure design of high-quality data solutions
Support the definition of quality requirements for data assets, based on standards for all data quality dimensions, to ensure design of high-quality data solutions
Develop data validation solutions for validating values and schemas and use them to ensure data accuracy and reliability
Implement solutions for monitoring, failure detection, and data availability and use them to ensure data timeliness and completeness 
Build software applications by using the relevant development languages for the systems, services and tools used by the specific business area
Ensure data timeliness based on business requirements by driving strategy and implementation of monitoring and failure detection
B. Skilled 
We have found that people who match the following requirements are the ones who fit us best:
Beginner knowledge of data modeling methods (Relational, Dimensional)
Intermediate knowledge of data quality requirements and implementation methodologies
Intermediate knowledge of Data Management requirements based on best practices, e.g. DAMA-DMBOK
Intermediate knowledge of one or more database querying languages or scripting tools, e.g. SQL, VBA, Pandas, R
Driven and results oriented personality
Open to feedback and always looking for ways to improve own performance
Able to understand details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture.
Able to spot opportunities to drive business growth from their craft. 
Analytical and curious mindset
Strong interpersonal skills
Open and friendly attitude
Expertise and experience on data analysis.
Expertise in data management, data visualization and quality.
  B. Offered
Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide
Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture
Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com
Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Partner Solutions Architect
  Booking.com - world’s #1 accommodation site and 3rd largest global e-commerce player - is looking for a Partner Solutions Architect to join the Connectivity Partnerships Team based out of the US (Washington DC, Boston, Atlanta, Chicago, Austin or New York). 
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world.
We’re a truly global e-commerce company, with business operations in nearly every country and city on the planet. We want to make it easy for everyone, anywhere in the world, to connect and integrate with our platform – whenever and however it’s convenient for them. 
The Connectivity Partnerships team (residing within the Accommodation Partner Services organisation) focuses on realizing this ambition by tapping into the 3rd-party hospitality technology ecosystem, consisting of companies who are providing a wide range of software applications and -services to our accommodation partners. 
The ecosystem is rapidly growing and provider software offerings are becoming more prominent in the way accommodation partners run their business. Our integrations with software providers should give accommodation partners the flexibility and ease to work with Booking.com seamlessly in the applications they use most. . The Connectivity Partnerships team nurtures and develops software providers with the aim to maximize the performance of our joint connected accommodation partners through the underlying ambition of becoming the preferred partner of choice.
  The Partner Solutions Architect is a technical & business expert in the Connectivity Partnerships Team who works with our most strategic Connectivity Partners - Global Chains and Premier Connectivity Partners - on technical and transformational projects. In this role you will lead the design and implementation of technical solutions to help Global Chains & Premier Connectivity Partners optimize, scale and respond to market opportunities in alignment with our strategy. 
Your primary role will be to partner with our account teams to advise our Global Chains on architectural design and guide them in implementing technical solutions to enable their business. You inspire them and their Connectivity Partners on the capabilities of our products and services and drive proof of concepts to demonstrate success. You stay on top of industry trends and act as a thought leader guiding Global Chains and their Connectivity Partners on technology opportunities that enable mutual growth. 
Internally you will partner with product management and software development teams to advise on solution enhancements to accommodate the needs of Global Chains and Premier Connectivity Partners. You will collaborate with Connectivity Partner Management teams and Chains Account Management teams around the globe to define the technical account direction.  
To be successful it's required you have related experience in technical pre-sales or technical consulting roles. You have a proven track-record in leading architecture and implementation discussions with senior executives.  You are  well versed in pitching technical solutions backed up with business data to partners and internal product teams. You are an excellent communicator with strong presentation skills who strives to consistently meet or exceed partner expectations.


B.Responsible
Partner Relationship
Is responsible to establish deep relationships with the IT decision makers of strategic Connectivity Partners with the aim to drive value-add to their company and Booking.com and become a trusted advisor.
Is responsible to define high-level system architecture of potential Connectivity solutions between Booking.com and 3rd party software vendors.
Is responsible to drive consensus from internal stakeholders in various product teams to prioritize the technical development of the architectural solution, based on validated business cases and industry knowledge.
Ensures that the development and implementation of technical solutions for respective Partners are part of the overall account strategy by working closely and aligning with Commercial Managers (Key Account Managers and/or Partner Business Managers).
Is responsible to drive effective decision-making with Partners by identifying needs and motivations then translating them into actions.
  Architectural Vision and Systems Design
Is responsible to evaluate partner architecture solutions by taking into account cost, stakeholders business requirements, technology requirements and emerging technologies.
Is responsible to assess, deeply understand and shape the architecture landscape of strategic Connectivity Partners by identifying opportunities to reduce complexity, coupling and accelerate the adoption of Connectivity Products.
Is responsible to map business challenges to different architecture phases and technology solutions based on partners existing solution landscape, reference architecture and applying domain knowledge.
  Architecture Standards
Is responsible to design and advise on technical governance by writing and reviewing architectural patterns (e.g. peer reviews) guidelines and other supporting documentation.
  Experience building software applications
Has sufficient knowledge to build software applications by using relevant development languages and applying knowledge of systems, services and tools appropriate for the business area.
Has sufficient knowledge to maintain data security, integrity and quality by effectively following company standards and best practices.
  Architectural Guidance
Is responsible for the exploration and collection of requirements from Connectivity Partners and providing input to internal product teams towards a technical or business solution.
Is responsible for the delivery of technical transformation projects to Connectivity Partners by managing scope changes, overall timelines and keeping stakeholders informed.
Is responsible to support and improve Connectivity Partner’s technical capabilities around Booking.com platform and infrastructure, by developing and delivering a scalable learning path and Architectural workshops.


Critical Thinking
Is responsible to systematically identify patterns and underlying issues in complex situations, and to find solutions by applying logical and analytical thinking and guide more junior members of the team in this topic.
Is responsible to constructively evaluate and develop ideas, plans and solutions by reviewing them, objectively taking into account external knowledge, initiating 'SMART' improvements and articulating their rationale and guide more junior members of the team in this topic.
  Continuous Quality and Process Improvement
Is responsible to identify opportunities for process, system and structural improvements (i.e performance gains) by examining and evaluating current process flows, methods and standards.
Is responsible to design and implement relevant improvements by defining adapted/new process flows, standards, and practices that enable business performance.
  Effective Communication
Is responsible to deliver clear, well-structured, and meaningful information to a target audience by using suitable communication mediums and language tailored to the audience.
Is responsible to achieve mutually agreeable solutions by staying adaptable, communicating ideas in clear coherent language and practising active listening.
Is responsible to ask relevant (follow-up) questions to properly engage with the speaker and really understand what they are saying, by applying listening and reflection techniques.


B.Skilled
BA/BS in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field experience required.
Recommended 5-7+ years experience in any of the following roles: technical architect, presales engineer or solution consulting.
Experience with cloud computing platforms, enterprise APIs, solution architecture within web and mobile environments and emerging computing trends. Tech experience in the hospitality industry is desirable. 
Experience leading and delivering technical projects,  across multidisciplinary teams,  in customer facing roles with a proven track record of effective collaborations. 
Knowledge of software development lifecycle and application architecture. Hands-on experience with one or more programming languages.
Experience in creating business cases and solving business challenges with technical solutions using qualitative & quantitative data.
Excellent verbal and written English communication skills. Past experience writing and publishing technical whitepapers is desirable.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to meet tight deadlines in an environment with competing priorities.
A self-starter with a proactive attitude, motivated by the end result. Driven by your own performance, yet actively able to contribute to a team.
Ability to solve complex problems, deal with constraints and can come up with creative solutions.
Results driven – excels in getting things done.
Ability to effectively network within a fast growing and changing organization.
Availability up to 30% of the time.
Location: Atlanta, GA, United States and 5 more

Job Title: Principal UX Writer - UX Writing and Content Design - Accommodations
Job Description:
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
About this role
We’re looking for a Principal UX Writer to join our UX Writing and Content Design organisation. We’re a close-knit community made up of more than 50 writers working on product teams all across the company.  And we’re right there in the thick of it – collaborating on product design, development and data analysis. 
As Principal you’ll produce strategies, guidelines, and frameworks – that serve as benchmarks for a business topic or technical focus area – in order to shape new products and services that drive innovation. You’ll guide and mentor core, senior, and lead UX writers, but also do hands-on work yourself. You’ll also participate in design leadership reviews of companywide UX/UI work.
As a member of the UX Writing Leadership Team you will help to define the UX Writing craft roadmap and you will manage key initiatives and deliverables at an organizational level. You’ll report to the Director of UX Writing and Content Design. 
To land a Principal position you will be asked to present your portfolio and explain relevant work that you have planned, led, and realised.
To learn more about working as a UX Writer at Booking.com check out B.Writes, our Medium publication.
B.Responsible
Facilitate the long-term UX Writing vision for a business topic or technical focus area; Integrate in-depth company knowledge and area of expertise to develop innovative new ideas and solutions, utilizing the strengths of others in creating and developing the vision.
Demonstrate advanced understanding and application of user-centered design concepts, methods, and techniques to facilitate, enable and advance quality content design and outcomes. 
Actively seek out, request, and contribute to the creation and collection of data and actively interpret it to help inform decisions. Able to draw on a variety of sources, both internal and external, to independently collect and interpret data from a customer experience point of view; expert with data and analysis tools to deliver solutions accountable to business metrics. 
Deliver company level or external industry communication on UX Writing, strategy, or processes at Booking.com, new products, and new business initiatives; 
Mentor and coach individual writers to improve craft, deliverables, process, communication, and career advancement. 
Proactively partner with leads, principals, directors, or other high level roles in product and technology organisations to define and drive organisational or BU level strategy; Align with other leaders to drive larger business unit initiatives. 
Identify project risks and make recommendations to lessen risk; Guide and influence strategic decisions made by managers and leaders in their own area; Evaluate trade-offs in costs and performance and make them explicit to stakeholders. 
Liaise effectively with the Extended Leadership Team and be a point of contact on UX Writing specific issues, jumping in where required. 
Promote your domain across the company in order to spread awareness and create a more consistent user experience.
B.Skilled
You have 10+ years UX Writing experience within high traffic digital products (100,000+ visitors per day), preferably E-commerce or marketplace companies.
You have a proven track record of successfully advocating for UX Writing as a discipline and influencing multi-disciplinary teams, including designers, researchers, engineers, and product leaders.
You have a proven track record in building both copy strategies and roadmaps, and setting KPIs and objectives.
You can comfortably lead others through each part of the writing process – from brainstorming and researching to shipping products and iterating, all while keeping the user at the centre of their process.
You are self-driven and able to solve problems in a rapidly changing environment.
You thrive on feedback and critique and can promote that culture across UX Writing teams.
You have experience working directly with language specialists and localisation teams on multilingual platforms.
You know how to write copy that is future proof and scalable.
You have A/B testing experience and knowledge of experimentation techniques.
You have experience with user testing and are knowledgeable of research methodologies
  B.Offered
This role is open to candidates worldwide. We provide assistance for you and your family (if applicable) with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.
You’ll contribute to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and see the real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide.
You’ll receive relocation support for you and your family (if applicable) to move to Amsterdam – one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe. We have fine-tuned this process by successfully relocating 300+ technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year alone.
You’ll join a performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.
You’ll get discounts on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits.
You’ll be invited to company-sponsored family and social activities aimed at helping employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture.
You’ll be part of a truly international environment with diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world.
Please apply with your English CV and link your portfolio or writing samples. Samples should include UX/product writing work specifying your role and clearly defining problems, solutions and your UX processes. If you don’t have a portfolio, a slide deck of writing samples with mentioned specifications is enough.
Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

Booking.com Transport Ltd is part of the Trips Business Unit at Booking.com. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners, and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world. 
The Trips business unit will bridge the Booking.com of today with the Booking.com of tomorrow, leading the evolution from a single-product company to a multi-product offering company with an unprecedented, personalised travel experience at the heart of its success. 
Do you have hands-on experience building, developing, and supporting complex planning models in Excel and translate them to the Anaplan or similar forecasting platform? Are you passionate about identifying new planning opportunities and translating complex forecasting needs into meaningful models? If this sounds like you, Let’s connect!
In this role you are part of a dynamic and fast-paced team and will be part of the Corporate FP&A team in the trips Business Unit of Booking.com. The role is based in Manchester. Due to the rapid and continuous growth of the organisation, the tasks and duties of this role will evolve over time including creating of Anaplan Center of Excellence with FP&A focus. You will be keen to develop and grow within the role and challenge yourself to take on additional projects and responsibilities as they present themselves.
The ideal candidate must have participated in Anaplan implementations before and can anticipate what needs to be done, adapt quickly, and work well in a fast-paced environment.
 The Financial Analyst - Anaplan Model Builder will be responsible for:
Become proficient in all aspects of our forecasting tool, Anaplan
Collect business requirements on key company operations and challenge the key stakeholders in finding the best forecasting practices
Visualise, conceptualise and build financial models
Engage, train and assist new users on both Anaplan and its models
Assist with coordinating and executing project management related tasks during the implementation phase
Work closely with  FPA on model improvements and business changes to provide the best user experience possible
Proactively approach key stakeholders to explore further opportunities with Anaplan
Provide support to the team during the preparation of the company’s budgeting/Forecasting cycles including Budget presentations, embed waterfalls into Anaplan tool and create new dashboards
Support the FP&A Team in ad hoc projects and analysis
The Financial Analyst - Anaplan Model Builder will have:
Minimum 3 years of experience in finance modelling, preferably within FP&A including modelling and Planning tools implementations or model buildings.
Experience in consulting is also relevant
Experience in model building in Anaplan is a must
Keen interest in internal KPI reporting and analysis as well as dashboard development
Advanced knowledge of Excel and multi dimensional modelling
Experience in data and systems integration including use of ETL tools, preferred.
Experience with building macros or SQL, but not required
Comfortable with problem solving and the mentality to try and fail and try again; “think outside the box” approach
Able to work under pressure and with strict deadlines in a fast-paced environment while maintaining accuracy
Demonstrate the ability to manage multiple competing priorities and ensure their completion
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) in English
Organised and shows attention to detail with sharp analytical skills
Experience in consulting is also relevant

Job Title: Senior Full Stack Developer - Customer Platform Team- Accommodation Tech
Job Description:
About Booking.com
  It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more. Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission. We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
  With over 1.6 million room nights booked every day, accommodation represents the largest share of our business to date. We are responsible for accommodation growth, with clear ownership of all marketing, product and supply related to accommodations.  Our mission is to deliver the best customer experience and most varied selection of properties.
  About the Customer Platform organization
The Customer Platform delivers foundational services, components and frameworks that are used by all product teams across Booking.com’s accommodation business. We are on a mission to modernize our technology stack, improve development processes and optimize the way tech teams work together – so we can build and iterate over our products faster, raise the bar and further strengthen our position as the global industry leader.
As a member of the Customer Platform, you will develop highly available and performant systems, maintain and scale critical services. You will lead the implementation and drive the adoption of state of the art frontend and backend technologies. You will directly shape the future of an e-commerce titan. Your platform development efforts will have a direct impact on performance, scalability, resilience and continuous modernization. In addition to a range of unique technical challenges you’ll participate in setting strategy based on platform usage and evolving business requirements. You will frequently have the opportunity to  support hundreds of other developers by managing platform documentation, answering questions, providing guidance and applying best development practices.
B.responsible
Solve complex technical problems to improve our development process and unlock new business opportunities.
Take initiative to improve existing solutions, challenge decisions, propose augmented alternatives and address technical debt.
Drive the collaboration within the team, across teams, roles and departments. We value individual work as much as your contribution to brainstorm sessions, pair programming and code reviews. Even when we work remotely we fail and succeed together.
Be ambitious, open to learn and adjust to frequent changes. We treat our mistakes as opportunities to improve.
Own your decisions and deliver on your promises. Be the one who cares and takes action.
Rely on data in problem identification and solution evaluation. If the data is not enough do the research and share your findings.
Be pragmatic in planning and fast in execution. Prioritize based on the impact and limit the scope of the initial implementation. Validate your ideas and solutions sooner.
Keep the customer at the center of everything you do. The success of your work is defined by the efficiency of the platform, its convenience for the internal users and the value we all can bring to our partners and clients.
Respect Booking.com values, promote equality and contribute to our diverse environment, open for participation from individuals with different ideas, perspectives, and backgrounds.
  B.skilled (minimum qualifications)
8+ years of working on frontend and backend tasks.
2+ years of working with Node.js and TypeScript or Flow.
Extensive knowledge of the JavaScript ecosystem including good understanding of Webpack, Babel, Rollup and Lerna.
Experience working with large scale distributed systems, highly available APIs, and products that impact millions of customers.
Hands-on experience of building or managing React or Vue.js applications.
Solid understanding of Service Oriented Architecture, Microservices, FP and OOP design patterns.
Experience with cloud platforms and container technologies, i.e. Amazon AWS, Docker, Kubernetes.
You own your systems end-to-end and are comfortable performing incident management.
You have driven successful technical, business and people related initiatives that improved productivity, performance or quality.
  B.skilled (preferred qualifications)
You worked with large scale distributed systems, highly available APIs, and products that impact millions of customers.
Experience with architecture, deployment and configuration of enterprise class applications.
Experience in building Webpack plugins and/or understanding of Webpack 5 module federation.
Experience in optimizing web application build processes and/or runtime performance.
Experience in creating, managing and optimizing performance of Node.js services running in a cloud environment.
Experience using GraphQL and Apollo in production on server and client sides.
Experience using Protobuf, Kafka, and Hadoop.
Experience mentoring or coaching new or less experienced team members.
Excellent communication skills, you are able to influence and cooperate with people at all levels.
Experience applying data analytics to solve technical and business problems.
You are a humble and thought leader, you lead by example and gain your teammates respect through your actions and not your title.
You own your systems end-to-end, ready to be on-call to take care of critical systems and manage potential incidents.
  B.offered
Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe.
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide.
Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture.
Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit.
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions.
Design, shape and drive the adoption of a unique in size and complexity micro-frontend architecture that powers one of the biggest e-commerce businesses in the world.
Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation.
Competitive compensation, benefits package, and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com.
  Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

Junior Technology Product Manager - Cloud Financial Operations
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.
Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission. We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
Booking.com is looking for a Junior Technology Product Manager to join our Core Infrastructure department at our Amsterdam headquarters.
Our mission at Booking.com is to create visionary, innovative, and personalized travel experiences for millions of customers all across the world. We want customers to have an amazing experience wherever and whenever they choose: mobile, web, and through partners and 3rd parties.
To make all this possible, our developers expect best-of-class tools and platforms to build on. A critical part of this is our public cloud platforms, spanning multiple cloud providers. In order to gain the benefits of public cloud services, we need strong governance in place and a key part of this is cost control and management capabilities. These capabilities unlock public cloud as our future default platform for services that will delight our customers.
We reduce barriers to adopt new technologies giving our developers more freedom to choose whatever technologies make sense for their service. Our architecture will enable each service to be continuously integrated and deployed independently at scale. The developer experience is the key foundation to all of these goals.
B.responsible
Defines the vision (end goal, one year and beyond) and roadmap (how to achieve it, quarter-per-quarter) for the team.
Works with teams to translate user needs into development requirements that drive impact for the business.
Owns the ideation, post mortem, prioritization, backlog, customer feedback loop processes.
Guide new features and services from inception to launch while keeping (internal) customers at the center of everything.
Measures and reports the team’s progress and impact to the business in a transparent and effective way. This includes defining key business and product success metrics, track them, and improve upon them.
using data to inform team priorities and decision making. 
Is the advocate for the team’s customers and stakeholders and keeps the track, customers, stakeholders, and the wider business up-to-date with team progress.
Other responsibilities:
Manage monthly cloud financial analysis processes, creating monthly cloud cost reports and working with Finance teams to incorporate into budgets and accruals
Build cloud cost forecasting models across multiple cloud providers, building a reliable cloud cost forecast spanning multiple years based on a foundation of the business cloud adoption strategy and plans which incorporate variables such as technical initiatives to optimise cloud cost expenses
Work with business units to identify cloud adoption plans and incorporate these into forecast
Work with procurement teams to use cloud cost forecasts as an enabler and informer for contract renewals
Support BAU cloud cost administration work (purchase orders, invoicing questions, etc)
  B.skilled
At least 2 years of experience as a technology Product Manager or similar role with some focus on developing cost management capabilities for public cloud services.
Strong knowledge of main public cloud provider platforms, especially AWS, detailed knowledge of native cost management tools embedded in these platforms and (beneficial) to have knowledge of third party providers in this space.
Strong affinity with technology, especially cloud. Previous hands-on experience as an engineer, or equivalent technical role, is a nice to have.
Preferable experience with AWS/GCP cost management tools & with Tableau
Excellent communication, collaboration, and influencing skills.
Team player with a bottom-up ideation process.
An analytical orientation and strong problem-solving skills demonstrated by the ability to structure issues and analyze alternative solutions.
Able to understand and formulate meaningful business metrics.
Fluent in the English language both spoken and written.
  B.offered
This position is open to worldwide candidates. We provide assistance for you and your family with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated 300+ technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year.
Headquarters located in one of the most vibrant cities in Europe: Amsterdam
Performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.
Training, regular hackathons and opportunities to travel and attend global conferences.
Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits.
Company sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture.
Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world. 
The hiring company Booking.com BV is the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online accommodation reservation service in the world. Booking.com BV is looking for an Infrastructure Product Manager in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. All references to “Booking.com" refer to Booking.com BV.

At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world. 
With over 1.6 million room nights booked every day, accommodation represents the largest share of our business to date. We are responsible for accommodation growth, with clear ownership of all marketing, product and supply related to accommodations.  Our mission is to deliver the best customer experience and most varied selection of properties.
About the Team
Within the Search & Match track in Engagement, a few opportunities have come up for Product Managers:
Partner Content team: Responsible for ensuring that properties provide us with the best information necessary to welcome and delight our mutual guests.  This ranges from all the photos, property facilities, room amenities to even the price of parking.  If you have ideas on how to decide which is the best photo for a property at scale, detecting and correcting if partners have inadvertently given us the wrong information, and testing customer facing innovations to help our partners, this position may be for you.
Location team: We all know the importance of where you stay has implications on how satisfied you will be with your trip.  From spatial orientation in maps, showing grocery stores for those staying in apartments to figuring out what really is a city center, we strive to understand and improve the what, how and when of location information.
UGC Scalability: How do you get guests to share their experiences?  Which topics do we need to cover so that future potential guests can get not only an accurate representation of a stay but also, provide a more vibrant color of the stay experience?  How can we help partners improve the future guests’ experience based on feedback?  
If you are looking to see how you can help our reviewer help the millions of visitors with the answer to the simple question “Is this good?”, this might be a good position for you. 
Trip Types Lower Funnel: Tailoring the search & book funnel by displaying relevant content based on users' trip type intent. (Beach, Ski, Nature and more).
  Your impact:
Be the voice of our customers & partners and the driving force behind product innovation from in-depth product understanding to new feature development.
Identify partner and provider behaviours and needs through research and analysis, uncover trends, and help our business partners grow
Take full ownership of the product, the prioritisation of new features and enhancements to existing features.
Empower and collaborate with your team, product marketing and supportive roles to unlock their full potential, from idea generation and validation to new product pilots, launches, API adoption and usage. 
Analyse, understand and share learnings from product changes and experimentation to build a strong knowledge base of the product with a clear roadmap and overarching strategy.

The Company

It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Do you enjoy taking ownership and being responsible for your own internal business portfolio? Do you thrive in building strong relationships and inspiring partners about new products and services? If your answer is “yes”, you might have what it takes to be the next Account Manager!

Booking.com GmbH, one of the support companies in Germany, is seeking a full time Account Manager in our Frankfurt office.

How we communicate at work can have the power to transform working lives by helping people feel engaged and purposeful – that they matter - making for a better organization overall. Successful internal communication creates an environment of mutual understanding. It forges connections between people, allowing them to perform at their best, both individually and collectively.

At Booking.com, Internal Communication is responsible for keeping colleagues connected and informed, and creating a shared understanding of our goals, values, and culture in order to drive organizational performance and build brand advocacy.

As an Internal Communications Lead at Booking.com, you will be a part of a team of talented internal communications professionals and be responsible for owning the department's communication cadence and creating engaging strategic narratives and campaigns for its diverse base of commercial, service and product development employees.
  B.Responsible
Communication Strategy and Planning
Partner with leadership to develop & deliver internal communication strategies that enable strategic alignment and employee engagement across a department
Own the implementation of the internal communication calendar within a departmental/regional scope and internal communication plans for the wider business
Ensure all strategies/plans incorporate adherence to ethical, legal and brand requirements
Network and build relationships with senior departmental leaders to identify communication needs and contribute to the development of departmental /regional strategy
Advising, Educating and Influencing
Develop internal relationships and alliances with other functions to ensure alignment of strategy and delivery
Provide feedback, challenge and coaching regarding leadership communication style to department VP
Advocate and lead thinking on the impact of effective internal communication on department performance
Act as a trusted advisor to the VP and department LT, being a sounding board and providing advice, coaching and constructively challenging as appropriate
Creating and Curating Content
Articulate the corporate narrative, adapting as necessary for different Booking.com audiences
Deliver innovative and creative communication campaigns
Ensure compliance with content standards
Develop department strategies committed to employee voice and knowledge sharing
Distill complex issues/ideas into simple, honest and compelling communication
Coach key stakeholders in effective content creation and opportunities
Channel and Community Management
Develop overall channel strategy for multi-directional communication
Monitor and measure departmental channels against global standards
Develop and introduce new channels in line with strategy, working with other disciplines as appropriate
Develop ideas to encourage conversation and connection across Booking.com
Monitor channels for compliance with content standards
Hosting and facilitating business and leadership events
Coach leaders and ensure healthy participation in internal social media and communication events/forums
Understanding and Advocating for People and Culture
Analyze data from internal social media, feedback and employee voice initiatives to inform understanding of employee perspectives and opinions and feed into communication and business planning
Segment employee groups based on understanding of needs/subcultures and ensure communication plans and channels are appropriate
Active Listening and Measuring Impact
Oversee departmental internal communication measurement and evaluation
Work with colleagues to design feedback gathering initiatives
Draw meaningful insights from analysis of data
Use data and insights from research and measurement to influence VP and department LT
  B.Skilled
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
5+ years experience working in complex global internal communication programs in a fast-paced, changing environment.
Demonstrable experience creating and delivering communication strategies
Able to run communication planning at a strategic/program level.
Strong project management skills, ability to run multiple projects concurrently and prioritize effectively
Ability to influence and build effective relationships with senior stakeholders, and use those relationships to enable the best possible outcome for Booking.com and employees.
Ability to coach leaders and line managers to be effective communicators
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with Journalistic skills: interviewing, writing, copy editing, proofreading.
Ability to distill complex issues/ideas into simple, honest and compelling communication; avoiding jargon and matching language to the needs of colleagues.
Able to deliver succinct talking points and superb written communications for leaders.
Strong facilitation skills: face to face and online.
Demonstrable success working with social media and community management.
Understanding of organisational culture: which channels will work most effectively in different environments and why.
Awareness of user trends in technology/opportunities.
Vendor/supplier management skills.
Detailed understanding of the needs and experiences of the diverse Booking community.
Detailed knowledge on the use of inclusive language and able to adapt writing style or channel mix to meet the needs of the diverse Booking community, making sure everyone feels a sense of belonging.
Detailed understanding of channel monitoring, campaign evaluation, qualitative/quantitative feedback and survey analysis.
Ability to work within an agreed budget

At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
The Tel Aviv Machine Learning Center is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists. You will have the opportunity to build data products that will be used across various departments of our business to help us predict and understand our customers’ behaviour, enabling us to offer them the most relevant personalised experience.
Machine learning projects at the center cover topics such as recommendation systems, computer vision, natural language understanding, reinforcement learning and more.
As a Machine Learning Scientist, you’ll have the chance to work on exciting products and play an integral role in taking it to the next level!  You’ll have the chance to collaborate closely with other developers, scientists, engineers, product managers, designers and various business stakeholders and take full ownership of your work - from the initial idea generation phase to the implementation of the final product.
You will thrive at Booking.com if you are result-focused, innovative, and with a solid quantitative background, but most of all by understanding our complex business model and the logic behind it.
B.RESPONSIBLE
Work in a multi-disciplined team where you’ll take full ownership of turning discoveries and ideas into products through machine learning (incl. understanding product requirements, data discovery, model development and evaluation, to implementation of a full production pipeline for both batch and stream-based deployment).
Use the model’s output to deliver both short-term commercial impact and longer-term differentiated business value and customer experience.
Define and build proof-of-concepts to test new ideas and demonstrate their potential value to relevant stakeholders. 
Document and share the findings, and identify when these technologies can be generalised into reusable frameworks.
Continuously evolve your craft by keeping up to date with the latest developments in ML/AI and related technologies, and upskilling on these as needed.
Actively contribute to Machine Learning at Booking.com through training, exploration of new technologies, interviewing, onboarding and mentoring colleagues.
B.SKILLED
At least 3 years of relevant work experience.
Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.)
Prior experience with classification and regression algorithms and an excellent understanding of the specifics of those algorithms.  Experience with deep learning is a plus.
Solid understanding of fundamental machine learning concepts. 
Fluency in at least one programming language, with a strong preference for Python.
Strong working knowledge of Spark and SQL.
Experience with putting machine learning models in production is a plus.
Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal; the ability to convey your message to team members and other stakeholders.
B.Offered
Performance-based company that offers career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential
Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits
Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world
