Engineering Manager, Rides Apps
Not long ago, booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, to stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or to feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was complex and time consuming. Now it is simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.
 
In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.
 
Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.
 
We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
 
Booking.com core values:
 - Think customer first
 - Succeed together
 - Own It
 - Learn Forever
 - Do the Right Thing
 
Trips Business Unit (TBU):
 At Booking.com we’re working to seamlessly connect every aspect of travel, and the TBU team is one of the cornerstones of our connected trip vision. We’re dedicated to helping travelers uncover the best transport options available to them around the world. To do this we need to offer the broadest selection of bookable transport options, and effortlessly match the right options to the right person at the right time. Our goal is to offer travelers the widest choice and the best customer experience no matter what transport option they choose.
About the product:
The Rides department covers everything that’s not car rental - airport taxi, ride-hail and public transport. Within Rides the Taxi Apps team focuses on bringing the user both a Ride Hail and a Pre-book experience that allows them to quickly and seamlessly book their rides, fully integrated with the rest of their trip with booking.com.
About the role:
We are looking for a superbly enthusiastic and proactive Engineering Manager to head up our Taxi Booking Experience Apps team. You will be responsible for the day to day leadership of this team, driving the rapid and robust delivery of new features to our customers. You will be part of a self-organising agile team and will be working closely together with your product counterpart in order to deliver value to our customers and help in achieving the wider business goals. You’ll be responsible for ensuring that the team delivers the business requirements to the highest engineering standards and will be working closely together with other Engineering Managers, Architects and Principal Engineers to improve the tech stack and overall processes.  
The role of Engineering Manager is to primarily manage, coach and develop an engineering team, ensuring the development of both (the individual and team as a whole) are in line with organisational objectives and direction. Manages all activities of an engineering in scope through the direction of activities,  to design new products and modify existing designs, ensuring that deliverables are on time and with acceptable quality. The role holder is required to analyse technology trends, human resource needs, and market demand to plan projects to ensure resilience in line with current demand and future ambition. In addition to this, the role will confer with key stakeholders to determine engineering feasibility, cost effectiveness, scalability and time-to-market for new and existing products. 
 
Responsibilities:
Managing People
 - Inspire, grow and develop individuals by helping the creation of their personal development plan, leveraging available learning resources and offering stretch opportunities.
 - Manage underperformance by setting and reviewing performance objectives and KPIs, providing timely feedback and collaborating with HR counterparts.
Managing Teams
 - Get things done in the right way by taking ownership, being proactive and collaborating with business counterparts, peers, other craft managers and stakeholders.
 - Ensure delivery by tracking team health metrics and KPIs, monitoring roadmap progress, identifying blockers and resolving or escalating them.
 - Manage the team’s stakeholders by reporting progress and blockers in a clear and timely manner.
 - Plan and manage headcount by actively participating and involving own team in recruitment efforts and planning processes.
Coaching/Mentoring
 - Coach, guide and improve the overall performance of stakeholders and colleagues at all levels, when appropriate, by sharing experience, knowledge and approaches to work.
End to End System Ownership
 - Own a service end to end by actively monitoring application health and performance, setting and monitoring relevant metrics and act accordingly when violated and guide more junior members of the team in this topic.
 - Reduce business continuity risks and bus factor by applying state-of-the-art practices and tools, and writing the appropriate documentation such as runbooks and OpDocs and guide more junior members of the team in this topic.
 - Reduce risk and obtain customer feedback by using continuous delivery and experimentation frameworks and guide more junior members of the team in this topic.
 - Independently manage an application or service by working through deployment and operations in production and guide more junior members of the team in this topic.
Technical Incident Management
 - Address and resolve live production issues by mitigating the customer impact within SLA
 - Improve the overall reliability of systems by producing long term solutions through root cause analysis
 - Keep track of incidents by contributing to postmortem processes and logging live issues
Building software applications
 - Build software applications by using relevant development languages and applying knowledge of systems, services and tools appropriate for the business area and guide more junior members of the team in this topic.
 - Write readable and reusable code by applying standard patterns and using standard libraries and guide more junior members of the team in this topic.
 - Refactor and simplify code by introducing design patterns when necessary and guide more junior members of the team in this topic.
 - Ensure the quality of the application by following standard testing techniques and methods that adhere to the test strategy and guide more junior members of the team in this topic.
 - Maintain data security, integrity and quality by effectively following company standards and best practices, guiding more junior members of the team in this topic.
Architectural Guidance
 - Advise product teams towards a technical solution that meets the functional, non-functional & architectural requirements by challenging the rationale for an application design and providing context in the wider architectural landscape
 - Set a clear direction for a technical capability by evaluating and aligning the target architecture improvements, reframing architectural designs and decisions for varied stakeholder
Critical Thinking
 - Systematically identify patterns and underlying issues in complex situations, and to find solutions by applying logical and analytical thinking.
 - Constructively evaluate and develop ideas, plans and solutions by reviewing them, objectively taking into account external knowledge, initiating 'SMART' improvements and articulating their rationale.
Continuous Quality and Process Improvement
 - Identify opportunities for process, system and structural improvements (i.e performance gains) by examining and evaluating current process flows, methods and standards.  
 - Design and implement relevant improvements by defining adapted/new process flows, standards, and practices that enable business performance.
Effective Communication
 - Deliver clear, well-structured, and meaningful information to a target audience by using suitable communication mediums and language tailored to the audience
 - Achieve mutually agreeable solutions by staying adaptable, communicating ideas in clear coherent language and practising active listening
 - Ask relevant (follow-up) questions to properly engage with the speaker and really understand what they are saying, by applying listening and reflection techniques
 
Skill summary:
Solid experience in one or more technology stack based on Java, iOS or Android
Passionate about building and refining a good Agile culture and making sure that the Agile metrics are recorded and actioned on when needed
Quality first mind-set for writing code using techniques such as TDD & BDD

Great office space in central London near London Bridge and flexibility to work from home with our hybrid working approach.

Collaborate closely with multiple teams and stakeholders within an environment of trust, respect and inclusion
Clear career path with long term opportunities for growth 
All the security and potential of a company that is FTSE-100 equivalent, but with the autonomy, pace innovation of a start-up environment.
25 days paid holiday plus bank holidays, with the opportunity to buy/sell up to 3 per year.

About Booking.com
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world. 
With over 1.6 million room nights booked every day, accommodation represents the largest share of our business to date. Our mission is to deliver the best customer experience and the most varied selection of properties.
At Booking.com we combine the best traits of a start-up with the resources of planet Earth’s  #1 accommodation website. We are working towards creating the ultimate travel experience, building and improving great products for both travelers and the accommodation partners.
About the Accommodations Business Unit
We are responsible for the design & delivery of services and products to offer customers the best selection of properties and rooms. Our products & services are available on the Web, Mobile and API platforms, and span over all aspects of Booking.com accommodation business – from getting inventory from partners to displaying rooms to our customers. Our focus area is to provide customers with the best selection of properties & rooms by understanding customer intent, getting more relevant properties and rooms, and using existing inventory as effectively as possible.
B.Responsible
As a Data Scientist you’ll work within a data science team, and with stakeholders throughout the company, to generate understanding, strategy and guide key decision making based on data. You spend your time doing practical data science work to transform complex data sets into pragmatic insights which you provide through skilled story-telling.
You are expected to combine sound business understanding, data handling, programming, statistical modeling and data visualization to derive actionable information from broad sets of data while valuing pragmatism over perfection.
Important aspects of the job include:
Transform large, complex datasets into pragmatic, actionable insights
Prioritize impactful business problems, translate them into feasible data problems and solve them effectively by applying suitable statistical data analysis and modeling methods
Identify, source and organize data required for the solution and prepare it in a way that makes it fit for use
Identify key stakeholders and manage them proactively through effective communication and addressing their needs
Use data visualization skills and storytelling to drive actions from stakeholders
Design and interpret quantitative experiments to objectively guide key business decision making
Have the capacity to thrive in our fast-paced environment, adapt quickly and take ownership of your work
Challenge ideas and methods while working together with talented, highly skilled team members. 
Ensure quality of your own and others’ work, by making it reproducible and replicable and by validating through peer review
Convey complex analysis results clearly and with conviction to all levels of stakeholders
We have found that people who match the following requirements are the ones who fit us best:
Experience solving real problems using data mining techniques and with statistical rigor
Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics, machine learning and programming. Strong working knowledge of Hadoop, Spark or SQL as well as coding experience with Python and/or R
Excellent communication skills
Strong skills in translating business problems into data problems
Strong stakeholder management
Strong data visualization skills
Strong skills in storytelling with data
Strong knowledge of Statistical Methods (e.g. Hypothesis Testing, GLM, Causal Inference, Forecasting)
Strong knowledge of Statistical/Machine Learning (e.g. Dimension Reduction, Clustering, Regularization, Bagged/Boosted methods)
Strong knowledge of data management (engineering, data pipelines, workflows)
Strong knowledge of the possibilities and limitations of different types of data analysis and/or data science modeling

Summary
The Lead Designer is a critical thinker who has sought-after expertise in the principles, theories, and strategies of product design and in the related areas of creative direction, brand development, content design, visual design, and customer engagement. The Lead Designer will be adept at collaborating with marketing, product, engineering, copywriting, and research management representatives and individual contributors. 
Lead Designers leverage their knowledge and insight to challenge established practices and uncover new business value in existing products and services. They comfortably take on known and anticipated product design challenges and deftly balance design strategy, customer and partner needs, and business goals in order to provide efficient and evocative end-to-end solutions. They inspire with their vision of the future.They love connecting the dots amongst teams and initiatives and display a commitment to design excellence in their work and in their influence on others--ensuring an extraordinary level of quality and cohesion in the work we produce.
Trip Foundations Department
Join us on the Trip Foundations team, where our aim is to provide travellers everywhere with a seamless, multi-product customer experience, while delivering the best value for everything they could need for their trip. From Accommodation to Cars, Flights to Attractions, we’re building the foundations of the connected trip, working closely with teams across all verticals to create one powerful platform that is optimised for cross-selling each of our products effectively across Booking.com. When it comes to building standout experiences, we’re always raising the bar, so we can continue driving the Trip Foundations team and product in new and exciting directions.
Design Lead Responsibilities
Demonstrates advanced understanding and application of user-centered design concepts, methods, and techniques to enable and advance quality design and outcomes. Lead the creation of design initiatives and contribute hands-on when needed; develop innovative ideas and solutions based on product expertise, design thinking, and customer or partner insight.

Proactively helps others to develop, champion, and refine ideas or initiatives that solve business and/or user needs both inside and outside of their area of direct responsibility. 
Encourages and enables designers to grow their skills and impact in design theory, practice and execution (including workshops, sprints, solution ideation and implementation, experimentation and optimization, visual and product design systems). Holds the bar for quality and cohesion.
Utilizes leadership and negotiation skills to influence senior stakeholders and to provide innovative solutions. Communicates and motivates in an engaging and efficient manner. Contributes to the design community at large: cross-team people and design initiatives, recruiting, department representation. 
Requirements
8+ years’ in larger organisations with software/UX design experience in a senior/leadership role; agency and UI experience, campaign experience a plus; travel and e-commerce experience a plus.
An array of design skills and execution experience, from visual design and brand implementation to interaction design and information architecture to loyalty and engagement.
Advanced understanding and application of user-centered design concepts, methods, and techniques in service of quality design and outcomes. Leading knowledge of prototyping tools or prototyping environments, web, and native app interface engines. 
Commitment to design excellence and exceptional polish and attention to detail. Move deftly from strategy to tactical implementation and bring others along.
Ability to challenge established practices and uncover new methods and new business approaches to engagement, loyalty, and revenue.
Strong project management. Creates vision, mission, and achievable milestones for bigger, influential design or experience initiatives. Makes recommendations to leadership and stakeholders on what is possible if we use our research, talent, and time wisely.
A portfolio which demonstrates previous design experience, breadth and depth of design skills, a case study or two which illustrate challenges, methods, roles, and outcomes.
Bachelor’s or Master’s a plus.
Prefer relocation to Amsterdam.

You will also work directly with product teams to help craft the user experience for customers reaching the product from customer acquisition channels (e.g., metasearch, marketing emails, marketing push notifications). One of our Booking.com UX values is “design is a team sport.” We expect our new UX writer to embody that principle. You will join a highly collaborative team of talented designers, UX writers, and researchers committed to crafting a user-focused experience that also delivers on business objectives. You must be proactive and own your commitments.

Established in 1996 in Amsterdam, Booking.com has grown from a small Dutch start-up to the third largest e-commerce company in the world. Booking.com is the largest business within Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) and accounts for the vast majority of Booking Holdings’ total revenue. Booking Holdings is a leading Fortune 500 e-commerce conglomerate with a market cap of approximately $80 billion.
With a mission to make it easier for everyone to experience the world, Booking.com invests in digital technology that helps take the friction out of travel. Booking.com connects travellers with the world’s largest selection of incredible places to stay, including everything from apartments, vacation homes, and family-run B&Bs to 5-star luxury resorts and even tree houses. The Booking.com website and mobile apps are available in over 40 languages, offer more than +28 million total reported listings, and cover +140K destinations in +200 countries worldwide.

At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. The Horizontal Business Services department is part of the Central Tech Organisation at Booking.com. We have a team of highly skilled engineers and our mission is to build the core pieces of the e-commerce pipeline that will enable a connected trip for our customers. We are centrally linked to the customer-facing business verticals like Accommodation and Transport trips, as well as to the other horizontal functions like Customer support, Payments/Fintech, and Security.
The Order Platform
The order platform enables Booking.com to place multi-product orders in a fast, reliable, and compliant way. The platform connects with the vertical and the horizontal platforms of the business allowing them to access order data and react to order events fast and seamlessly. We allow the business to quickly check out orders, sell new products, execute and add new workflows, trigger AI and automated feedback to order events, help the customer, and generate order reports and views. We build highly available, data intensive,  and large scale Java services. We put the business, reliability, data governance, and compliance at the center of everything we do.

Job Title: Manager of Data Engineering - Partner Services Business Insights
Job Description:
Since Booking.com started facilitating bookings in 1996, the amount of data produced and consumed has increased in unimaginable proportions (~20TB/day), certainly from the perspective of our founders. 
The Partner Services organization focuses on providing the best accommodation options from our Partners for every customer. We are committed to enabling our Partners to attract and inspire our >100m active customers to stay with them. 
As a Manager of Data Engineering you will be leading a small team of Data Engineers and Analysts. Our successful candidate will be able to build a strong team, support their team with career development and connect well with our wider team to provide guidance and remove roadblocks. You will be working closely with our Partner Services business stakeholders up to the leadership team to enable us to provide them with the reliable data and tools they need when they need them. 
We are looking for a technical subject matter expert and organizational leader who drives data engineering strategies and delivery for a team, through hands-on execution and people management. Working closely with other technology and product leads, you will drive the data engineering development plan for your team and lead the capacity planning for its execution. You will guide the day-to-day activities of your team members, providing technical direction and actively contributing to the work. You lead identification of data engineering skill gaps within your team and drive development of tools, materials, and training to bridge these gaps.
B.responsible
Support the data requirements of new and existing solutions by developing scalable and extensible physical data models that can be operationalized within the company’s workflows and infrastructure
Drive efficiency and resilience by mapping data flows between systems and workflows across the company
Ensure standardization by following design patterns in line with global and local data governance requirements
Support real-time internal and customer-facing actions by developing real-time event- based streaming data pipelines and reporting
Enable rapid data-driven business decisions by developing efficient and scalable data ingestion solutions 
Drive high-value data by connecting different disparate datasets from different systems into a well-managed unified solution
Own end-to-end data and data applications by defining, monitoring and adjusting relevant SLIs and SLOs
Handle, mitigate and learn from incidents in a manner that improves the overall system health
Ensure accuracy by developing criteria, automation, and processes for data production, transport, transform, and storage
Ensure compliance with data- related requirements by building solutions in line with all applicable standards and regulations
Ensure ongoing resilience of data processes by monitoring system performance and acting proactively identifying bottlenecks, potential risks, and failure point that might degrade overall quality
Build software applications by using the relevant development languages and applying in- depth knowledge of the systems, services and tools used by the specific business area
Write readable and reusable code by applying standard patterns and using standard libraries
Continuously evolve your craft by keeping up to date with the latest developments in data engineering and related technologies, introducing them to the community and promoting their application in areas where they can generate impact
Actively contribute to Data Engineering at Booking.com through training, exploration of new technologies, interviewing, onboarding and mentoring colleagues
Push for improvements, scaling and extending data engineering tooling and infrastructure, collaborating with central teams
You are a role model of the Booking.com values:
Thrive on change and gets things done
Demand a high standard of excellence in their craft
Embrace the opportunity to improve
Understand success starts with accountability and ownership
Care more about being successful and reaching goals together than individually
Curious, experiments and continuously learns
Humble, open, friendly and remember that diversity gives us strength
B.skilled
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science or related field
6+ years of experience in a data engineering or related field using a server side programming languages, preferably Scala, Java, Python, or Perl
4+ years of experience building data pipelines and transformations at scale, with technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra, Kafka, Spark, HBase, MySQL
2+ years of experience in data modeling,
2+ years of experience handling data streaming 
Requirements of special knowledge/skills
Intermediate knowledge of data modeling methods based on best practices, e.g. TOGAF
Intermediate knowledge of data governance requirements based on best practices, e.g. DAMA, and tooling for continuous automated data governance activities
Strong knowledge of data quality requirements and implementation methodologies
Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.
B.offered
An opportunity to contribute to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real time impact of your work on millions of travelers worldwide.
Be part of a truly international fast paced environment and performance driven culture.
Various opportunities to grow technically and personally via side projects, hackathons, conferences and your involvement in the community.

Our flight business is one of the cornerstones of the connected trip. We ought to offer the best and most convenient flights to every customer, those that start their trip by buying a flight or those that are complementing their existing journey with a flight. We will do this by having the best inventory available at the most competitive prices powering a site that solves all the pain points of booking a flight today.
As a Manager Data Science Insights you will be leading a team of Data Scientists, Machine Learning Scientists, and Data Analysts. As a successful candidate you will be able to build a strong team, support the team members with career development, and connect well with the team members to provide guidance and remove roadblocks. You will be working closely with the product and tech teams in the Flights Organization, its leadership team, as well as business stakeholders within and outside of Flights to help them make decisions and drive operations based on data. Your team helps them understand and steer their ongoing product development through proving or disproving hypotheses for the business and supporting product development, using a combination of advanced statistics, experimentation, performance monitoring tools, and machine learning models. 
The Flights Data Science team covers a wide spectrum of topics. Some current examples include: models to rank the content we offer to users, alerts and predictions to help users time their purchases for their best benefit, analyses on how flights can provide incremental value to our users and our business, and development of logging and monitoring tools to understand and improve our customers’ journey. We also guide sibling teams to create and maintain the infrastructure that enables a data driven development process, by for instance informing the schema design of our data logging pipelines.

Think strategically and identify areas where data science can make significant impact on the supporting department

Play an instrumental role in evolving and designing new applications of data science to business problems
Take ownership and understand goals and objectives of supporting business partners, translating them into DS requirements and frameworks
Bring vision and strategy to improve efficiency in the way data science teams work
Drive implementation and deployment of complex projects within the scope
Work closely with the other managers and internal entities to ensure teams are always working towards what’s most important for the customers and to help the business achieve its goals.
Work closely with team members to ensure data quality, provide technical and tactical support, remove roadblocks and provide active support
Drive actions from stakeholders leveraging expertise in data visualization and storytelling skills
Articulate complex concepts in simple terms to senior stakeholders
Be the advocate of data science with their main stakeholder(s)

5+ years of relevant working experience (or 3+ years for PhD background) in the field of Data Science & Analytics
1+ years of experience managing people (or equivalent experience)
Ability to coach and mentor team members on the best tools and techniques to tackle their challenges, or guide them to experts in the area.
Ability to build a strong team within their area, designing and iterating team processes, and maintaining a healthy, collaborative and open culture.
Expert in (senior) stakeholder management 
Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics, experimentation, machine learning, data management, and programming. 
Strong working knowledge of Hadoop, Spark, SQL, Python and/or R.
Excellent communication skills
Expert in translating business problems into data problems
Strong data visualization skills and storytelling with data
Strong knowledge of the possibilities and limitations of different types of data analysis and/or data science modelling

Job Description:
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. With over 1.6 million room nights booked every day, Accommodation represents the largest share of our business to date. We are responsible for accommodation growth, with clear ownership of all marketing, product and supply related to accommodations. Our mission is to deliver the best customer experience and most varied selection of properties.
The Accommodations business unit is responsible for the design & delivery of services and products to offer customers the best selection of properties and rooms. In the Selection department, our products & services are available on the Web, Mobile and API platforms, and span over all aspects of Booking.com accommodation business – from getting inventory from partners to displaying rooms to our customers. Our focus area is to provide customers with the best selection of properties & rooms by understanding customer intent, getting more relevant properties and rooms, and using existing inventory as effectively as possible, with the support of in house solutions to help properties and their staff run and grow their business through direct and 3rd party solutions.

We are recruiting for a Senior Technical Product Manager to join us here in Amsterdam.

Marketing Messaging organisation is in charge of achieving this goal. We have a diverse group of software engineers, data scientists, designers, product managers and marketers to make all this possible.

Job Title: Senior Tech Product Manager - Marketing Messaging
Job Description:
Our Company
Founded in 1996 in Amsterdam, Booking.com has grown from a small Dutch start-up to one of the world’s leading digital travel companies. Part of Booking Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: BKNG), Booking.com’s mission is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
By investing in technology that takes the friction out of travel, Booking.com seamlessly connects millions of travelers to memorable experiences, a variety of transportation options, and incredible places to stay – from homes to hotels, and much more. As one of the world’s largest travel marketplaces for both established brands and entrepreneurs of all sizes, Booking.com enables properties around the world to reach a global audience and grow their businesses.
At Booking.com, we are all involved in making hundreds of decisions every day. The decisions we make are a reflection of our values -  they reflect what is important to us, both as individuals and as an organization. 
Booking.com was recently ranked #3 in the Financial Times’ 2021 Diversity Leaders list of European employers, and we couldn’t be more proud. It’s a great recognition for our colleagues around the world, who effortlessly work to create a welcoming and open environment in which people can connect and learn from each other. 
Marketing Messaging
Marketing Messaging is a multi-channel, ever-changing, complex and high business impact area. To achieve Booking.com’s mission, we need to bring real value to our customers with every message we send them. Messaging infrastructure and platform capabilities are foundational in achieving this mission. We have a multifunctional team of software engineers, data scientists, product managers, designers and marketers to make all this possible.
Senior Tech Product Manager - Marketing Messaging
We are searching for an experienced Senior Technology Product Manager to define the future of Marketing Messaging infrastructure and platform, integrate new communication channels, develop tools and APIs. You will work across multiple teams and departments, collect and analyse customers feedback and internal stakeholder requirements, translate business needs into technical requirements and product roadmaps. Alongside a group of product managers you will develop and support a long term engagement strategy aiming to maximise Customer Equity, increase our customer base, increase teams efficiency and their impact using platform capabilities.
This is a fantastic opportunity to make a difference in marketing messaging at Booking.com. A background in email marketing, multi-channels messaging is required. 
You are an expert in product craft with a technical focus, you get things done by prioritizing the right things, inspiring people with the vision and leading roadmap execution. You unlock the creative potential of your technical teams, motivate them to build the best for our customers. You thrive on change, challenge the status quo and lead to developing high quality products.
Responsibilities
Develop a deep understanding of infrastructure and platform, internal and external customer needs. Collect and translate requirements into a vision and roadmaps
Manage prioritization and trade-offs between product quality, operational support and speed of development
Work with developers and an architect to expose problems, identify solutions, create alignment, design and deliver infrastructure and services
Present your teams’ strategy and progress to stakeholders
Manage subscribers base hygiene, inbox placements, monitor and mitigate deliverability issues
Use external vendors’ tools to ensure messaging platform high quality and performance, manage relationships with ESPs, monitor their product updates to further improve our platform capabilities
Understand vendors product and technology landscape of marketing messaging technologies, provide assessments and recommendations on possible solutions and integrations
Gather, analyse and report on platform performance
Ensure that the appropriate solution governance, compliance and resilience is built into solutions
Solve customers and product users' pain points, collect and analyse data to identify opportunities, inform and support product direction
Define success metrics for teams, infrastructure and platform. Track them to ensure they are moving forward with our defined goals
Understand and drive product development to have zero data protection and privacy issues, e.g. GDPR, CCPA, etc.
Support and justify the chosen technical solutions and build a bridge between technical and non-technical stakeholders
Skills and Qualities
8+ years of product management experience
Strong technical background, can speak with developers the same language
Knows email marketing, push notifications and other marketing communication channels best practices & standards, e.g. subscription list hygiene, IP reputation, SPAM traps, onboarding process to new ESPs, return-path, from-address, list-unsubscribe headers, etc.
Knows customer data protection regulations
Problem-solver, can identify and analyze complex issues and develop a clear approach solving them
Entrepreneurial mindset, prioritizing for impact
Excellent communication skills, can effectively communicate with stakeholders in different roles and levels, clearly communicate strategic vision and big picture but also specific details. Great written and presentation skills
Strong organizational and project management skills, can manage multiple projects effectively. Experienced with agile methodologies
Team player, fast learner, passionate about technology and product
Ideal candidate
Has experience building CRM systems, Customer Data platforms, applying AI to increase impact and teams’ effectiveness
Has experience building, integrating marketing communications channels
Knows how to measure incremental value of customer messaging
Knows how to leverage performance marketing data to increase customer value
Has experience with analytics and machine learning capabilities
Has experience with Public Cloud, such as AWS, GCP
We offer
This role is open to worldwide candidates. We provide assistance for you and your family with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated thousands of technology professionals to Amsterdam.
Headquarters located in one of the most vibrant cities in Europe: Amsterdam
Performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential
Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits
Company-sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture
Competence advancements via online resources, trainings, on-the-job opportunities, conferences and community initiatives
Competitive compensation and benefits package
Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world
Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

Job Title: Manager Data Science Insights - Pricing - Accommodations
Job Description:
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more. Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
With over 1.6 million room nights booked every day, accommodation represents the largest share of our business to date. We are responsible for accommodation growth, with clear ownership of all marketing, product and supply related to accommodations.  Our mission is to deliver the best customer experience and most varied selection of properties.
Perfecting the right formula for competitive pricing is a high priority of the accommodation business unit. It is an interesting business challenge for the Pricing organisation to take on. Offering attractive rates and deals globally through monitoring of relevant prices in the market, creating deal events or discounting rates with Booking.com funds. The loyalty of our customers is essential to us, and to ensure this our loyal customers have access to the best prices, we have the Genius programme that is constantly fine-tuned.. This role is to focus on the areas of price intelligence and pricing-wide data initiatives.
  B.responsible
People Management
- Thinks strategically and identifies areas where data science can make a significant impact on supporting department
- Builds a strong team within their area, by coaching and developing 
- Is able to prioritize work depending on business needs and keeping stakeholders aligned at all times
- Translates data science vision and strategy into execution keeping in mind the needs and specificities of the team and the scope   
Commercial Awareness:
- Plays an instrumental role in evolving and designing new applications of data science to business problems
- Takes ownership and understands goals and objectives of supporting business partners, translating them into data science requirements/framework
Craft:
- Drives implementation and deployment of complex projects with their scope.
- Works closely with team members to ensure data quality, provide technical and tactical support, remove roadblocks and provide active support.
- Has excellent data visualisation skills and storytelling, capable of driving actions from stakeholders.
- Coaches and mentors team members on the best tools and techniques to tackle their challenges, or guides them to experts in the area.
- Knowledge and (preferably) experience on the following topics: Coding principles (R,Python, SQL...), Statistics, Experimentation, Data management (engineering, flows, logs…), financial modeling, data visualisation (dashboards, monitors...).
Communication:
- Is capable of articulating complex concepts in simple terms to stakeholders
- Is the advocate of data science with their main stakeholder (s)
- Work closely with other internal entities to ensure their teams are always working towards what’s most important for customers and to achieve high business impact.
- Ensures clear and effective communication to their stakeholders: proactively keeps all stakeholders informed of what’s happening, upcoming changes, projects, issues, etc.
B.skilled
3-5+ years relevant work experience.
At least 1 year leading a team in a growing, fast-paced environment.
Master Degree or PhD.
Track record of delivering innovative solutions in ambiguous situations.
Analytical, strategic, humble, entrepreneurial and data-driven
Comfortable interacting throughout the organisation.
Exceptional communication and presentation skills
Flexibility to accommodate change and thrive amid ambiguity
B.Offered
Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide
Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture
Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com

Job Title: Senior Technical Program Manager - Machine Learning
Job Description:
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. 
In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.
Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.
We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
  Senior Technical Program Manager - Machine Learning
  Booking’s Data and Machine Learning Platform (DMLP) is seeking a sharp, talented and energetic Senior Technical Program Manager to work with our bright ML scientists and engineers on the best-in-class ML systems. This is a highly visible role that requires substantial business acumen as well as technical depth. If you are passionate about innovation, want to have organization-wide impact, and are looking for opportunities to drive key ML-related programs from idea all the way to production, we look forward to talking to you  
Our DMLP team is responsible for building the machine learning platform and tooling that powers all inference models at Booking, such as for ranking and fraud. We use these models to power cross-sell campaigns shown on our family of products. Our machine learning platform includes the full ML Lifecycle (feature engineering, model building, productionization and monitoring). As a Senior TPM, you will work with Engineering teams to build and launch new machine learning products, improve engineering efficiencies, as well as drive scalability and reliability. In this role, you will also own delivering cross-department business cases  and define ML product investments for the company. .
As a Senior TPM, you will anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance customer and business needs versus technical constraints. An ability to take large, complex projects and break them down into manageable pieces, develop functional specifications, then deliver them in a successful and timely manner is expected. We are looking for entrepreneurial, innovative individuals who thrive on solving tough problems. Maturity, high judgment, negotiation skills, ability to influence, analytical talent and leadership are essential to success in this role.
In addition to the above, knowledge of the following is required: scrum methodologies, agile project management, release (program increment) scheduling.
B.Responsible
Be the driving force that collaborates with business and technical teams across Booking to make sure your teams deliver world class solutions that are highly scalable, secure, and flexible - all the while maintaining a strong customer focus.
Interact with project sponsors, project stakeholders and multiple business and technical teams to define and deliver complex features
Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints
Plan and manage multiple parallel projects
The ability to slice through ambiguity and drive clarity where confusion exists; leveraging technical expertise with strong business acumen
Maximize resources for the greater good of the organization, identify inefficient processes or waste and redirect resources as necessary
Identify, assess, track and mitigate issues and risks at multiple levels
Create, maintain and disseminate project information to stakeholders
Communicate project issues and status in a concise, accurate, and professional manner
Insatiable curiosity and ability to understand architectural and technical aspects of projects
Apply best practices to the software development lifecycle (SDLC) for projects based on experiences with a number of agile and blended approaches, as well effectively coordinating the implementations across teams using very different approaches
Build and maintain integrated project schedules that account for internal/external dependencies, differing SDLC approaches, numerous constraints and adequately factors in some contingency for some unplanned delays while still being aggressive.
B.Skilled
Computer Science / Engineering Bachelor’s degree or related technical field
Advanced Knowledge (5 - 8 years) relevant work experience, including technical program management experiencE
Experience in privacy, security, or compliance principles or technologies, such as sensitive data handling, retention, user data protection, privacy by design, gap analysis, DLP, anonymization
A proven track record of leading a visionary strategy to deliver global, company-wide platform services at enterprise large scales
  B.offered
This position is open to candidates worldwide, we provide visa and relocation assistance.
Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe.
We provide assistance for you and your family with a relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. 
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world-renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work
Working in a fast-paced and performance-driven culture
Career advancement via online and on-the-job training, Hackathons, conferences and active community participation
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com

In this role you will be responsible for the smooth running and administration of Research Operations (ReOps) projects, programs, and research studies. This will encompass coordination of quantitative and qualitative methods with guests, accommodation partners, and other stakeholders to drive innovation in product development at Booking.com. To do so, you will need to be able to work with Researcher stakeholders, ReOps Specialists, and Research vendors to deliver high-end Research outcomes that impact business objectives. Your work will also include the execution of ReOps programs to help improve effectiveness and efficiency of, as well as scale, research at Booking.com. You will be a highly effective project manager with skills in budget control, effective research processes, and prioritization skills.  Finally, you will be an excellent communicator who can keep all Research stakeholders informed on projects and tasks.
B.Responsible:
Collaborate within ReOps team and may collaborate across departments (i.e. Research, Marketing Insights, Legal, Procurement, etc.) to define next iterations of ReOps programs, initiatives, and solutions.
Collects, reviews, and may assist in refining research and ReOps program requirements
Manage recruitment of research participants, both guest and partner
Assist stakeholders with project budgeting
Advise Researchers on best use cases of tooling
Strong stakeholder management, internally (with researchers and product teams) and externally (with vendors, panel providers and research agencies).
Enable the smooth running and administration of research projects at Booking.com
Manage participant  incentive methods (eg. virtual and physical cards, payments etc.)
Supervision and project management of Community Research projects (eg. Partner Lounge) to facilitate easy and frequent use by the Research community
Facilitate technical support (through internal and external teams) of research technology, including lab spaces.
Provide regular feedback to Researchers and Research Operations Manager on project costs.
Organises and implements internal ReOps project plans to improve research operations and meet/exceed industry standards.
Stay up to date on research operations trends and standards to ensure study and program quality.
Collaborate with internal partners (i.e. Procurement, Legal, etc.) to develop and maintain formal vendor (incl. tooling and other professional services) relationships
Knowledge of data protection requirements of research to protect participants and our business (eg. GDPR, CCPA).
Understand, follow, and communicate operational policies, processes, and standards within ReOps and with the larger research community
Build strong collaborations with researchers to contribute to efficient and impactful research for the benefit of the business.
Help stakeholders with operational aspects of research, deferring to more proficient experts in complex scenarios.
Provide coaching/training to less experienced colleagues as required.
B.Skilled:
Strong ability to prioritize research tasks
3-5 years of experience
Stakeholder-focused, proactive approach to research operations
Demonstrated skills in project management, especially as applied to research projects
Experience supporting multidisciplinary research efforts, including--but not limited to--quantitative, qualitative, primary and secondary research
Highly organised, pragmatic and results-focused; driven to manage research projects full cycle
Able to work well independently and within a team
Good communication skills with a ”can do” attitude toward problem solving
Strong network across the research community, including those in business units
Open for input and feedback from management and stakeholders
Ability to manage projects across multiple departments and stakeholders
Strong communication skills, both written and oral
Fluent English speaker
B.Offered:
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses. We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits. This position is only open to local candidates.

Job Title: Senior Full Stack Developer - Machine Learning Platform
Job Description:
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world may feel distant right now, we are seeing a growth in domestic travel, as well as preparing for the anticipated traveling boom that is soon to return. Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission. We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. To do it more effectively we are building a platform for data scientists. Our Machine Learning Platform is behind what makes Booking able to deliver personal experiences and you will be a part of its development helping to support multiple areas of the business as they use ML to tackle some of the hardest problems that we face, from detecting fraud to recommending which properties you should check for your next stay.
This is a fantastic opportunity for a seasoned full stack developer to get involved in ML/AI. The team you will join develops both the way data scientists interact with the Machine Learning Platform and built-in facilities for them to monitor performance and quality of their work. You will have the opportunity to interact with data scientists as customers and will be involved in development all the way through the data consumed and produced by ML/AI models.
We are looking for:
Experience with one or more general-purpose programming languages like Java.
Experience with relational data storage and SQL.
Experience in front-end development with JavaScript (React or Vue.js).
Self-starters with a collaborative, “can-do” attitude and solid communication and interpersonal skills.
Passionate learners who aren’t afraid of new tools and technologies to build great end-to-end customer experience.
B.Responsible
As a Senior Full Stack Developer at Booking’s Machine Learning Platform, you are responsible for the development, performance, and scaling of our internal ML Platform website as well as internal systems for ML/AI specific monitoring. You will work independently and will also be responsible for making technical decisions within a team.
As a Senior Full Stack Developer you will:
Be part of a squad-like, multi-disciplinary team.
Be responsible for developing world-class, complete web experience, both on the backend and frontend, for monitoring and addressing performance and security, and for developing customer-focused and scalable user experiences. You will work side-by-side with machine learning engineers, product owners, designers and other developers to create new features, test your own ideas, and push changes live for data scientists as our users.
Deliver web portal and services from an idea, inception and validation to a scalable, high-performing solution in the big data environment.
Collaborate with colleagues to ideate solutions for data scientists, prioritizing based on business impact, and safely rolling them out and validating them.
Develop new user-facing products and optimize existing ones using both client-side as well as server-side languages and technologies: mainly Java, JavaScript, and Python.
Own and lead technical aspects of every project you are a part of.
Set an example for others by setting up necessary CI/CD pipelines, adding appropriate tests for your development.
Important aspects of the job include:
Take initiative to address the larger technical needs of the product you work on and always keep the customer at the center of everything you do.
Advocate for best engineering practices within the team.
Act as an intermediary for problems, with both technical and non-technical audiences.
Contribute to the growth of Booking.com through interviewing, on-boarding, and other recruitment efforts.
B.Skilled
Understanding the full stack of web development, from frontend rendering in browser to service in Kubernetes calculating necessary data. We need self-starters who are great at solving problems, who initiate discussions, are solutions-oriented, customer focused and believe that any challenge can be scaled with the right mindset and tools.
Experience working on products that impact a large user base and are in an entrepreneurial startup environment.
Experience with TDD.
Quick delivery of end-to-end solutions to validate ideas and iterating on those ideas to produce quality products.
A minimum of 5 years of experience with one or more general purpose programming languages, including but not limited to: Java, Javascript (Node.js), Python, C#, C++.
Must have experience in modern web development with React/Vue.
Experience with full cycle development: design, develop, test, deploy, operate, and support.
Proficiency with Git, GitLab CI and remote debugging of applications.
Practical experience with containerized application deployment systems, particularly Kubernetes and Docker.
Demonstrable experience with Relational databases (e.g. MySQL).
Demonstrable experience with NoSQL databases (e.g. ElasticSearch).
Demonstrable experience with distributed event platforms (e.g. Kafka) is a plus.
Proven experience in owning and leading technical projects.
Interested in applications of statistics and machine learning. Experience with BigData or ML systems is a significant plus (Hadoop, Flink, Argo).
Preferably a university degree in Mathematics or Software Engineering.
Excellent communication: written and spoken (with English as the main language across the organization).
B.Offered
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide.
Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture.
Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit.
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions.
Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation.
Competitive compensation and benefits package.
Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.
We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. We offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits. We have tech talks, trainings and we support you attending and speaking at global conferences.
This position is open to worldwide candidates and, in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We successfully relocate hundreds of IT professionals and their families to Amsterdam every year. Join us!

As a Senior Technology leader, you are accountable for the overall technology architecture and strategy across the Accommodations Technology estate and leading a team of Architects and Technology Fellows in a department of self steering teams who develop products and constantly innovate to delight our customers.
Our vision is to empower people to experience the world. Wherever our customers go and whatever they do, they book it with us.
With over 1.5 million room nights booked every day in our 1.5 million + accommodations worldwide, our daily mission is to make travel, experience and exploration accessible for everyone, everywhere. As our business is constantly growing, we are looking for a senior leader  to join our team, impact our users on a daily basis and take our product and technology to the next level.
We hire the best and the brightest professionals, and we empower them to innovate, your focus will be on:
Business & Solution architecture and design across systems, services and products within accommodations and partnering with architectures across other BUs
Building and leading a team of our most senior technical experts who are in the implementation detail
Partnership with Booking.com wide technology councils and boards
Supporting craft excellence
In your role you will be leading the mid to long term strategic technology narrative and architecture to ensure it is setting our business up for success. You will partner with Technology and Product Leaders across the business to align our architecture roadmap and technology strategy. 
You must hold your own in a technical argument, but you know getting out of the way is often the best option. You get things done via influence not authority. You unlock the creativity of your team and inspire them to build the best for our customers. 
As a Senior Leader you take full end to end responsibility for your area.
B. Responsible
People & Function Leadership 
Lead, inspire and motivate your team function through leading by example
Take accountability for yourself and others by setting expectations around what success looks like, giving ownership and providing clarity when necessary
Create a learning environment by coaching, two-way feedback, helping people extract and share personal learnings, and support teams to constantly adapt
Fostering a great engineering culture who innovate, work as a team and celebrate success 
Foster inclusion by holding self and others accountable and drive people centric initiatives that enable workforce diversity
Be curious, learn, iterate and shape our culture 
Create a positive working environment where people can be candid, work towards shared goals, and align to share information across teams and functions
Build a world class Engineering team  
Technology & Architecture Leadership 
Own and enterprise architecture for accommodations 
Able to knit together enterprise architecture for within Accommodations by connecting the initiatives and technology strategic to the business priorities to maintain strategic alignment
Engrain solution excellence and quality through robust and resilient architectures
Strong thought partner to the Senior Technology and Product leadership mapping out our long term technology vision, strategy and roadmap
Aligning the technology strategy and architecture landscape to other business units
Strong focus on simplify our architecture
Influence of Senior stakeholders across Product, Technology and other business units
Communicate strategy in a compelling manner to multiple teams and relevant stakeholders, and create long-term plans that align with the overall focus of the business
Partner and Influence senior stakeholders across the Accommodations and the broader business to set and align the strategic direction of your function
Strategic thought partner to Product, Tech Directors, your colleagues and the wider Business 
Anticipate the need for changes based on context, and set renewed courses of action to engage teams and achieve goals, while striving to make the impact clear and understandable
B.Skilled
Strong leadership and direction on the technology landscape and architecture within Accommodations
Be able to lead a team of Architects and Fellows within Accommodations
Inspire the technology community with the technology vision and strategy
Expert knowledge and significant experience in Software and Solution architecture 
Highly proficient in domain based technology strategies
Highly proficient in platform and platform of platform architecture patterns
Strong understanding of digital technology space including mobile, web and distribution stacks
Strong understanding of cloud technologies and emerging technologies
Strong understanding of NFRs and building resilience

Demonstrate deep business acumen and technical expertise

B.Offered
This position is open to candidates worldwide and when hired we provide Visa and Relocation assistance.
Technology is the core of our business and we ensure that we give the best ‘deal’ possible, to our employees. Here is what you get:
Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
